loans.name: Lofi

texts.en:
Lofi is 38 years of age and married with 4 children

Lofi owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  She has 4 years of experience in this business. Lofi needs a loan of WST $2700 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve and expand her business.

Lofi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lofi's 4th loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  "

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es: La señora Otilia a sus 49 años de edad es madre de cuatro hijos por los cuales tiene que velar sola puesto que su esposo murió hace poco. Con el ánimo de generar ingresos para sostener a su familia, la señora Otilia desea emprender su propio negocio de venta de ropa informal para dama y caballero desde su casa. La señora Otilia requiere de la compra surtido para iniciar a trabajar y así poder generar los ingresos para su hogar. El sueño de la señora Otilia es tener su propio almacén y mejorar el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Otilia is a 49-year-old mother of four children for whom she has to care for alone since her husband recently died.  With the aim to generate income to support her family, Mrs. Otilia wants to start her own business selling casual clothes for men and women from her home. Mrs. Otilia needs to purchase an assortment of clothing to start to work and thus to generate income for her home. Mrs. Otilia's dream is to have her own store and improve the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase an assortment of clothing in order to start her business.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Adjo est une femme âgée de 33 ans. Elle est mariée å un conducteur de taxi moto. Elle a 1 enfant de 2 ans qui ne va pas encore à l’école.
Adjo travaille comme coiffeuse depuis 2007. Elle coiffe, vend des crèmes défrisant et des mèches pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’as pas de difficultés.
Adjo a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches et des défrisant. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Adjo voudrait agrandir l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adjo is a 33-year-old woman. She is married to a motorcycle taxi driver. She has a 2-year-old child who doesn't go to school yet.

Adjo has been working as a hairdresser since 2007. She does hair, sells hair relaxer creams and hair extensions for all types of clients in her shop. She buys her products in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, she has no difficulties.

Adjo has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy hair extensions and hair relaxers. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Adjo would like to expand her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and hair relaxers.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo es de la ciudad de Pilar, el es motosierrista y nos cuenta que se dedica a està actividad hace más de 8 años, el nos comenta que tiene movilidad propia, lo que lo ayuda a poder cumplir con el trabajo que hace.
Leonardo es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, tiene muchas ganas de sobresalir y ayudar a su familia, es por ello que se esfuerza mucho, y de esa forma poder tener los ingresos necesarios para hacerlo. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y de esa forma poder tener más clientes.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de una maquina para podar plantas, con lo cual podrá ser más fácil para el poder cumplir con sus trabajos. Agradece por esta oportunidad de progreso que recibe por parte de kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Leonardo is from the city of Pilar. He is a chainsaw operator, and he tells us that he’s been doing this work for more than 8 years. He has his own transportation which helps him be able to complete the work he has. 

Leonardo is a very hard working and enterprising person. He has a great desire to excel and to help his family. It’s for that reason that he works so hard and is able to earn the income he needs to do so. His dream is to her able to continue growing his business and then be able to get more clients. 

He’s asking for a loan for the purchase of a machine to prune plants with which it’ll be easier to perform his work. He is thankful for the opportunity to progress that he’s received from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy a pruning machine.

loans.name: Las Dalcas Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Las Dalcas” está conformado por 23 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran la venta de queso, juguetes, verduras, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Puerto Montt. 
Juan integrante del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila de pié, ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una chaqueta sin mangas color negro.
El se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente atiende un mini market, en el cual vende verduras, frutas, mariscos, bebidas, entre otros productos. 
Se desempeña en este negocio desde hace 6 años junto a una de sus hijas.
Trabaja de lunes a domingo de 6ºº de la mañana hasta las 20ºº hrs de la tarde.
Comenta que su local está ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, por lo que tiene bastante clientela. Sobre todo en ésta temporada de verano.
Su mercadería la compra a agricultores en el campo, lo cual le es más conveniente monetariamente.
Con el crédito comprará verduras, específicamente papas al por mayor.
Sus metas son crecer en su negocio, para esto seguir abasteciéndolo con mercadería y obtener mejores ingresos.
Juan vive junto a su esposa y actualmente también con sus 2 hijas de 30 y 20 años de edad quienes le ayudan con el negocio de la marisquería (negocio familiar dedicado a la venta de ostras).sus sueños a nivel personal son brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, más confortable.
El está muy contento y agradecido de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio.
Comenta además, que ha aprendido con las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones del Banco comunal.
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
This community bank is called “Las Dalcas” and has 23 members.  They all work in different fields including cheese sales, toy sales, vegetable sales, etc.  They all live in the city of Puerto Montt.

Juan is a member of this community bank.  In the photo, he is standing in the second row, on the far left, wearing a black sleeveless jacket.

Juan works in sales.  He works in a mini-mart and sells fruit, vegetables, seafood, drinks and other products.  He has been working in this business for 6 years together with one of his daughters.  He works from Monday to Sunday, from 6.00am to 8.00pm.

Juan says that his business premises are located in the city center and he has a lot of customers, especially during this summer season.  He buys his merchandise from local farmers which is most convenient for him.  He will use his loan to buy vegetables, specifically potatoes, wholesale.

Juan's goal is to grow his business.  For this reason, he will continue stocking it with merchandise and continue making better income.  

Juan lives together with his wife and his two daughters who are 30 and 20 years old.  His daughters help him with his seafood business (a family business which is aimed at selling oysters).  Juan's personal dreams are to provide his family with a better quality of life and more comforts.

Juan is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza are giving him as it helps him to invest in his business.  He says that he has learned from the training sessions that he receives as a member of his community bank.

Puerto Montt is a city in the south of Chile.  It is located in Los Lagos region.  Some of Puerto Montt's attractions are its beautiful green landscapes, its quiet beaches, its rich cuisine and the reputation of its fish, seafood and handicrafts.  It is also one of the main ports of entry to Isla Grande de Chiloé which is rich in traditions and legends.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, especially potatoes, wholesale

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 32 years old. She is married to Peter and together they have two children. She operates a cyber and has been in the business for the past two years. She gets a monthly income of KES 12,500 from the business.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD . She will use the loan to purchase a computer for her business. She was introduced to KADET LTD  by a KADET client.Her dream is to own rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase a computer

loans.name: Benkadi  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi  4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Bougoura, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : le riz et l’arachide  avec DJELIKA,  3 eme  assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles  et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 187.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Benkadi 4" are married women averaging 45 years of age and five children each all living in traditional families in Bougoura, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crops grown are rice and peanuts, as is the case with DJELIKA, the third one seated from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs, some seeds, and sundry farm equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 1.25 hectares.

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of men and women. 

She expects to make an average profit of 187,500 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy farm inputs, sundry equipment, and some seeds

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with seven children. She takes care of additional family members. She sales used clothes at the market on retail and whole sale basis for several years. She works seven days a week. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She has requested for a loan from MCDT- SACCO  bales of used clothes . Her challenges include seasonality of used clothes. Her dream is to open up another stall in the market for used clothes. She resides in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include utilities and food.

loans.use: To buy  bales of used clothes

loans.name: Necil

texts.en:
Necil is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Necil is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.

Necil has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Necil requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Necil has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Necil would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Olvin Ernesto

texts.en:
I have been working as a barber for 8 years in the community Chichicaste in El Paraiso. I have had much sucess, helped by the fact that there are not many barbers in our community. The earnings I recieve have helped me to build my home and have helped provide food, clothing and resources for schooling and health for my three children.

Loan Use: To buy scissors, razors, powders, mirrors, combs, shampoos

Tengo 8 años de dedicarme a cortar pelo aca en mi comunidad llamada el Chichicaste en El Paraiso, me ha ido muy bien ya que en nuestra comunidad no hay muchos barberos. Los ingresos que percibo por mis trabajos, me han ayudado a poder construir mi casa y ayudar a mis tres hijos con su alimentacion, vestuario, estudios y su salud.

loans.use: Compra de tijeras, rasuradoras, talcos, espejos, peines, shampoo.

loans.name: Gilbert Neba

texts.en:
Gilbert is the father of six children and two grandchildren from his oldest daughter. As he struggles to deal with the bitter truth of missing and incarcerated sons, Gilbert is determined to maximize his acquired skills. From his three previous loans he provided manure for farmers and carpentry services such as repairing broken windows, changing door locks, and constructing chairs for community members.

Given a loan of $600, he plans to buy planks, nails, and zinc to expand his piggery, and vegetable seeds to cultivate. He will provide manure and meat and employment for young kids who will supply grass for his pigs. His business will keep his children and other young kids out of crime.

Gilbert is capable of handling the loan money and repaying it without problems. He plans to pay his loan in 18 months. The first repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Animal (pigs and fowl) and food crop cultivation

loans.name: Rafail

texts.en: Rafail is a Displaced Person from the occupied Agdam district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. He is married, and has four children. He started his business in 1994, and borrowed seven Normicro loans from Baku branch totaling $5250. Now he is willing to borrow $1200 to increase his variety of goods.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Flora Verónica

texts.en:
Flora is a single and entrepreneurial woman. She studied beauty culture, and for this reason she wanted to start her own business and apply everything she learned. Also she lost her parents and she had to support her young brother, and she knew that if she was working as an employee in a beauty salon she could not obtain enough money to cover their expenses, because she was working before in a beauty salon to save money and also gain experience. In 2002 she started her own business at home and until today her business is going very well, but presently she is saving her income to purchase or rent a better location in order to improve her service to her clients.

Flora is requesting for a loan of US $ 375 to purchase merchandise that she will use in her business and also let her offer a better service to her clients. She offers to repay this loan in 4 months. She appreciates very much your support in establishing her business in a location that will offer better service to her customers.

Translated from the original text in Spanish.

Flora es una mujer soltera y emprendedora, ella estudió cultura de belleza, por lo que quiso poner su propio negocio y aplicar lo que había estudiado, además ella quedo sin padres y tuvo que ver por su hermano y mantenerlo, y si trabajaba como una empleada de una estética no le iba a rendir para poder mantenerse a ambos, ella lo sabía por que ya había trabajado como empleada para ahorrar y para obtener experiencia. Fue en el año 2002 que empezó con su negocio propio en su casa y hasta la fecha le ha ido muy bien, pero actualmente esta ahorrando para poder tener un local establecido por que es mejor que atender a sus clientes en su casa.

Flora esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 375 para poder comprar mercadería que usará en su estética que le permitan dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 4 meses, ella te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das para poder tener su negocio de manera establecida en un local que pueda dar mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en: Kadie M. is married with three children.  Her husband is a taxi driver and his income can only provide the family with a bag of rice, said Kadie.  Kadie sells smoked fish in the town of Magburaka.  Her previous loan enabled her  to have her own capital since she had to pay the installments on a monthly basis.  "I am able to make a profit and feed my children twice a day," said Kadie.  She is requesting another loan of $175 to increase her stock and have more time to attend to the business and her children.

loans.use: Increase her fish stock for selling in the village

loans.name: Nasareta

texts.en: Nasareta, 42 is a married mother of six. She runs a retail store in front of her house, serving people of her village.  She works from dawn unti dusk every day.  Her husband is one of the government’s school teachers.  She is requesting a loan to purchase additional inventory so she can earn more income for her family.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Liciola Del Carmen

texts.es:
Luciola belongs to the Las Riojanitas ("The Rioja Girls") community bank. Her business is located in her house in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin. She sells "maduritos asados" (aged meats) filled with cheese and mani (made from platanos). She also sells beauty products. Because of her physical disability, she can't easily go out so her customers come to her.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,000 (1,000 Peruvian soles or about US$335), to be repaid in 6 installments, Luciola will buy ingredients for making "maduritos asados" like mani (10 kg., cheese (10 kg) and 5 bunches of platanos. She will also buy beauty products so that she has them in stock for her customers.

Luciola, 50, is married and has 2 grown children with families of their own. She's proud of the work that she's doggedly pursued because her customers are happy. Furthermore, she's proud of being a strong example of determination and perserverance.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Luciola pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Riojanitas, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su casa, en el Jr. Amagura 1128 del distrito de Rioja, provincia de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Ella se dedica a la venta de maduritos asados rellenos con queso y maní (elaborado a base de plátanos), además de vender productos de belleza, ya que por su discapacidad física n puede movilizarse mucho a otros lugares y son los clientes la que la visitan.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000.00 ($ 335.00), el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará materia prima para la elaboración de maduritos asados como por ejemplo: maní (10 kg.), queso (10 kg.), 05 racimos de plátano maduro. Además comprará productos de belleza para tener en stock cuando su clientela la visite.

Ella está casada, tiene 50 años y tiene 02 hijos, mayores de edad que tiene ya su familia conformada, se siente muy orgullosa del trabajo que desempeña porque su clientela se siente satisfecha, además de ser un claro ejemplo de lucha y perseverancia.

loans.use: Compra de insumos.  Compra de productos de belleza.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia is 56 years old, living with her partner Pablo who is 52 years old. They have 4 children (all adults now).

Eugenia runs a grocery store, while Paul works as a driver for a business that sells bricks.

Eugenia began her business 10 years ago when she decided to stop making & selling chipas (typical Paraguayan meal made out of starch), because it was affecting her health.

Today she has a good assortment of products and a good clientele.

She says that thanks to the revenue generated by their small business, in addition to the profits that Pablo makes with his work, they have managed to raise their 4 children, who have become professionals.

She is now requesting a loan to supplement her inventory so she can get ready for the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Eugenia tiene 56 años, vive en pareja con Pablo que tiene 52 años de edad. Tienen 4 hijos, todos ya mayores de edad.

Eugenia posee una despensa mientras que Pablo trabaja como chofer para un negocio de venta de ladrillos.

Eugenia comenzó con su negocio hace 10 años cuando decidió dejar la elaboración y venta de chipas (comida típica paraguaya hecha a base de almidón) debido a que dicha actividad afectaba su salud.

Hoy día cuenta con un negocio bien surtido y con una clientela bien formada.

Afirma que gracias a los ingresos que genera su pequeño negocio, además de las ganancias que Pablo obtiene en su trabajo, ha logrado criar a sus 4 hijos quienes hoy se han convertido en profesionales.

Solicita el crédito para surtir mejor su negocio debido a que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, flour, rice, noodles, soft drinks, juices, fruits, vegetables, canned goods, and sweet breads, etc. (compra de azúcar, harina, arroz, fideo, gaseosas, jugos, frutas, vegetales, productos enlatados, pan dulces, etc.)

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 40 year-old Mwajuma S.. She is married with six children, aged 4, 11, 15, 17, 21, and 23, and has two other dependents, who are her niece and nephew. Mwajuma runs a clothing business, and requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her range of clothing.

loans.name: Suamah

texts.en: Suamah, 30, is married but her husband N. does not have a regular job or a steady income. So she helps support their family by selling snacks such as noodles and instant beverages at her food stall. She earns $5 a day from her business, and brings home a small profit. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $125 to expand her business. She agrees to repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand a food stall

loans.name: Ginelba

texts.es:
Mrs. Ginelba M. has 2 children and lives with her husband in her parents’ home on Beni street, in the Challapampa zone of the city of La Paz. Her husband works as a driver while she sells Avon beauty products for a living. She used to sell CD’s (music and movies), but because that business did not generate enough profits, she changed her line of work. She now makes a good profit selling cosmetics.

The loan she is requesting will allow her to stock up on more merchandise due to the fact that her customers demand a wider selection of products.

Because Mrs. M. has a good credit history, she can request a new loan. She has been a member of Impro since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ginelba tiene dos niños y vive con su esposo en la casa de sus padres en la calle Beni de la zona de Challapampa (ciudad de La Paz); el esposo trabaja como chofer y ella se dedica a la venta de productos de la marca Avon (productos de belleza para la mujer). Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de CDs (música y películas), ya que dicho negocio no generaba ingresos suficientes cambió de actividad. Ahora obtiene buenas ganancias por la venta de cosméticos.

El crédito solicitado le permitirá abastecerse de mayor mercadería debido a las exigencias de sus clientes que demandan mayor variedad en la oferta.

La señora tiene buenos antecedentes por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Ella es cliente de Impro desde el año 2006.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Effia

texts.en:
Effia B. is married and has six dependents. She prepares palm oil for sale. She wants to buy more raw materials to increase production.

She is asking for $325.00 as additional capital to enable her buy more raw materials for oil production and sale.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more raw materials for palm oil production and sale

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience A. is 38 years old and a divorced mother with two children. Her children are currently in school. She sells used clothes in the local market to make some income to take of the children. Prices of goods are going up and therefore she wants to use her loan to buy more bales of used clothes to increase both her inventory and her income to support the children’s education.

Patience is a member of the group called “Kamfo Yehowa” meaning Praise Jehovah. Members agree to guarantee one another to help with loan repayment.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Latifatou

texts.fr:
Born around 1974 in Cotonou in Littoral County in the south of Benin, Mrs. Latifatou A. comes from Sakété in Ouémé County. Married to Laïla Djibril, she is the mother of two children: Andillath (11) in sixth grade and Akim (8) in third grade. She has a shop where she sells a variety of products, among them cosmetics. Presently faced with financial difficulties, she is requesting her second loan so that she can cater for the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1974 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral au sud du Bénin, dame A. Latifatou est originaire de Sakété dans le département de l'Ouémé. Elle est mariée à DJIBRIL Laïla et est mère de deux enfants dont Andillath âgée de 11 ans est en classe de Sixième et Akim âgé de 8 ans est classe de CE1. Elle dispose d'une boutique de vente de divers produits et des produits cosmétiques. Confrontée actuellement à des difficultés financières, elle sollicite son deuxième crédit pour répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 cases of liquor, 5 cases of ointment, and 8 cases of hair-straightening products

Achat de 10 cartons de liqueur,de 5 cartons de pommade et de 8 cartons de produits de défrisage des cheveux.

loans.name: Bladimir Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Bladimir Antonio M. is 33 years old, married, and has one daughter. His daughter is 6 years old, and is in the first grade. Bladimir works in welding and soldering and his wife works for ARNECOM. In addition to their day jobs, the couple also has their own clothing business. This business serves as a means of increasing their household income, and they've been operating it for 4 years. Bladimir is asking for 9800 Cordobas, which he'll use to buy pants, shirts, and underwear in Managua twice a month, depending on sales. He and his wife will then bring the clothing to sell to colleagues, neighbors, and friends in Leon.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Bladimir Antonio M., tiene 33 años de edad, es casado, tiene una hija de 6 años, que actualemnte cursa el primer grado, su esposa trabaja en ARNECOM, es en solicitar un financiamiento por la suma de C$ 9800.00 córdobas para adquirir ropa actividad que lleva a cabo en conjunto con su esposa ya que donde labora tambien tiene la oportunidad de ofertarle a sus compañeros de trabajo, al igual que el señor M. ya que tambien trabaja en un taller de torno y soldadura. Dicha actividad economica la desempeña como una alternativa para poder incrementar los ingresos del hogar, desarrollandola de forma ambulante teniendo 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. El financiamiento será utilizado para comprar mas ropa como pantalones, camisas y ropa interior, llevando a cabo sus compras en managua dos veces al mes dependiendo de sus recuperaciones, sus ventas las realiza de contado y credito que recupera a los quince dias o al mes. Sus principales clientes son sus compañeros de trabajo, y perosnas del sector aledaños a su domicilio

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nura

texts.en: Nura was born in 1963, and she lives in the village of Snagovo, near the town Zvornik. She is a widow, and she works in agriculture and cattle breeding to make a living. This is not Nura’s first loan, and she is asking for 1000 KM to buy wheat and oat seeds for spring sowing. She also wants to purchase compost so that she may clean and prepare her land over the winter.

loans.use: To buy compost and seeds to prepare and plant her fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Invest in jewelry to increase income and improve the standard of living

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa nació en la Parcialidad de Alintuyo, tiene 37 años de edad, estudió sexto grado de primaria, es casada y progenitora de 04 hijos (02 varones de 07 años y 06 meses y 02 mujeres de 17 y 04 años de edad). Vive en la Parcialidad de Tojocachi, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno.

Desde hace un año integra el Banco Comunal “24 de Junio” en Alintuyo. Con su crédito inicial de S/. 300 compró lana de alpaca a un valor de S/. 30, 02 bolsitas de perlitas a S/.18 para hacer trencillas, 01 ovino con S/.180 para engorde. Doña Rosa quedó huérfana de madre a los 14 años de edad, ella asumió la responsabilidad de cuidar a sus hermanos menores porque su padre se dedicó a beber licor y ahora su padre se encuentra enfermo (inválido). Desde los 12 años de edad empezó a elaborar trencillas de lana de alpaca, a los 18 años formó su hogar y en la actualidad se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno y ovino y a su vez sigue con el negocio de trencillas que vende semanalmente el la ciudad de Ilave de 06 y 10 trencillas, también vende pan desde el año pasado.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, tiene  planificado comprar 01 vacuno para su engorde y posterior venta.

Su sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave para que sus hijos estudien en esa ciudad y no estén en el campo.
texts.en:
Rosa was born in the Alintuyo neighborhood, is 37 years old, studied up to 6th grade, is married and is the mother of 4 children (2 boys who are 7 years and 6 months and 2 girls who are 17 and 4 years of age). She lives in the Tojocachi neighborhood of the Ilave district in the province of El Collao, Puno. For the past year she has been a member of the "24 de Junio" Communal Bank in Alintuyo. With her first loan of S/. 300 years she purchased alpaca wool at a cost of S/. 30, 2 little bags of pearl beads at S/.18 to make little braids, and one sheep for S/.180 to be fattened. Rosa lost her mother when she was 14 years old and she assumed the responsibility of caring for her younger siblings because her father drank liquor and now her father is sick (disabled). From the age of 12 she started to make little braids from alpaca wool, at 18 years old she formed her own household and at the present time she works fattening cattle and sheep and at the same time continues with the braid business for which she sells 6 to 10 weekly in the city of Ilave. She has also sold bread since last year. With this loan of S/.1,000, which will be paid off in 3 installments, she plans to buy one cows to fatten and later sell. Her dream is to buy a house in the city of Ilave so that her children study in the city and are not in the countryside.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 45 años esta divorciada de su pareja y vive con su hija Jazmín de 9 años de edad. Nelly se dedica a la venta de ropa interior femenina,(lencería), desde hace 25 años tiempo en el cual ha recavado mucha experiencia para abrirse campo en este rubro. Nelly suele empezar su trabajo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 o 6 de la noche realizando la venta de forma ambulatoria. La venta es buena ya que Nelly se esfuerza por adquirir mercadería novedosa y de buena calidad para ofrecer a su clientela, siendo lo más difícil el viaje para conseguir la mercadería. Es su primer préstamo en Micro finanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero del préstamo viajara a otras ciudades a adquirir mayor mercadería y así espera aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Nelly is 45 years old. She is divorced from her husband and lives with her daughter Jazmín, who is 9 years old. Nelly has been selling lingerie for 25 years, time during which she has gotten a lot of experience so that she can make headway in this field. Nelly usually begins work at 8 in the morning until 5 or 6 at night, working as a street vendor. Sales are good and Nelly works hard to obtain new and interesting merchandise of good quality to offer to her customers. The most difficult part is traveling to get the merchandise. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very punctual in her payments. With the money from the loan she will travel to other cities to obtain more merchandise and thereby increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover expenses for traveling to the city and buying more merchandise.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok N., 30, is married and lives with one child and her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She stays at home doing housework and raises fish to earn a living and is able to make around $2 each day. Her husband is a local teacher, making $5 a day.

Sok N. would like to take out a loan of $600 to build a basin in which she can breed fish.

loans.use: Build basin to breed fish.

loans.name: Rossana

texts.en:
Rossana V. P. lives in the bustling, jungle city Pucallpa, Peru. It is the regional capital of the tropical Amazonian department of Ucayali which is characterized by the meandering Ucayali River that flows north, meeting up with Amazon and, eventually, the Atlantic Ocean. Fifty years ago, Pucallpa was a tiny caserío or hamlet; but everything changed when the only paved highway leading into the Amazon region was built and Pucallpa became the gateway to the jungle at the roads’ end. Since the mid-20th century, the city has sprung up and engulfed the surrounding caserios. Today the city is a bustling, hot metropolis with immigrants from all over Peru.

Rossana has worked with the Ucayali branch of Manuela Ramos for over five years. She is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras, or Women Entrepreneurs, communal bank with several of her relatives. Rossana first took out loans of 300 Nuevo Soles – the minimum allowed by Manuela Ramos; but as she has grown her business, Rossana has borrowed larger and larger sums.

Rossana is now requesting 1,500 Nuevo Soles to support her small restaurant. She will repay her debts within six months. Rossana is planning to purchase tables, chairs, a refrigerator, tablecloths and also rice in bulk with her loan. She is pictured in the photograph above preparing a midday day meal in her kitchen.

loans.use: Rossana would like to buy tables, chairs, a refrigerator and tablecloths and also rice in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Unidas Por Fe Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo solidario Unidas por fe, originarias de la comarca El Valle de La Laguna, está compuesto por tres integrantes que son:   Justa Pastora S., Guillermina I. R. y Digna Marina H.. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras conocidas por su actividad en su comarca.
Doña Justa Pastora S. de 47 años de edad, soltera, madre de tres hijos, actualmente vive con una hija que le ayuda en el negocio y los quehaceres del hogar.
Ella se dedica a la venta de escobas y especias como canela, achiote, manzanilla, etc, vende en los mercados de Masaya y Granada de forma ambulante, tiene 20 años de dedicarse a esta actividad pues la aprendido de su madre.
El crédito lo necesita  para comprar especias que las compra en Managua y las escobas la compra en la comunidad a mujeres que hacen escobas de trigo elaboradas a mano.
Espera poder comprar al por mayor y empacar especias con una marca de su nombre, para esto se compromete a pagar bien sus cuotas y ejercer solidaridad en su grupo y hacer uso de los financiamientos en comprar una selladora de empaque de bolsas plásticas.
texts.en:
This is the solidary group United Through Faith. They are from the area of El Valle de La Laguna. The group includes three members: Justa Pastora S., Guillermina I. R., and Digna Marina H.. They are very hard-working women who are known in their areas for their activities. Mrs. Justa Pastora S. is 47 years old, is single, is the mother of three children, and at present, she lives with one of her daughters, who helps her in the business and with the household chores. She sells brooms and spices, like cinnamon, annatto seeds, chamomile, etc. She sells these items by walking through the markets in Masaya and Granada. She learned this business from her mother and has been pursuing this activity for 20 years. She needs this loan to buy spices from Managua. She buys brooms from a community of women who make the brooms by hand from wheat. She hopes to be able to buy at wholesale and pack the spices with her own brand. Because of this, she is committed to pay her installments on time and have solidarity with her group. She will also use the financing to buy a pack of sealing plastic bags.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for work and to offer more producers to their clients

loans.name: Som

texts.en: M., 47, is a widower. He earns a living by raising pigs, which he sells when they mature. He currently lives with his daughter who is a garment worker at a garment factory in Phnom Penh City. M. wants his daughter to stop her work at the garment factory, so he want to provide her with a grocery store to run. Therefore, M. is asking for a $1000 loan for his daughter to use as capital to begin a grocery store. (He and his daughter are pictured.)

loans.use: To start a grocery store

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet D. is thirty-three years old. She is married and has two daughters and a son, who are all currently in the basic school. She lives with her family at Kwahu Da in the Eastern region of Ghana. Janet’s husband is food crop farmer. Janet runs a grocery store to help provide for the family. She has been in business for three years. She sells items such as tins of milo, milk, sugar, bread, canned fish, etc. Janet buys her goods from wholesalers in the big cities nearby, such as Kumasi. 

She seeks a loan to expand the size of her store and also to buy goods in bulk. She hopes to increase her profit margin, which will enable her save more for her family, especially for her children’s education. She belongs to a trust bank group called Heaven. Members in this group guarantee for one another, as social collateral, in order to access loans and to support one another in handling the repayment of loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
A PDP-LP Micro-finance member of PMPC, Elene S., of legal age , resides at Magsaysay Sibutad, ZN. She has two children and is married to Francisco S., a farmer. Mrs. S. owns and manages her business, full of hope that it will grow big in the future.

She has accessed a loan amounting to Php 5,000 for the purchase of additional stock such as canned goods, dried fish, noodles, and other related food items.

She aspires to be healthy always so she can pursue her dreams of becoming one of the big business owners in the future so as to be able to gain enough earnings for her family, especially for their retirement phase.

loans.use: Buy canned goods, dried fish, spices, noodles, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 39-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Hussein owns a photography studio. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase tools for his studio. This is the first time that Hussein has requested a loan.

Hussein is special in his work because he does nice pictures and knows how to suit his clients. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his work, he didn’t face difficulty. Hussein decided to do his work because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Hussein will use the loan to purchase tools for his studio.

loans.name: Konul

texts.en: Konul was born in 1969, and is married. This young woman lives in Baku city. Four years ago she started her beauty salon business. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the necessary things for improving her beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy the necessary things for improving her beauty salon.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina B. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 24 years old. Cristina is married and has three small children. To make a living, Cristina owns and operates a business venture operating a "sari-sari" or general store. She sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Cristina is just starting out in this business.

In 2008, Cristina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari-sari" store. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Cristina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marey Group

texts.en:
Marey is the group leader of Marey's group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses to purchase more materials and earn good incomes for their families in the future. 

Marey wants a loan for her husband's general store. Maryam wants a loan for her father's tinsmith business to expand his shop and make it larger. Rakhsar wants a loan for her brother’s stationery business; he wants to buy necessary materials for his business.

With this loan, they can grow their businesses and support their families and make a better future for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: To grow their businesses

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian C. is from the town of Jimenez. She is 59 years old. Vivian is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Vivian owns & operates a transport business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing jeepney transport services to local community members. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 30000, Vivian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business & registration renewal. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Vivian from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle & renew registration

loans.name: Rezyl

texts.en:
Twenty-three-year-old Rezyl C. is soaring high in her rice farming business. She started by renting a small farm from a relative. Since then, she has started helping her husband, Jess C., especially in tilling and preparing the soil. Now she owns the farm and, because she has three children, she works double-time to have an abundant harvest to support her family.

Knowing about the services of Community Economic Ventures Inc., she is applying for a loan of Php 12,000 to help buy the needed fertilizers and chemicals for her farm. The loan will really go far in having an abundant harvest for her family.

She is still taking part in the CEVI microcredit program. She has received loans, training and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hog raiser. Aside from that she also sells retail feeds in their village and has been doing so for four years. She is a member of Barangay Nutrition Scholar or BNS. 

Her first loan from Kiva lenders enables her to maintain her business, but still her income is not enough to meet all the needs of their family. For this reason, Marilyn is again requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 8,000. According to her, she must work hard for her family. She always aims to give them a complete education, which she and her husband are trying to provide for their future welfare.

Marilyn manages her business well. Her husband is a rice mill operator. Three of their children are still studying, while their eldest is already a college graduate. Marilyn hopes and prays that God will give them more strength as they are now growing older. She is looking forward to the day that all her children live with good future because it is what they have dreamed of and is trying to give them since they were born.

loans.use: additional capital for the farm

loans.name: Suraiyokhon

texts.en:
For the last four years Suraiyokhon has been selling basic grains in the city of Isfara. She is a woman worthy of being imitated. After not being able to cover her home expenses by being a housewife, she used her savings of about USD $100, which she had for emergencies, and started her business. IMON International has supported Suraiyokhon by facilitating loans to her for the last three years. In spite of the strong competition in her type of business, her results have been improving and therefore it has been proposed to continue granting her credit. Currently Suraiyokhon needs a loan of $1000 USD to increase the range of her goods for sale. She and her family appreciate your support in helping her improve her business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing stock and purchasing additional goods to sell

loans.name: Ines Ismelda

texts.es:
La señora INES ISMELDA C. G. tiene 72 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Usquil, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ines es Viuda y es socia del Banco Comunal Cachanchugo.
La empresaria es analfabeta, refiere que ella es la mayor de 8 hermanos por eso desde niña se dedicaba a la  jalca: desgranar maíz, cosechar las papas, dar de comer a los animales que cría.
Tiene 5 hijos mayores y ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
INES se dedica  a le venta de sal al por mayor que le llevan de Trujillo. Ella los lleva a vender al mercado de Usquil.
Con su primer crédito de 200 soles compró sus cuyes y empezó a dedicarse a la crianza y reproducción de cuyes.
Con este crédito de  400  soles, comprará sal al por mayor.
Ines tiene como sueño poder vender su sal también en los pueblos aledaños y obtener mayores ganancias.

loans.use: lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra de sal al por mayor.

loans.name: Jiguissèmè. Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Jiguissèmè de l’association Tienkadi sont tous des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans,  4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles monogames à Hamdallaye un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république  du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur septième  prêt de groupe, tous les précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles font de  la vente de fruits, de poissons fumés,  de pagnes, d’orange,  de pomme de terre et de la restauration.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 paniers d’oranges, 4 sacs d’ananas, 4 régimes de banane, 45,kg de poissons fumés, 5 pièces de pagnes wax, 2 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe, 5 sacs de 100 kg de pomme de terre et 1sac de 100 kg de riz,  5 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 2 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe, 1 bidon de 20 litres d’huile alimentaire pour la restauration. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants et  vendent à Sikasso ville  dans les différents  marchés  d’une façon fixe,  au comptant en détail et quelques fois à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne, les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles ambitionnent aider leur mari à construire un lot à usage d’habitation, mais aussi avoir  plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers pour la vente la restauration.

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en: Wassim is a 31-year-old single man living with his parents and brothers. He has been irrigating the agriculture fields in neighboring villages since 2000. He works daily as per the demands of the clients. Today, Wassim is requesting to borrow $600 to purchase new irrigation tools to expand and develop his work.

loans.use: To purchase new irrigation tools

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Our client is Teresa. Teresa is from Ccorao. She is 56 years old and is married with 5 children and 4 grandchildren.

Teresa is part of a communal bank consisting of 15 neighbors in Ccorao, a town 30 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Reynita D. Belen D. Ccorao, named after a virgin of Peru.

This is Teresa’s second loan from Arariwa. She sells artisan clothing – sweaters, coats and pants – to tourists in Ccorao from her house. She sells approximately 150-600 PEN worth of goods each day, which is the equivalent of $52-210. She buys her goods from Cusco.

She will use this loan to buy more artisan clothing to sell.

Teresa appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy artisan clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To develop and maintain a computer centre

loans.name: Rita Esmeralda

texts.es: La joven Rita Esmeralda Martínez , es madre soltera , habita en un barrio del municipio de Ticuantepe , la joven con el primer crédito logro levantar paredes a su vivienda y con este segundo financiamiento quiere poner ventanas y el zinc de la misma , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es su situación económica ya que tiene hijos por mantener y su sueldo no le ajusta para poder realizar la compra de materiales de construcción de una sola vez , sus sueños es poder darle un techo digno a sus hijos para que se sientan seguros y gocen de un mejor bienestar .En los últimos años a pasado por situaciones difícil con sus pequeños por no tener una casa que la cubra del frió y la lluvia ya que el cuarto donde se alberga su mamá con mucho esfuerzo lo construyo de plástico , madera y pedazos de zinc ya muy deteriorados.
texts.en:
Rita Esmeralda Martínez is a young single mother who lives in a poor neighborhood in the town of Ticuantepe. Her first loan was used to build the walls of her house. With this second loan, she will install windows and a zinc roof. Her greatest challenge has been dealing with her financial situation. She has three children to support, yet her salary has not been adjusted in order for her to purchase construction materials all at once. Her dream is to provide a decent home for her children where they can feel secure and enjoy better living conditions. In recent years, she has experienced difficult situations in which her young children were not protected from the cold and the rain. The room currently occupied by her mother is put together with plastic, wood, and sheets of zinc that have greatly deteriorated.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install windows & a zinc roof

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes M. is from the city of Balutu Concepcion Tarlac. She is 51 years old. Lourdes is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lourdes runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lourdes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Lourdes from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mean

texts.en: Mrs. Mean S. lives in Daeum Rumdael village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Kouy Sae, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a traditional musician who is hired by villagers for wedding ceremonies. In his plantation, he faces difficulties because his field has infertile soil and a lot of insects which damage the rice crops. Therefore, Mrs. Mean S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for ploughing the rice field. She is 53 years-old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, one who helps his parents work and the others attend the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and plough the rice field.

loans.name: Vista Al Mar Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group, Vista al Mar (View of the Ocean), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the Samana PeninsuL., a lush but rugged area of the Dominican Republic, where there is a nascent tourist economy and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a widow with her daughter.

Ana is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her clothing sales business by purchasing pants, skirts, blouses and underwear to sell. She will use the profits to invest in her family by purchasing a computer, books, pencils and notebooks for her daughter, as well as paying for her transport to school. Additionally, she would like to purchase a pig to raise in her yard. Her long-term goal is to improve her home little by little and to see her daughter go to the university. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase pants, skirts, blouses and underwear for resale

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
56-year-old Delia manages a 2-hectare (5-acre) farm in Banga, South Cotabato. She has twelve children and the eldest is 33 years old.

Delia started her business in 1975 using land from their parents. She was able to plant it with calamansi (a citrus fruit), coconut trees, bananas, rice and corn.

In October 2008, Delia joined CEVI and now she’s requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to help finance her business. The income she will receive is very helpful in providing their basic needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 37 year old man who lives in Tyre southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Ali has been working in construction since 2004. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase all the needed tools. He went into this business because he wanted to be financially independent. His clients are his friends and neighbors. 

He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and machines for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on improving his business by purchasing more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: To purchase tools.

loans.name: Bahlul

texts.en:
Bahlul A. is 50 years old. He is married and has three children. A.'s family lives in Fuzuli region.

A. has been in this business for six years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy 20 speeps to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy 20 sheeps

loans.name: María Argentina

texts.es:
La Señora María Argentina A. C. es comerciante desde hace 26 años tiene una fritanga que empieza a operar desde las cinco de la tarde hasta las diez de la noche de lunes a domingo  su negocio está ubicado en los semáforos de la Roberto González en una caseta ahí ella alquila.
Tiene cinco hijos pero solo uno depende de ella el resto de sus hijas le ayudan a atender el negocio anteriormente la señora A. C. era ama de casa empezó su negocio con un capital de C$ 500.00 vendiendo solo lo que era  tajadas.
Tiene cuatro años de trabajar con nuestra institución en los cuales la señora se siente muy Feliz y satisfecha ya que con esos financiamientos ella le invierte al negocio y de las ganancias ella ha podido ir acondicionando su negocio y su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Señora María Argentina A. C. has been a businesswoman for 26 years. She runs a fried food snack stall from 5pm until 10pm every day of the week. The rented stall is located near the traffic lights on Roberto González Street. María has five children but only her son is still dependent on her. Her remaining four daughters help her in the business. Before she started the business, she was a housewife. She started with an investment of $500 selling only fried plantains. María has worked with our institution for four years and feels very pleased as she has invested the money in the business, and with the profits she has been able to continue equipping the stall and improving her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and a table for her business

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
Thompson S., holding the sign, is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God Is Able. He is 52 and married with five children aged 7 to 30. He could not continue his education through 12th grade due to financial problems. For more than two years, Thompson has sold goods such as batteries, soap, and toothpaste in a shop at the Gbengbar Town in Paynesville, Liberia. He has a nice way with customers and sells goods that they need which keeps them returning. He started selling when he lost his job due to the civil crisis. Shortage of capital to improve his business is Thompson's main problem. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy batteries, soap and toothpaste. His goal is to have a very large business, educate his children, and give his family a good future.

About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To build up his inventory.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: Don Alfonso es un hombre trabajador de 48 años, vive en el barrio san juda, junto a su esposa y tres hijos. Su carrera ha sido camarógrafo durante varios años, un tiempo trabajo para canal seis, pero luego aspiro a tener su propio estudio en donde hasta ahora ha logrado estabilizarse, la dificultad que se le ha presentado es que sus equipo de trabajo no los ha cambiado debido a que no cuenta con el capital. Pero eso no interfiere para ser su trabajo en  la toma de video y fotos. Con este  préstamo que solicita es para comprar  tarjeta pina de hacer video. Sus planes es logra ahorrar para poder comprar equipo nuevos en la tecnología que facilite el trabajo como la calidad y dar mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Don Alfonso is 48 years old. He lives in the San Juda neighborhood with his wife and three children. His has worked as a cameraman for a number of years, for a time he worked for "canal seis", but then he aspired to have his own studio which he has managed to keep stable up to now. The challenge that he faces is that his work equipment has not changed due to the fact that he does not have the capital. But this does not interfere in his work taking video and photos. This loan that he is asking for is to buy a sound card for making video. His plan is to succeed in saving to be able to buy latest technology equipment that will make his work easier, such as in the quality, and give better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sound card for making video

loans.name: Cira Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Pequeños Comerciantes se reúne en la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita en la costa ecuatoriana, esta ciudad es mas conocida como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, cuenta la historia que en tiempos pasados cuando aun no era ciudad en lo que ahora son sus calles habían sembrado muchos arboles de tamarindo y de ahí base el nombre.

Al visitar este banco conversamos con la socia Carmen, es madre soltera con 6 hijos es una portovejense de nacimiento vive en la orquídeas un sector bastante vulnerable de la localidad, ella se dedica al comercio de ropa, vende prendas interior, sostenes, medias y mas,  sus compras la realiza en Guayaquil viaja cada dos meses según como  vaya  sus ventas, invierte de  400  a 500  dólares en la mercadería, la forma en la que se gana la vida es recorriendo las calles del sector donde vive y entre otros cercanos, de una manera que le facilita a sus clientes le deja a crédito la mercadería cobrando por semana , ya son 17 años que lleva este oficio, el ser socia de la Fundación le ha ayudado mucho ha superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito surtirá su negocio  viajara a comprar mas mercadería.
texts.en:
The Small Traders Community Bank meets in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi province, on the coast of Ecuador. This city is known as the city of Tamarinds. The story is that many years ago when it was not yet a city they planted many tamarind trees in what are now the city streets, and that is how it got this name. Upon visiting this bank we spoke with Carmen, a single mother with six children. She is a native of Portoviejo and lives in the Orquideas, a low-income neighborhood in the city. She works selling clothing, underwear, bras, hosiery and more. She buys her products in Guayquil, where she travels every two months. Depending on how her business is going she invests between 400 and 500 dollars on merchandise. She makes her living selling her products door-to-door in her neighborhood and others nearby. She sells her merchandise on credit, collecting payments every week. She has had this business for 17 years. Being a member of the foundation has helped her overcome problems and grow her business. With this new loan she will supply her business with more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase underwear, hosiery, bras

loans.name: Mariuxi Del Pilar

texts.es:
Nuestra Socia Mariuxi es Fundadora del banco comunal Alfa que se viene reuniendo desde hace varios años en la ciudad de Portoviejo, la actividad en la que ella trabaja es la venta de productos naturales y medicinales, además trabaja en una boutique es experta en saber dividir el tiempo, con su  negocio ya lleva  6 años, a ella siempre le han gustado el comercio de diferentes productos, lo que la motivó a vender esta clase de productos es porque tiene su propio testimonio; el esposo estaba al filo de la muerte y le recomendaron que los tome y se curo, ahora es un hombre sano y desde entonces se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien.

 La hija de esta pareja de esposos es la que se encarga de hacerles probar los  productos como aloe, té y batidos a los clientes, en un club que tiene. La señora Mariuxi sale a recorrer para entregar el producto en frascos sellados, con este nuevo crédito la señora Mariuxi podrá invertir en su nuevos productos que tiene por entregar a sus clientes, la manera de vender es  a contado,  con la otra parte del crédito lo compartirá en el negocio que tiene su esposo que es la venta de carne al por mayor, tiene un congelador pero en los actuales momentos se les  a dañado y necesitan  uno nuevo urgente, este negocio del esposó lo ha  mantenido por 23 años.
texts.en:
Mariuxi is the founder of the Alpha Communal Bank which was established several years ago in the city of Portoviejo. She sells natural health products and also works at a boutique, so she is an expert at managing her time. Mariuxi has been in business for six years and has always enjoyed selling different types of products. She began selling health products as a result of her own experience. Her husband was near death and these products were recommended to him to take for its curative properties. Now he is a healthy man and since then her business has done very well.

Her daughter is responsible for preparing products such as aloe, tea, and smoothies for customers who have joined a club that she established. Sra. Mariuxi delivers her products in sealed jars. With this loan, she will invest in new products that she can deliver to her customers. Most of her sales are made on a cash basis, but with some she extends credit. Her husband manages a meat wholesale business. He has a freezer, but at the moment it is not working and he needs to get another one as soon as possible. His business has been operation for 23 years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase aloe vera & medicinal teas

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran has been married for twenty-three years. She has been spending her life with her family in Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan for the past eight years. She has two sons and one daughter. Her elder son operates a cosmetics-selling business and the other kids attend a local school.

A very talented lady, Sugran runs her bangles-selling business, selling colorful bangles in her community. She is showing her bangles in the photo. She does this work to give her children a better education. Her husband has thirty years of experience selling wheat in the market. His earnings help them to meet their financial expenses.

Surgan has taken three loans from Asasah and has successfully repaid them. From the profit generated by these loans she bought a color television, a cycle and a motorcycle. Now she is applying for the fourth time for a loan to expand to her husband’s wheat-selling business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat for her husband's business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok M. is a woman who is married with three children, two of whom are laborers, while the youngest one is two years old. Mrs. Sok M. was born in 1969. She and her family live in Srae Vong village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Sok M. is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectares (3.75 acres) of land she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Moeurn Mao, is a laborer and, aside from this, he is also a palm juice collector who is able to earn some money from selling palm sugar to support his family.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they are able to earn only a little. So, to improve her family’s living conditions, Mrs. Sok M. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. With the rest of the loan she will buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding plus rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase plantains to make fried plantains

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Meet 48-year-old Fatu K., a small-scale businesswoman in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. Fatu sells locally dyed cloths (gara lappers), baby clothes, bowls, coolers, etc. She has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. With a loan of SLL 2,000,000, Fatu will be able to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items at wholesale. Fatu’s husband is a businessman too and all three of her children are adults.

loans.use: To buy gara lapper making materials (inks, white cotton cloth, etc), baby clothes, bowls, coolers, etc.

loans.name: Regalo De Dios Group

texts.es:
el grupo Regalo de Dios esta integrado por tres personas humildes y trabajadoras, que desean obtener capital de trabajo para invertir en sus negocios. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

 
el señor Benito R. G. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en union libre con la señora Maria Teodora Fuentes Anariba quien es ama de casa y vende charamuscas de frutas. don Benito se dedica desde hace 5 años a vender frescos, leña y maiz.
Ademas trabaja por la noches en una escuela como guardia de seguridad.


don Benjamin Moreno tiene 48 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Maria Fatima Bonilla con quien han procreado 6 hijos, tres de ellos dependen de el, 
Benjamin se dedica al cultivo de maiz, venta de leña seca para consumo domestico y venta de vacas.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar leña.


el señor Dionicio V. M. tiene 49 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 7 hijos, cuatro de ellos
dependen de el, los otros ya trabajan y aportan al hogar, Dionicio se dedica desde hace 5 años
al cultivo de maiz para la venta, venta de leña por carretadas puestas en el lugar. 
tambien cria cerdos, los engorda y luego los vende.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar leña.
 
todos ellos son personas muy humildes, serias, trabajadoras y que desean obtener capital para trabajar y salir adelante con sus familias.
texts.en:
The Group, Regalo de Dios ( Gift of God) is made up of three humble and working people who wish to obtain working capital to invest in their businesses. The following details the different activities each of them perform. Benito R. G. is 49 years old. He lives in a common-law marriage with Maria Teodora Fuentes Anariba who is a housewife and sells fruit popsicles. Benito has been selling soft drinks, firewood, and corn for the last 5 years and aside from that he also moonlights as a security guard at a school. Benjamin Moreno is 48 years old and is married to Maria Fatima Bonilla whom with he has 6 children, three of which are dependent on him. Benjamin cultivates corn, sells dry firewood for domestic use and also sells cows. He would use the loan to purchase firewood. Dionicio V. M. is 49 years old, is married, and has 7 children. Four of the children are dependent on him and the rest work and contribute to the household. Dionicio has been cultivating corn for the last 5 years to sell along with firewood sold on site in carts. He also raises pigs, plumps them up and then sells them. He would use the loan to purchae firewood. Every one of them are humble people, serious, and hard-working who wish to obtain working capital to get ahead with their families.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo G., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, firewood, and corn

loans.name: Lilliam Johana

texts.es:
Lilliam Johana T. C. es una mujer joven de 28 que apenas hace 3 años inició su pulpería en su casa de habitación, anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de productos AVON sin embargo decidió vender algunos rubros en su casa como chiverías, gaseosas y golosinas. Hoy esa pequeña venta que inició como un experimento ahora es una pulpería pequeña pero surtida.

Lilliam recibe ayuda de su mamá en cuanto a la atención del negocio puesto que tiene dos hijos de 5 y 3 años que necesitan aún mucho cuidado y atención. Su sueño es poder ver a sus hijos preparados y tener una tienda de ropa. Seguir luchando es su objetivo diario.
texts.en:
Lilliam is 28 years old, and with hard work she started a convenience store in her home three years ago. Previously she made a living selling Avon products, however she decided to start selling some items, such as soft drinks and snacks, out of her home. It started out as an experiment, but now it's a small but well-stocked store. Lilliam's mother helps her with the business because Lilliam has two children ages 5 and 3 who need a lot of care and attention. Her dream is to be able to see her children be successful and to have a clothing store. Her daily objective is to keep fighting.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mujeres Talentosas Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de las Sras. Eladia A. y la Sra. Norma Martínez, quienes se habían  acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse mas del  Programa  Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, las mismas decidieron invitar a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo de vida, son 16 mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días. 
La señora Rosa es una de las integrantes, muy humilde, pero con su trabajo ella logra obtener ingresos para su familia.
Su actividad consiste en la venta de especias  como comino, ajos, pimienta blanca y negra, órganos, y remedios naturales que ella compra en gran cantidad y los fracciona para facilitar su venta y además para aumentar su ganancia.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de especias y ajos.
texts.en:
This committee was formed through Mrs. Eladia A. and Mrs. Norma Martínez who approached Fundación Paraguaya’s office to join the Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) Committee’s Program. They then invited their friends and colleagues from the neighborhood to join in order to get ahead and improve their way of life as a group.
