They are 16 hard working, humble women who must earn their livelihood every day. One of the members is Rosa. She is very humble but succeeds in earning income for her family through her work. She sells spices like: cumin, garlic, white and black pepper, organs and natural remedies that she buys in bulk and repackages for ease of sale and to increase profits. She is asking for a loan to buy spices and garlic.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy garlic and spices.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn P. is from the village of Tonggo,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old. Marilyn is married and has 2 school-age children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting rootcrops, fruits & vegetables for sale. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Eva Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eva María; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de platería como aretes, pulseras y collares, ella vende en forma independiente en la plaza de armas desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener un puesto donde pueda vender la platería. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Eva María, a member of the Banco Comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” (“Lord of Muruhuay” Communal Bank). The communal bank is located in the Cusco department, province and district.

Eva María is 35, livign with her partner and her 3 children. She alternates her daily chores and her retail activity selling silversmith’s craft such as earrings, bracelets and necklaces. She is an independent merchant and she works in the Plaza de Armas form 8 am to 6 pm; she would like to have a place where to sell silversmith’s craft.

She is thankful to those that will help her achieve her dream through this loan, and she commits to comply with the repayments of her dues in the set time.

loans.use: To buy materials to make jewels.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es:
Sandra Maria es casada con el Sr. Julio Cesar Castilla Meneses con quien tiene 6 hijos, el mayor tiene 28 años y el menor 12 año, todos habitan en la Comarca La Palma del municipio de Tecolostote, Es comerciante de leche la que ademas procesa y obtiene crema, queso y cuajadas las que vende a las personas de su comunidad. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien asume los gastos del hogar. 

Esta solicitando su segundo credito a Afodenic con el Apoyo de Kiva para construir un cuarto de 4x4 mts, con el objetivo de brindar mejor comodidad a su familia. 

El mayor sueño de Sandra es poder tener una vivienda digna con las condiciones basicas para que su familia se sienta comoda y ver a sus hijos realizados que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Sandra Maria is married to Mr. Julio Cesar Castilla Meneses, with whom she has six children.  Their oldest child is 28 years old and the youngest is 12 years old.  They all live in Comarca La Palma, in the municipality of Tecolostote.  She sells milk, which she also processes to make cream, cheese, and curds, and then sells to people in her community. She counts on her husband's support, as he takes care of the household expenses.

She is requesting her second loan from AFODENIC, with Kiva's support, in order to build a room measuring 4 meters by 4 meters.  Her goal is to make her family more comfortable.

Sandra's greatest dream is to be able to have a dignified home with basic conditions that will make her family feel comfortable, and to see her children turn out to be good people.

loans.use: to build a room to make her family more comfortable

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine L. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old. Christine is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling a variety of fish like sardines, solib, kutob, kabalyas, kugita and kubotan in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Christine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. 

Christine is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: José Roan Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama “José Roan”  y se ubica en la localidad de la Ribera Llano Grande, Municipio de Coapilla, Estado de Chiapas México, dicho grupo se integra de tres personas y cada una tiene diferente actividad.
La señora quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama Idolina P. Pérez, es casada con el señor Rodulfo S. Vázquez, del cual tienen dos hijos: Rodulfo Misael de veinte  años de edad y Abimael de quince años.
Idolina solicitó el préstamo para trabajarlo poniendo una granja de pollos, comprarle alimentos y luego venderlo en la misma localidad.
Su inspiración por  esta actividad inicio hace poco tiempo, para obtener ingresos en su  hogar y con ello cubrir los gastos pequeños que se realizan del diario.
Con las ganancias que vaya obteniendo de su venta de pollos va a ahorrar para comprar más, y así vaya obteniendo más ingresos en su negocio para su hogar.
El sueño de Idolina es ahorrar para seguir trabajando, para que con eso logre comprar materiales y comenzar a construir su casa ya que donde vive es un techo de tabla.
Se integro al programa de FRAC ya que donde ella radica hay varios grupos que le comentaron del crédito se vio muy interesada y busco a otras dos personas y formo el grupo.
Las personas que integran el grupo son los siguientes.
•	Idolina P. Pérez: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de  pollos de granja para criarlos y luego venderlo en la misma localidad.
•	Uriel Pérez Hernández: invertirá el  préstamo para la compra de madera, para  fabricar muebles.
•	Joel S. P.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de puerco para engordarlo y luego venderlo vivo.
texts.en:
The group called “José Roan” is located in the town of Ribera Llano Grande, which is part of Coapilla Municipality in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  This group consists of three of persons, each of whom is involved in a different activity.

The lady who agreed to be interviewed is Idolina P. Pérez.  She is married to Sr. Rodulfo S. Vázquez and has two children for whom she is responsible, Rodulfo Misael (age 20) and Abimael (age 15).  Idolina is requesting a loan for her chicken farm.  She plans to buy feed for her animals so that she can sell them later in her community.  

Her inspiration to start this business came to her recently.  She wanted to have income for her household so that she could cover a few daily expenses.  With the profits she earns from selling chickens, Idolina is able to save more and generate a better household income.  Her dream is to save and continue working so that she can buy materials in order to begin the construction of her house since her existing home is made of wood planks.  Prior to joining the program, she met with other groups who told her about the loans.  Idolina was very interested, so she found two other individuals to form a group.

The members of the group are as follows:
•	Idolina P. Pérez will invest her loan in the purchase of chickens for her farm that she will raise and later sell in her community.
•	Uriel Pérez Hernández will invest his loan in the purchase of wood for making furniture.
•	Joel S. P. will invest his loan in a pig for fattening and later sell the meat by the piece.

loans.use: Purchase young chickens and feed so that the animals can be sold in the future

loans.name: Elvelita

texts.en:
Elvelita B. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 40 years old. Elvelita is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvelita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market.

Elvelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvelita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elvelita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets

loans.name: Mi

texts.en: Mi R., 54, is a farmer, earning an income of $2.5 USD per day. R. is married and lives with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend $65 USD on food, $10 USD on electricity supply, and $7.5 USD on other necessary expenses every month. R. is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase a water pump. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her sixth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. R. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy a water pump

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia, de 61 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de  su esposo y sus dos menores hijas.Desde hace 21 años, comercializa comida y su negocio esta ubicado en la puerta de su casa, en el lugar atiende por las mañanas y  tardes. Su esposo la apoya  en trasladar objetos muy pesados, en las noches empieza con la preparación de sus platillos  y también de los utensilios, que ofrecerá al día siguiente a sus comensales. Recién ha empezado a ofrecer su servicio de bufetes para algunos eventos sociales, y el negocio  tiene bastante salida, pues  su puesto de ventas se ubica en una avenida muy transitada de la ciudad. Por las ventas exitosas de sus diversas comidas, tiene planeado para el futuro mejorar su negocio con  un local de ventas más presentable.Es su octavo crédito con MFP, y  esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero pues siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, además esta muy agradecida con todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que  le permitirá continuar progresando.Delia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de ingredientes, al por mayor, que necesita para continuar ofreciéndoles los mejores platillos a sus clientes, y así espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Delia is 61 years old; she lives in her own home in the company of her husband and their two young children. For the past 21 years she has been selling prepared foods and she runs her business from the front door of her house. She is open in the mornings and afternoon. Her husband helps her carry heavy objects and in the evenings she prepares the food and utensils for the following day. 

Recently she has started to offer catering services for social events and this new business has had great success. Her stand is located on a busy street in the city. In the future she plans to improve her business by opening a more comfortable restaurant to support the excellent sales of the various foods. 

This is her eighth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner0 and she is very happy to know she has access to this financial support. She has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments. She is also grateful to her community bank and to all those who have made this loan possible. It will permit her to keep advancing. Delia's plan is to invest the requested loan in the purchase of large quantities of ingredients acquired in wholesale. She needs this to keep up the sale of her best dishes to her clients. This way she hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For over fourteen years, she has operated a mat-weaving business, selling from home to her neighbours. In addition she also sells kerosene which contributes to her sources of income. Fatuma faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to establish a cereals shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase palm leaves, materials used in weaving mats for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase palm leaves used in weaving mats for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal, bitter-balls, sugar, oil, etc

loans.name: Nurgul's Group

texts.en:
Nurgul T., 48, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Balykchi. Together with her husband, she is raising two daughters. The first daughter studies at the university and the second is at school. 

Nurgul works as a teacher of history at a school and her husband works in the company “Kyrgyz Altyn.”  In order to earn additional money to support the family budget, the family breeds livestock animals. They have been doing this since their marriage. With the money received from the loan, Nurgul wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, she wants to expand her business activity and provide her children with a good education. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She has been operating a cafe for the past three years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business.

With the 40,000Kes she is requesting, she wants to purchase a potato-chip cutter and increase her food inventory. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a potato-chip cutter and increase food inventory.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.en:
Adrian is aged 62 and has been in mixed farming for forty years in his hometown of Nkubu in Central Kenya. He is married with five children (all adults). He produces tobacco, coffee, bananas and milk which are all sold locally. He relies on his teaching pension for additional income.

Adrian has requested for a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase dairy goats. He believes he will generate enough income to purchase more farming inputs and better his farming business as well as family living standards. He also aspires to buy more land and build rental houses in future.

Adrian points at prolonged drought as the major challenge for the farming business in the area.

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is married to Susan and they have three children. He has been running a retail shop as a primary business for 11 years. He also has been selling vegetables for 11 years and gets a monthly income of KES. 9,000.

Dominic was introduced to KADET LTD by existing customers and currently he is servicing his eighth loan after repaying the previous ones successfully. He plans to use the loan amount to purchase more stock like sugar, flour and cakes for the retail shop for sale.

Dominic hopes to expand his business and build a better house for his family. He describes himself as hard-working.

loans.use: To buy more stock such as sugar, flour, and cakes.

loans.name: Melanine

texts.en: Melanine is a mother of two children and she is 47 years old. Her children are between the ages of 17-26 years old, and all her children are in school. Melanine sells sodas and sorghum and she has been doing this business for 10 years. She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum. With the profits she plans to buy cattle which will give her milk.

loans.use: To buy sorghum for sale and make more profits.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rug-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for the past eight years and also earns additional income from selling used clothing.

Mercedita has been sustaining her business through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy rug-making materials. In the future, she hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make rugs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice for selling.

loans.name: Buyanravjih

texts.en:
Buyanravjih is a 63-year-old widow who lives in a rented house in the province of Uvurhangai in Mongolia. All of her children have grown up and live separately. In 2000, Buyanravjih started a grocery trading business at a rented stall in the Zanabazar trading center and has gained much experience, managing to build a strong customer base and expand her operation. She has also developed long-term and transparent relationships with her partners and suppliers.

A hardworking and honest woman who is planning to continue her business in the future, Buyanravjih says, "I want to build savings with the earnings I make." She is now requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery products to increase her business sales.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Bacilides

texts.es: Bacilides de 42 años, casada con Darío de 45 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia  en el centro poblado de natividad del distrito de Pichari. El negocio que realiza es la venta de prendas de vestir, y ya tiene 11 años dedicándose a ello, recuerda que en un inicio lo hacía en la calles ofreciendo su mercadería.  Con el pasar de los años logró ahorrar una cierta cantidad de dinero y eso la ayudó adquirir un local propio y abastecerse de más ropa. Ella esta satisfecha por haber logrado esto y más por su negocio que le genera una rentabilidad segura. Ahora no solo se dedica a vender ropa, sino que también ofrece zapatos y otros enseres para la casa, asimismo ha hecho un espacio para vender comida, alimentos como verduras y diversos productos. Para el futuro desea tener una tienda de calzados, ya que no hay negocio de este rubro por su zona. Este será su primer  crédito con MFP, por lo pide el apoyo de todos ustedes para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. En su banco comunal es una persona colaboradora en todas las reuniones. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles ella desea comprar zapatillas para iniciar con la venta de estos productos.
texts.en: Bacilides, 42, is married to Dario, 45, and they have 4 children.  They live in their own home in the town of Natividad in the Pichari district.   She has 11 years of experience with her business selling clothing.  She recalls starting the business by offering her merchandise for sale on the streets.  Over time she managed to save some money, and so was able to acquire a small store and stock it with clothing.  Bacilidades is pleased that she was able to achieve this, and to have a business that generates a reliable profit.  Now, not only does she sell clothing, but she also sells shoes and other household goods.  In addition, she has made a space to sell food, including vegetables and other products.  In the future, she wants to have a shoe store, since there is no such business in her neighborhood.  This will be her first loan with MFP, and she is asking for support from all of you to help her reach her goals.  In her communal bank, she contributes to all of the meetings.  With the 1,000 Peruvian soles requested, she wants to buy sneakers to start selling these products.

loans.use: to buy sneakers

loans.name: Norhanena

texts.en:
Norhanena is 53 years old and married with four children.

Norhanena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items for her sari-sari store.

Norhanena has borrowed and paid back 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 30 years and earns additional income from farming coconut.

Norhanena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, aged 30, is married to Carolyne, and they are blessed with one child. He operates a hardware shop, which has been in operation for seven years. The business earns him a monthly income of 8,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is his fourth loan term with KADET LTD., and he has successfully managed to repay the previous loans. He will use the funds to buy more hardware items for his shop. Charles intends to use the expected profits to build rental houses on his piece of land and to educate his child. He hopes to have a bigger hardware shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy hardware for sale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth de 49 años, vive en la ciudadela 20 de Julio, barrio ubicado al Sur de la ciudad, y se caracteriza  porque interactúan el comercio formal e informal, escenarios deportivos y recreativos, infraestructuras comerciales, zonas bancaria y conjuntos residenciales, pero principalmente  esta comunidad tiene una de las infraestructuras deportivas más importantes de Colombia y muy pronto  se convertirá en el escenario del futbol mundial en la categoría sub 20, por eso todo comerciante de su alrededor se  prepara para atender la avalancha de clientes que llegarán a la ciudad de Barranquilla, desde todas partes de Colombia y de otros países. 
En este ambiente integral Ruth vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos quien se dedica al comercio de mercancías variadas a través de 3 guías especializadas de productos y también prepara deliciosas hayacas que vende los fines de semanas y constituyen ingresos adicionales importantes. Desde el año 1996 inició su actividad comercial entre vecinos y amigos y gradualmente se ha extendido a clientes referenciados por sus mismos compradores. Ruth desarrolla la venta de productos mediante guías especializadas, a crédito con plazos que van desde 7, 15, 30 hasta 45  días,  y la venta de sus hayacas las realiza los fines de semana y de contado. La competencia es su mayor desafío pero se sostiene con precios y con buen servicio.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que Ruth hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará mercancía variada bajo pedidos, y será exitosa porque con ella logrará ampliar los plazos a sus clientes y aumentar su oportunidad de agregar nuevos compradores de sus productos. Su meta más adelante es tener una miscelánea bien surtida, con mucha mercancía de la que sus clientes piden permanentemente y se agota con mucha facilidad. Mientras trabaja para cumplir su sueño, maneja en su negocio una razón corriente de tres veces, y una rentabilidad no menor del 21%
texts.en:
Ruth, 49, lives in the 20 de Julio neighborhood located in the south of the city and noted for being an area where formal and informal commerce intermingle, for its sports and recreation areas, commercial infrastructure, banking and residential complexes but, above all, this community has one of the most important sports infrastructure in Colombia and soon will become the stage for Sub 20 World Football.  Because of this, all the surrounding merchants are preparing for the avalanche of customers that will arrive in the city of Barranquilla from all over Colombia as well as from other countries.

Ruth lives in this environment with her husband and two children.  She sells varied merchandise using three specialized catalogues.  She also prepares delicious ‘hayacas’ (type of corn cake similar to tamales) that she sells on weekends and are an important source of extra income.

She started her commercial activity in 1996 among friends and neighbors and has gradually expanded to other customers who were recommended to her by her current customers.  Ruth sells based on specialized catalogues.  She offers payment plans that go from 7, 15, 30, and even up to 45 days of credit.  She sells the hayacas on weekends and for cash.  Her greatest challenge is competition but she prevails thanks to her prices and good service.

Her Kiva loan will be her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy varied merchandise on order and she will be successful because with it she’ll be able to expand the time she gives her customers to repay and thus will increase her opportunity to win over new buyers of her products.

Her goal for later on is to have a well-stocked general store with lots of the merchandise that her customers most request and easily runs out.  While she works to attain this goal she has an accounts receivable ratio of three times and a profit margin of no less than 21%.

loans.use: to buy varied merchandise like cosmetics and feminine articles.

loans.name: Frederic

texts.fr:
Client de 32 ans, celibataire avec 2 enfants a sa charge, ayant deja beneficie d'un pret au premier cycle, il a rembourse avec succes et a eu a faire des epargnes considerables.
Pour ce second  pret qu'il va beneficier , il veut elargir sa boucherie en achetant des denrees qu'il ne pouvait acheter avant comme , les queue de boeufs,viande arriere, cotes de porcs, poules a bouillir et de la charcuterie.
Tres ambitieux, il veut aller loin dans son activite, ouvrir a la longue une chambre froide et avec les benefices continuer a epargner et prendre soin de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This client is 32, single and responsible for two children. He has already received one loan which he reimbursed successfully. He managed to put aside considerable savings. 

For his second loan, he wants to expand his meat shop by buying meats he was not able to afford earlier on such as ox tails, roasts, pork ribs, stewing hens, and cold cuts.

Very ambitious, he wants to go far in his business, in the long run opening a cold storage room and with his profits continuing to save to care for his children.

loans.use: to buy cartons of chicken thighs, stewing hens, ox tails, and chicken wings.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is the father of three children. He was trained on how to grow rice by his cooperative.  He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 37 years-old and married with four children.  To earn a living for her family, she farms.  She has eight years of experience in farming.  She has retained her business through her hard work and determination.  She hopes to expand her farming to a larger-scale.

She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings in order to buy seeds and pay for labour.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labour.

loans.name: Santos Alfredo

texts.es: El señor Santos , es habitante del municipio de  Ticuantepe , junto  a su esposa e hijos , la esposa labora en una empresa privada para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , él desde hace varios años se dedica a dar clases , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no cuenta  con recursos suficientes para invertir de una solo vez en materiales de construcción para ir mejorara do poco a poco la vivienda , agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva para mejorar su calidad de vida y vivir seguro en su humilde casa .
texts.en:
Santos lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his wife and children. His wife works at a private enterprise in order to help Santos with household expenses. For various years, he has dedicated himself to offering classes.  

The greatest difficulty he faces is a lack of sufficient resources at any one time to invest in construction materials to continue, little by little, improving their home. 

Santos is grateful for the help offered by Afodenic through the Kiva fund to improve their quality of life and help them live more securely in their humble home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve security at his house.

loans.name: Flor De Pilar 2 Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Flor de Pilar 2, se conformó en agosto del 2011,  se encuentran en el primer ciclo. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar económicamente  a sus familias en especial.
La Sr. Rosa se dedica a la venta de queso, nos comenta  que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia podrá  mejorar, ya que por medio de su negocio y su arduo trabajo logra tener los ingresos necesarios para paliar los gastos diarios.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de queso, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women's committee named "Flor de Pilar II" was formed in August 2011, and they are in their first lending cycle.  In addition to their own independent work, they also are developing activities together to bring in money, with the goal of having some capital within the group.  They work together to help each other achieve their objectives, which are to work to help their families out financially.

Señora Rosa works selling cheese.  She tells us that through this business, her family's financial situation will improve, and that through her business and her hard work, she will be able to earn the necessary income to cover their daily expenses.

She is requesting the loan to buy cheese, with which she will be able to stock up and meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy cheese for later resale.

loans.name: Maria Cliselda

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maria Cliselda le esta haciendo falta un cuarto.
Solicita un préstamo para empezar la construcción de una recamara ya que le esta haciendo falta para sus niños. Necesita compara el material que es (Cemento, varilla, block, arena y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora). 
Doña Maria Cliselda tiene poco tiempo que se quedo viuda y bajo su responsabilidad dos hijos, con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una  fábrica  en el ara de  jefa de línea de producción planean pagar el crédito. 
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida y que sus hijos tengan lo necesario para que sean personas profesionales, que tengan su propio espacio y privacidad en la casa.
texts.en:
María Cliselda’s house needs another bedroom room.  She’s asking for a loan to start building a bedroom she needs for her children.  She needs to buy the materials which are cement, rebar, concrete block and sand and to pay the person who will do the improvements).  

María Cliselda was widowed recently and left with two children in her care.  She will use part of her salary as a factory production line supervisor to repay the loan.  She wants to improve quality of life and that her children have what they need to become professional people and that they have their own space and privacy in the house.

loans.use: to start building a room in the front of her house.

loans.name: Vundu

texts.en:
Vundu is 41 years old and a livestock keeper. He and his wife Ann, a housewife, are blessed with eight children aged between 3 and 15 years. He has been rearing and selling livestock for the past eight years with the monthly income of 8,000 Kenya shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family. 

Vundu is applying for his third loan term with KADET after successfully repaying the previous loans. Vundu will use the loan to buy goats to sell.

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hope is to buy some commercial land and build rental houses, which will help him cater to his family needs.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Myrna is engaged in selling frozen foods in their village to supplement her husband's income. She is 37 years old and has three school-age children. They want to continue sending their children to school because they want them to finish their studies and find a good job someday. Despite the hardships of life, they have the strong determination to improve their status of living. 

Myrna is asking for an additional capital of PHP 9,000 to buy tocino, longaniza (pork sausages), hot dogs and ham to sell. She mentioned that through this loan, she will make an improvement in her business. She hopes that her patience and hard work will bear good fruit someday.

loans.use: to buy tocino, longaniza (pork sausages), hot dogs and ham to sell

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмал женат и ответственный отец двоих несовершеннолетних детей. Более 7 лет он занимается купле- продажей обувей. Данный бизнес он унаследовал от своих родителей. В бизнесе ему помогает младший брат.  За товарами он ездит сам в город Бишкек и привозит модные и высококачественные обуви. Его торговая точка находится в центре вещевого рынка. Более 7 циклов кредитуется в ИМОН Интернэшнл и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Акмал запрашивает займ для расширения ассортимента товаров. Он заранее благодарит ИМОН Интернэшнл и КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en: Akmal is married and is a responsible father of two adolescent children.  He has been involved in buying and selling shoes for over seven years.  He inherited this business from his parents.  Akmal's younger brother helps him with the business.  Akmal himself travels to the city of Bishkek and brings in stylish and high-quality shoes.  His retail outlet is located in the center of the clothing market.  He has obtained more than seven loans from Imon International and has a good credit history.  Akmal is requesting this loan to expand his merchandise selection.  He thanks Imon International and Kiva in advance for the support.

loans.use: to expand merchandise selection

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina trades in clothing from a rented booth in the city market. In order to meet her clients' demand before the coming New Year season, Lina would like to increase her clothing assortment. With the help of this loan, Lina will increase sales and receive more business income. This will allow Lina to sustain her family and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for clothing

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 43-year-old farmer married to Junivalis. They have four children, aged 21, 20, 18, and 12.  She has been growing vegetables and fruits for a period of one year and also has a green grocery business where she sells her farm produce and what she does not have she buys from other farmers. This business earns her an income of KES 10,000 per month but she also does poultry rearing as another business.

Regina was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member. She is applying for her first loan, in the amount of KES 10,000, which she will use to purchase more vegetables and fruits from other farmers as she currently does not have enough in her farm. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children.

Regina hopes to meet all of the demand in the market. She is a hardworking, aggressive businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Abdulai's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are a group of teachers from the township of Magburaka, in Northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 6,100,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to solve their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, they will gradually repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school's bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and repayment on their behalf. 

Abdulai (pictured in the left) is the leader of this group. Abdulai is forty years old. He was born in a village called Makam in Northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a teacher and the couple has three children, two of whom are attending primary schools. Abdulai has been a teacher for seventeen years now. He has requested for this loan in order to buy house building materials like iron and corrugated zinc.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron and corrugated zinc

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 21 years old and is a married man with a 3-year-old child. He has had a "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business for 2 years. He earns 6000 PHP per month with this business. Edwin also tills a piece of land where he grows rice crops. He says his harvest is for family consumption.

Edwin requested this loan to buy motorcycle spare parts and fertilizers. Edwin hopes for his business to grow.

loans.use: buy motorcycle spare parts and fertilizers

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es: La Sra. Ramona vive en  la zona del plan 3000. Es casa propia donde vive con sus tres hijos y sus padres. Ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías las cuales las hace ella misma. Hace hamacas de hilo, collares, manillas cinturones y adornos, muchas veces tiene pedidos. También se dedica a la panadería y los domingos hace patasca. Ella es cliente antigua de la institución esta en su cuarto ciclo. El crédito que esta solicitando es para aumentar su capital de trabajo ya que necesita por las fiestas de fin de año. La Sra. Ramona es una persona tranquila, responsable con muchas ganas de superación, muy trabajadora  para darles una mejor vida a sus hilos y ver que un día salgan profesionales ya que eso es lo que más desea. El dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de variedad de lanas e hilos para  realizar sus bordados artesanales.
texts.en: Ramona lives in the Plan 3000 neighborhood. She lives in her own home with her three children and her parents. She sells handcrafts which she makes herself. She makes yarn hammocks, necklaces, bracelets, belts, and accessories. She often takes orders. She also makes breads, and on Sundays she makes patasca [pork stew with corn]. She is an old client of the loan institution, and is now in her fourth loan cycle. The loan she is requesting is to increase her working capital since she needs to prepare for the end of the year holiday. Ramona is a calm and responsible person with ambition to improve her life. She is very hard-working, and desires to provide her children with a better life. Her greatest wish is to see her children have professional careers. She will use the loan money to purchase a variety of wool and yarn to make her hand-crafted works.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of wool and yarn to make her hand-crafted works.

loans.name: Doleel Djiguène 55 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Doleel Djigueene 55 regroupe cinq femmes  qui font parti d’une grande association de développement. Leur activité consiste  à faire du commerce de divers produits.
La présidente, madame Khoudia vend des chaussures, des habits prêt à porter, des bijoux, des parfums etc.…Elle a une expérience de plus de dix ans dans ce domaine. Elle est marié et appui son époux sur les dépenses du foyer : frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
Avec l’épargne qu’elle fait elle envisage d’ouvrir  dans l’avenir un magasin.
.
texts.en:
The Doleel Djigueene 55 loan group is composed of five women who belong to a large development association. They buy and sell various products.

The group's president, Khoudia, sells shoes, ready-made clothing, jewellery, perfume, etc....She has over ten years of experience in this line of work. She is married and helps her husband cover family expenses: paying for their children's education.

With the loan, she plans to open a store sometime in the future.

loans.use: to buy shoes, ready-made clothing, jewellery, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Jesus Hamilton

texts.es:
Jesus es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy talentoso, y gracias a esto, vio una oportunidad de crear un negocio y generar sus ingresos. Jesus se dedica a la actividad de la música, dando clases de diferentes instrumentos y tocando los fines de semana con algunas agrupaciones. Gracias a las buenas enseñanzas de Jesus, ya es reconocido por los habitantes de su sector y esto le ha traído muy buenas ventas. Jesus estudió en varias academias de música lo que le permite tener muy buenos conocimientos y siempre ha mostrado muy buena técnica para enseñarla a las demás personas. Con el ánimo de realizarle mantenimiento a sus instrumentos, Jesus busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a realizar el mantenimiento de sus instrumentos y pueda seguir generando con ellos los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. 
Jesus espera que de esta manera sus instrumentos le sigan ofreciendo la oportunidad de partir clases a diferentes personas y generar los ingresos que requiere su hogar.

loans.use: Realizar el mantenimiento de sus instrumentos y pueda seguir generando con ellos los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is married and has four children. She is 33 years old and resides in Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Angelina sells fish while her husband does the fishing to earn a living. She's been in this business for 6 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of business. 

Angelina requested a loan of PHP15,000 to repair their fishing boat. Angelina joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Angelina wants to build a house and to finish the study of her children.

loans.use: repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson lives in the coastal town of Mombasa, Kenya. He started as an employee and then purchased his own motorcycle from his savings. He is married and runs a transport business. He owns a motorcycle which he uses to transport people and goods. The regions around his area lack a reliable road network and motorcycles provide a convenient means to travel on business errands. He has also learnt the trade of motorcycle repair.

Wilson was introduced to Milango by a friend and is applying for a loan of 18,970 Kenyan shillings to add to his savings in order to purchase another motorcycle. Wilson believes the income from this loan will help him meet his family's needs and add new stock of spare parts. His future ambition is to own a three-wheel vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a farmer who mainly grows maize and does dairy farming.  She had requested for a previous loan which she used to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer.  She got a lot of farm yields and she made a good profit out of her sales.
This helped Anne to repay her loan and pay school fees for her children.  She has requested for another loan of 20, 87 KES to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gretty Virginia

texts.es:
Gretty viven junto a su hijo y a su esposo en Santo Domingo de los Colorados, una ciudad con un clima cálido húmedo agradable, conocido por ser el puente que une a la sierra y la costa.
Gretty cuenta con casa propia que la ha podido construir gracias al apoyo de su esposo, quien siempre la ha incentivado a salir adelante. Juntos han progresado, él trabaja en el municipio mientras ella cuenta con negocio propio en su domicilio.
Gretty comenzó de a poco, hace años atrás vendía cd´s y también hacia manualidades para ver la manera de ella también generar ingresos para su hogar, así fue creciendo y comprando productos de bazar para ir surtiendo, actualmente ya cuenta con unas vitrinas donde además vende artículos de papelería; Gretty comenta que gracias a los créditos de Fundación Alternativa ella ha podido crecer como microempresaria, ella es clienta fiel de la institución.
Está muy feliz porque cuenta con mucha clientela ya que su negocio es único en el sector, con el crédito que gracias a la institución y a Kiva pudo obtener, podrá comprar más mercadería ya que está próxima a acercarse la temporada estudiantil y necesita tener más artículos de papelería.
texts.en:
Gretty lives with her spouse and child in Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a city with a pleasantly warm and humid climate, well known for being the bridge connecting the mountains with the coast.

Gretty has her own home which she was able to build thanks to the support of her husband, who has always encouraged her to get ahead. Together they have made progress, he works in the town and she runs her own business from home.

Gretty started slowly, years ago she was began CDs as well as making handicrafts to generate an income for the home. She continued to grow as she did this, and began buying some goods to begin stocking her store, she now also has some display cabinets where she sells stationery products. Gretty says that thanks to the loans from Fundación Alternativa she has been able to grow as a micro-entrepreneur, she is a faithful client of the institution.

She is very happy as she has many customers as her business the only one of its kind in the area. With this loan, which she was able to get thanks to the institution and Kiva, she will be able to buy more goods, as it is approaching the student season and she needs more stationery products.

loans.use: Para emprender su negocio de bazar y papelería y seguir progresando.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is 36 years old and has one child. Marciana is married and has one child who is in school.

Marciana is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Marciana requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marciana has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Marciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Iaeli

texts.en: Iaeli F.’s business is a small shop. With her first loan of $120, she started her small shop with selling sugar, rice, salt, flour and onions, now with her 4th loan of $750, she has extended her business, selling different variety of goods, such as tin meats, snacks, frozen foods, beverages and also clothes. Iaeli’s business has turned out to be one of the successful businesses within the SBPD’s program. She also won the best saver for 2005’s Savings Program.

loans.use: Restock shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open his own shoe shop and to increase range of shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stocks of her used shoes business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Rugiatu K. is forty-five years old, married, and has three children. She has been running a fish business for a long time but could not progress due to a lack of capital.

With her previous loan, Rugiatu managed to pay cash for two baskets of fish, and that earned her a good profit. She has successfully completed the repayment of her previous loan and would like to take more loans of $175 after the national election in September. Fish is the main food and one of cheapest foods in Sierra Leone. Rugiatu’s aim is to make more profit and diversify her business.

loans.use: Increase her stock of fish so that she can earn more income

loans.name: Lolelai

texts.en: Lolelai is 32 years of age, married and has six children. She joined this Program last year when she needed help for her business. She runs a lawn mowing business and is requesting a loan to buy petrol, oil and other supplies to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy petrol, oil, and other supplies for her lawn-mowing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate her stall and purchase an assorted stock of clothes

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina is in her early thirties, and for the last eight years has operated a grocery store.  Her business is popular because of the many items she has to sell, and because she is such a kind and thoughtful person. Catalina is committed to protect and expand this tradition of excellence in customer service so that her business can keep growing. She plans to do that with a new loan, which will allow her to purchase new items -- such as beer, rice and fresh pork -- to sell to her customers. Catalina's long-term goal is to open a new store in a location she owns, because this will allow her to increase her income and take better care of her six children.

loans.use: To restock her store with items to sell

loans.name: Marcana

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Marcana M.. She is married with two children, ages 10 and 17, and has two other dependents, who are her niece and nephew. In 2006 Marcana established a livestock and weaving business, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional livestock, as well as materials and dyes for weaving. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional weaving materials and dyes in bulk.

loans.name: Jubaidah

texts.en: Jubaidah is 36 years old and married to A.. Her husband has no fixed job, so Jubaidah must work to support her family's needs. Everyday, she goes door-to-door to sell kids and adult clothing on credit. She can earn up to $10.00 a day with only a very small profit. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $125.00 to buy more clothes to sell. She agrees to repay this loan within twelve months.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Muhamed G.

texts.en: Muhamed G. C. is 42 years old and is married with 5 children.  He is a farmer who grows vegetables, rice, and beans.  Last season, Muhamed saw an increase in production, especially with rice.  He has already received a loan from SMT and he used the loan proceeds to produce rice and pigeon peas; as a result, his pea harvest increased by 80%, and the rice production increased by 100%.  Muhamed would like to start commercial farming and would like to develop his business slowly over time; simply put, he will need to achieve a greater lever of production, so he will need to hire labourers and purchase additional inputs.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan of Le. 1,000,000.

loans.use: To hire labourers and purchase inputs in order to develop a commercial farming business

loans.name: María Salomé's Group

texts.en:
María Salomé is thirty-five years old and the mother of four children: three are boys, all of them attend school. Her husband works as a security agent at a country house. To supplement her family’s income, María Salomé sells vegetables and ripe fruits in her hometown, the low-income Cruce Mela community of Yamasá.

María Salomé admits humbly that it is hard to keep up with her children and that maintaining the cash flow is very challenging. Nonetheless, she expects that her business’ growth will help her augment her income so that she can improve her family’s living conditions. María Salomé says that the most important thing for her is to support her children’s studies so that they get a good education. In this way, even the poorest children are given a fighting chance.

María Salomé has applied for a loan together with the following entrepreneurs:

Marta Teresa D. L. S. Gonzalez, who will buy curtains and decorative window dressings.

Grisel V., who will purchase seeds to resell in the community.

Ramona Antonia M. T. has a small business selling cakes and other goods.

Epifania S. will buy materials for a small beauty parlor.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits for a small business

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa G. is a thirty-nine year old widow and has four children who are all currently in school. Theresa hopes to be able to provide her children with good education despite being a single parent. She owns and operates and grocery shop in one of the busy local markets. In the shop, Theresa sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. Currently, she would like to take out a loan to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, and other goods to increase her stock. Theresa belongs to the community group called Decency Trust Group, whose members provide a guarantee for one another as social collateral to help access and repay loans.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, evaporated milk, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr:
D. Marcelline was born on the 22 of March, 1976 in Adjohoun, located in the Department of Oueme in Benin. She is married to André Houinssou and has 3 children that are still dependent on her. She was selling petroleum, but a year ago begun selling corn and millet instead. She is asking for the loan in order to be able to travel to Glazoué, a city in the center of Benin, where she will be able to purchase goods.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Née le 22 Mars 1976 à ADJOHOUN dans le département de l'OUEME au BENIN, dame D. Marcelline est mariée à Monsieur HOUINSSOU André et mère de 3 enfants encore à sa charge. Elle commercialisait le pétrole qu'elle a abandonné depuis bientôt 1 an au profit de la vente du maïs et du mil. Dans l'intention d'étendre son activité, elle sollicite ce concours financier pour un voyage sur Glazoué, une ville du centre du BENIN afin de s'approvisionner.

loans.use: Purchase 5 bags of corn and 2 bags of millet

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es:
Octavia is a mother of 9 children who are the apple of her eye; she has made an effort to provide for them the best possible way according to her capacities. Thanks to her work she was able to bring them up and give them education and now she is alone with the last two. Octavia is a farmer and a stockbreeder and with these activities she can support her home. She knows very well how to look after and feed her cows to obtain the necessary amount of milk to be sold on week-ends and to make cheese. Octavia wishes to increase her income and for that purpose she needs one more cow and therefore she requests this loan and hopes to count on your support to satisfy her need.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Octavia es una madre de 9 hijos quienes son sus más grandes tesoros, por ellos se esforzó para darles todo lo posible, dentro de sus capacidades. Gracias a su trabajo pudo educarlos y criarlos, ahora se ha quedado con los dos últimos, que son su única compañía. Octavia es agricultora y ganadera, con estas actividades puede mantener su hogar. Ella sabe muy bien cómo cuidar y alimentar a sus vacas para que pueda obtener leche necesaria para su venta los fines de semana y para la elaboración de quesos. Octavia espera incrementar sus ingresos y para ello necesita adquirir una vaca más, por lo que pide este préstamo, ella expone su caso para que con su ayuda pueda darle solución a su necesidad.

loans.use: Purchase a cow to increase sale of cheese and milk.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Don Gilberto is a photographer, but he also runs a small shop out of his home where he sells candy, soft drinks and enchiladas near a school in Managua. He's always looking for alternatives to supplement his income so he can support his family. He is married and his wife helps with the administration of the store. They have 3 children (15, 12 and 3 years of age), for whom Gilberto works hard in order to leave them equipped with a good future.

He has been working now for 20 years and began by selling candy. As time went on he became involved and grew his business with the other activities.

The loan Gilberto is requesting will be used to build a wall in his house and thus ensure the welfare of both his family and his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Don Gilberto se dedica al oficio de fotógrafo, pero también tiene una pulpería en su vivienda, y vende golosinas, refrescos y enchiladas en un colegio de Managua; todo esto en busca de alternativas que le pudieran brindar los ingresos para mantener a su familia. Es casado y su esposa le ayuda con la administración de la pulpería. Tiene 3 hijos de 15, 12 y 3 años de edad, para los cuales Gilberto trabaja arduamente para en un futuro dejarles un buen patrimonio a sus hijos. Tiene 20 años de haber empezado a ser comerciante y empezó vendiendo golosinas y con el paso del tiempo ha ido creciendo en estas tres actividades. El préstamo que Gilberto está solicitando es para construir un muro en su vivienda y así asegurar el bienestar tanto de su familia como de su negocio.

loans.use: For construction of a wall in his home .  (Construcción de un muro en su vivienda)

loans.name: Levy Abdiel

texts.es: El cliente Levy Abdiel  está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Cambiarle el zinc a la casa), trabaja como docente de la Escuela Miguel Larreynaga en colonia el Serrano a 25 km de Nueva Guinea,  desde hace 7 años.  Tiene 1 hija de 8 años de edad, estudia su 3er grado de Educación primaria en la colonia Yolaina. Actuamente él esta estudiando su segundo año  en la Univesidad  URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea. Poco a poco a ido construido su vivienda , él se siente agradecido con AFODENIC ya que con los créditos anteriores ha ido mejorando su casa. Su esposa trabaja como docente y le apoya con los gastos familiares,  su sueño es seguir  estudiando,  tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, salud  y estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The client Levy Abdiel is asking for a loan in order to invest it in bettering his life (To change the zinc of the house). He works as a teacher in the Miguel Larreynaga school in the community of Serrano, 25 km from Nueva Guinea, where he has been for 7 years. He has one daughter who is 8 years old. She is studying in 3rd grade of the primary school in the town of Yolaina. At the moment, he is studying in his second year at the University URACCAN Recinto, Nueva Guinea. Little by little he is able to improve his home. He feels grateful to AFODENIC because with the loans he has taken out in the past he has improved his house. His wife works as a teacher and helps with the family expenses. His dream is to continue studying, to have a home in a better condition, health, and work stability such that he can help his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To change the zinc on his home

loans.name: Maura Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Maura tiene 58 años de edad, habita en el barrio de Ticuantepe, es soltera y tiene un hijo mayor de edad, que le apoya para los gastos del hogar. El negocio de Doña Maura es la venta de ropa y cosméticos, tiene treinta años de experiencias y comenzó con esfuerzos propios. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para invertir en el negocio de las venta de ropa para ofertar variedad y estilo a sus clientes. Sus planes futuros es poder terminar de construir un anexo en su vivienda, para luego alquilarlo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maura is 58 years old, lives in the neighborhood of Ticuantepe, is single, and has an adult son, who helps her with the household expenses. Mrs. Maura’s business is selling clothes and cosmetics. She has 30 years of experience and began the business with her own efforts. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of clothing to offer variety and style to her clients. Her future plans are to be able to finish building an annex in her home, and then to rent it out.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes to invest in her business

loans.name: Sakun

texts.en: Mrs. Sakun S. is a villager in Bakuong Kang Keurt village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a 37-year-old  farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Mau Phuon, is a construction worker who earns a small salary. Their combined incomes are not enough to support their family, which includes three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Therefore, Mrs. Sakun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy a breeding cow

loans.name: Thi Huong

texts.vi: Chị Đỗ Thị Hương, sinh năm 1975(Mã số 010105030052),đây là lần đầu tiên chị tham gia vay vốn của tổ chức tài chính vi mô Bình Minh. Chị tham gia vay mức 1.972.000 vnđ để mua tre về đan chổi. Chồng chị hàng ngày đi làm thuê có thu nhập theo ngày, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.500.000 vnđ/ tháng. Được chị em giới thiệu, chị cùng vay với các chị em trong nhóm vay có 7 người. Được vay vốn chị rất vui và mong muốn được tham gia lâu dài như các chị em khác trong thôn và hứa sẽ hoàn trả vốn vay đầy đủ.
texts.en:
Mrs. Huong Thi D. was born in 1975. This is her first time participating in the Binh Minh fund. She joined with a loan of 1,972,000 VND to buy bamboo to weave brooms. Her husband works as labor for hire every day and gets paid daily. Her family's average income is 2,500,000 VND per month. She was introduced to the fund by her sisters and she is participating in a group loan of 7 people. She is very glad to be able to borrow from this fund and hopes to be a long time participant like her sisters in the town. She promises to repay the loan in full.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bamboo

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor pertenece al Bancomunal Mujeres del Futuro. Flor de Maria, no pudo terminar sus estudios se quedo en el tercero de media con el tiempo se llego a casar actualmente tiene 33 años y cuatro hijos de 11, 7 3 y él ultimo de 5 meses de nacido, los mayores están en la escuela.

Flor de Maria empezó a trabajar limpiando casas lo hizo por mucho tiempo después decidió dedicarse a la venta de frutas en el mercado de Sevilla por su barrio por tiempo de un año y medio pero siempre le engañaban, en un cajón le daban fruta buena y en la parte de abajo estaba fruta malograda  perdiendo  capital, entonces como sus hijitos estaban pequeñitos decidió dejar el negocio y abrir en su casa un pequeño bazar hace medio año y cuenta con la ayuda de su mama, también sigue trabajando  limpiando casas por horas, le da tiempo para estar con sus hijos.

Flor de Maria solicita un préstamo de Finca  de 400 para poder invertir en su negocio de bazar, va a comprar mercadería de ropa,  ella nos cuenta que ha aprendido hacer más responsable en los pagos valora mas las cosas, no le gusta endeudarse y esta feliz por que esta  ganando  más.
texts.en:
Flor is a member of the village bank Mujeres del Futuro. She was unable to finish her studies because she got married. She is now 33 years old with four children ages 11, 7, 3, and the youngest just 5 months. The oldest children are attending school. Flor began working as a housecleaner, but later decided to focus on selling fruits in the market of Sevilla in her neighbourhood. She did so for over a year and a half but kept being deceived by providers who would give her boxes with ripe fruits on top, but rotten fruit beneath, which made her lose money. Since her children were so young she decided to leave this business and open a small shop in her home, which she and her mother have run for the past year and a half. She also continues to clean houses part time which gives her time to spend with her children. Flor de Maria is requesting a loan of 400 soles in order to invest in her shop, she will use it to buy clothing for resale. She says that she has learned how to be more responsible with payments and to value things more highly. She does not want to be in debt and is happy to be earning more money.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing clothing for resale

loans.name: Ni Komang Sukra Ratmini

texts.id: Setelah menikah, kini  Ni Komang Sukra Ratmini mulai membuka warung kecil di depan rumahnya.Usaha ini dipilih karena  di daerah tempat  tinggalnya belum ada  usaha warung yang  menjadi saingan dalam usahanya. Barang yang dijual pun beraneka macam seperti makanan ringan dan kebutuhan pokok setiap hari bahkan sayur mayur.Setiap hari Ni Komang Sukra Ratmini membuka warung pada pukul 07.00 wita dan tutup pada pukul 18.00 wita. Karena warung ada didepan rumahnya, maka jika tidak ada pelanggan yang berbelanja Ni Komang Sukra Ratmini bisa melakukan pekerjaan rumah tangga lainnya. Dalam menjalankan usaha ini Ni Komang Sukra Ratmini membutuhkan  dana untuk menambah usaha warungnya karena pelanggannya banyak sedangkan modal yang dimiliki sangat terbatas. Disamping melayani konsumen secara individu untuk kepentingan sendiri, Ni Komang Sukra Ratmini juga menjadi suplyer bagi para pedagang yang lain yang lebih kecil karena modal yang mereka miliki sangat kecil dan terbatas. Sekarang setelah Ni Komang Sukra Ratmini mendapat tambahan modal ia dapat melayani para konsumen lebih banyak lagi dengan keuntungan bersih perhari  mencapai Rp.150.000,- yang dulunya hanya memperoleh keuntungan bersih perhari Rp 50.000. Usaha warung ini ditekuninya dengan harapan  kedepannya usaha warung dapat lebih meningkat dan menjadi lebih besar lagi dari sekarang.
texts.en:
Ni Komang Sukra Ratmini opens a small stall in front of her house. She has been in this business since she got married. She decided to open a small stall because there was no other stall in her neighborhood.

She sells various stuffs in her stall such as snacks and vegetables. She opens the stall from 7 am to 6 pm everyday. As she has the stall in her house so she still can do the daily house chores.

She needs additional working capital as her customers are increasing so she needs to stock up more merchandises. With additional working capital she is able to increase her daily net income from USD 4.5 to USD 13. She is hoping that she can expand her business even more.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add working capital

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en: Mrs. Sokunthea S. is a villager in the Thkouv Village in the Takeo Province. She is 29 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Aside from this business, she is a pig breeder as well. Her husband, Mr. Ly Thoeurn, is a motor-taxi driver. Additionally, he is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he has a problem because his field is too far from the irrigation system; thus, Mrs. Sokunthea S. decided to request a loan to buy a pump machine in order to allow water to support the field, making her crops more productive. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine to help irrigate the crops

loans.name: Andrey

texts.en:
Andrey is married with one child. He owns a small business that sells pop drinks (pop and mineral water) in bulk. His business is located at the market and many retail vendors get their goods from Andrey. Low prices and good client service help him to keep repeat clients. Andrey has been in this business for 5 years. This is the only income for this family.

Andrey would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to increase the assortment. Andrey is a talented entrepreneur and wants to develop his business even further.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of drinks

loans.name: Noel De Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Noel B. se dedica a su actividad agrícola en la ciudad de Estelí. Inicialmente Ceprodel le otorgo un crédito para la compra de un panel solar y posteriormente se le brindó crédito para compra de insumos para el cultivo de las papas  , los créditos le han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también a poder comprar los insumos a mas bajos precios y también a comprar lo necesario para la producción  de papas.

Hoy en día el motivo por el cual acude una vez mas a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un nuevo crédito para la compra de insumos químicos para la cosecha de papas y así poder tener una producción exitosa en su comunidad y beneficiar a su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Noel B. is a farmer in the city of Estelí. Ceprodel initially offered him a credit to buy a solar panel and then offered him a credit to buy supplies to grow potatoes. The credits have helped him improve his family's living conditions, to purchase supplies at lower prices, and to buy what he needs to grow potatoes. Today he is turning to Ceprodel one more time for a loan to buy chemicals for his potato harvest so he can have a successful production and benefit his family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chemicals for his potato harvest

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en: Felipe D. is a responsible man from Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City, Philippines. He is 56 years old. He is married and lives with his 6 children. Felipe is engaged in a kind of business known as "alacart." This is a food business, wherein you sell primarily chicken barbecue or pork barbecue. Alacart businesses are in demand. They're affordable and at the same time very tasty. Felipe has many local customers. He doesn't regret engaging in such a business. He has fed his family with this business. He is able to send his children to school and gain a college degree. Felipe is indeed a determined man. He is working hard for his business so that he can sustain the needs of his family. Felipe wants to impart his gratitude to the organization that supported his business, and that is HSPFI (a Kiva partner). Felipe believes that he could do more with his business if he had money to purchase additional ingredients for use in alacart vending. He is now asking for another loan amounting to 11,000.00 PHP. He is aiming for immediate approval of his request, for he wants to pursue his plan for expansion of his business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for his alacart business

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.en:
Mirzoali H.'s economic activity is agriculture, which he has dedicated himself to for several years. He is married and the father of 4 children. Mirzoali learned farming business from a young age and now has a lot of experience. It is very important to point out that his business requires a lot of effort, which is why he dedicates himself to growing potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, etc. This requires a lot of exposure to the sun as well as moving the product long distances. The reason why Mirzoali is requesting a loan from IMON International is to invest in technological assistance in cultivation. With this loan he will be able to succeed and have better opportunities for the sale of his products after the harvest. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 45 years old and married with six children. She sells firewood to make a living.

She hopes to receive a loan in the amount of N70,000 to purchase more firewood to sell.

She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida M. is from the village of Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 56 years old, is married, and has eight adult children. Aida owns and operates a business operating a specialized retail store, primarily selling vegetables in Cogon public market. She has been in this business for almost ten years. In 2008, Aida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Aida is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is 53 years old and married to Lolito. They are living a simple life in Barangay San Isidro in Cauayan City. The couple does not have any children so Zenaida manages their food-vending business full time. The business is located in the public market of Cauayan City. Her husband helps her in the business in order to generate higher income. This eatery business supports their daily needs.
