Lack of financial capital is the reason why she is asking to borrow PHP15,000.  She wants to expand her business with the financial support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Business Capital

location.town: Barangay San Isidro in Cauayan City

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora D. C. is a married 39-year-old woman who lives in a rented house in Dismariñas, Cavite. She has an eight-year-old son.	

For four years, Nora has run a business distributing mobile phone credit to small credit resellers. Last year, she expanded her business into selling mobile phone accessories, detergent, and other commodities. Her mobile phone credit business realizes profits of approximately 15,000 PHP per month, while her new commodities business is bringing in profits of approximately 10,000 PHP per month.

Nora is seeking a 50,000 PHP loan from CCT to further expand her business. Nora joined CCT in 2004 and successfully repaid a previous 50,000 PHP loan. Nora hopes to ultimately buy a house with the profits from her businesses.

loans.use: Additional capital for mobile phone credit and commodities businesses

loans.name: Rosavilla

texts.en:
Rosavilla S. is from the village of Katipa. She is 50 years old. Rosavilla is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rosavilla owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosavilla has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Rosavilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosavilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosavilla is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Rosavilla from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & for working capital

loans.name: Magelyn

texts.en:
Magelyn is already 41 years old. She is married to Melvito who happens to be a Barangay treasurer in their village. They are blessed with four children of whom two are still studying, one in college and one in high school. Their family lives in the mountainside of Barangay Capellan, Ilagan, Isabela.

Magelyn manages her improving direct-selling business in which she invites most of her neighbors and friends to place their orders from her Avon, Natasha and MSE brochures. She generates 25% commission for every PHP 100 of sold products. To further increase her credit line with these companies, she is requesting a loan of PHP 16,000 from Kiva lenders.

Magelyn also wants to help her husband to purchase other necessary items for their farm, like fertilizers, pesticides and so on, by increasing her commission from her direct-selling business. They are hoping to have development and growth both in her direct-selling business and in their agriculture business managed by her husband. They also hope to give their children a complete education, especially for those who are interested in studying.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Eli

texts.fr: G. Eli  est une jeune femme âgée de 23 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle habite à Lomé quartier Awatame.  Elle fait  le commerce des assiette. Avec ce prêt, elle voulait renforcer son commerce en achetant de divers assiettes pour revendre. Avec ce bénéfice, elle voudrait aider son mari dans ses devoirs de  famille.
texts.en:
G. Eli is a young woman, 23 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She lives in Lomé in the Awatame district.  She has a business selling plates.  With this loan, she would like to bolster her business by buying an assortment of plates for resale.  With the profits, she would like to help her husband with his family duties.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To diversify her commerce

loans.name: Tekove Pora Rekavo Group

texts.es:
Todas las mujeres destinan sus creditos para el sustento de sus actividades comerciales que les permite obtener pequeños margenes de ganancias para sostener sus gastos diarios en alimentos, educación de sus hijos, gastos  de salud, y para reinvertir en sus negocios.
Como veremos en la descripción de sus negocios, todas estas actividades requieren dedicación y mucho esfuerzo a la par de asumir riesgos altos ya que las señoras conocen básicamente la administración de un negocio.
Todas estas  mujeres forman parte de un programa de desarrollo social y económico denominado Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras impulsado por la Fundación Paraguaya , ofreciendo a las involucradas una gama de capacitaciones por ciclo de vida del comité, y un apoyo financiero para que las mismas cuenten con un capital operativo que netamente invierten en sus respectivos negocios.
Por este hecho el Comité Tekove pora rekavo , que significa `` Buscando  una vida mejor ´´agradece  a la Fundación Paraguaya por la confianza puesta en personas de status relativamente baja (que son ellas) que son discriminados en el mundo de las oportunidades hasta la actualidad, pero que aún así la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva les brinda su apoyo.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderias para la elaboración de chipa (maiz, harina, huevo,), compra de ropas para venta y frutas para la elaboración de jugos y dulce.

loans.name: Preab

texts.en: Mrs. Preab L. is a low-income 35 years of age. She currently depends on selling fish from home to home around the commune. She sells fish that she either gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier. Preab L. is a humble mother who has been blessed with two school-aged children. Now the river is full of fish due to the coming fish season. Preab L.’s husband can’t catch a lot of fish because he lacks tools to use for the fishing activities. Therefore, Preab L. has decided to seek a loan of US$400 which will enable her husband to purchase more tools to fish.

loans.use: To purchase more tools to fish

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
le sr. MIGUEL ANGEL Z. H. tiene 24 años de dedicarse la elaboracion y venta de bloques de concreto para construccion de casas y edificios , este producto tiene mucha demanda en la zona
ya que la mayoria de las construcciones emplean este tipo de material por ser mas economico y resistente
El Sr. Z. nos manifesto que este negocio le es de mucha bendicion ya que le ha generado ingresos para cubrir sus gastos personales y las obligaciones finanacieras que el ha contraido. Su esposa a sido de gran apoyo para salir adelante con su pequeña empresa.
su meta es poder fabricar mas bloques y asi poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel Z. H. is 24 years old and works manufacturing and selling concrete blocks for the construction of houses and commercial buildings. There is great demand for this product in the area; most local constructions use this type of material because it is resistant and economical. Mr. Z. tells us that this business has been a great blessing for him, since it has generated income to cover his personal expenses and the financial obligations he has contracted. His wife has been a great support in helping him develop his small enterprise. His goal is to be able to produce more blocks and thus provide a better quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cement and sand

loans.name: Xiomara Elizabeth

texts.es: La joven Xiomara M. su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapato desde hace dos años comenzó su negocio, la idea comenzó por su mama para que se ayudara económicamente y de esa manera apoyarla sus padres dieron el dinero para que comprara ropa  y tenga sus propio ingreso y no depender solo de su esposo, el trabaja como conductor y su salario  es bajo. Y están ahorrando ya que están comenzando hacer su casa  y desean terminarla pronto para una mejor privacidad, y estar en mejores condiciones.  Tiene 21 años de edad y con una bonita niña de 4 años de edad el cual cuida su mama cuando sale a vender  ambulante oh a entregar la ropa a sus clientes que le hacen pedidos, vende al contado y al crédito de quincena, las dificultades que ha tenido es que a veces no le pagan en la fecha y retarda sus pagos. Con este crédito quiere aumentar la copra de ropa variada para dama, caballero y niños, juguetes, ya que las ventas mejoran en esta época de navidad lo cual espera ganar su buen dinero para la inversión de su casa. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad del préstamo para elevar las ventas y por el progreso familiar.
texts.en:
Xiomara M. started her business of selling clothes and shoes two years ago. The idea started with her mother so that she could help her economically. As a way of helping her, her parents gave her the money to buy clothes so that she would have her own income and not be dependent solely on her husband. He is a driver, and his salary is low. They are saving because they are starting to build their house. They want to finish it soon to have more privacy and to be in better conditions. She is 21, and she has a pretty four year old daughter. Her mother takes care of her daughter when Xiomara leaves to sell on the street or to deliver clothing orders to her customers. She sells for cash and for credit every two weeks on payday. The problem she has had is that sometimes they do not pay on time, and their payments are delayed. With this loan she wants to buy toys and more clothing for women, men, and children. Sales improve during this Christmas season. Therefore, she hopes to earn good money to invest in her house. She is grateful to the institution for the opportunity of the loan to increase her sales and for her family’s progress.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and a variety of shoes for children and adults

loans.name: Nelith

texts.es:
La señora Nelith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Mujeres Talentosas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 23 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun depende de ella.

Su espíritu luchador, que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de artesanías, ya que habiendo estudiado cursos de manualidades no dudo en ejercer ese conocimiento e implementar su propio negocio, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en esta actividad. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, ubicado en su misma casa donde vende todo el día también sale  a ofrecer casa por casa los productos que vende  a sus amistades. 
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará materiales como: pashaca, huairuro, achira, rosarios, mostacillas, todo esto los comprará en kilos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra una vitrina, donde pueda exhibir sus productos, a sus clientes.
  
Nelith, se siente muy joven, tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Nelith belongs to the communal bank, "Las Mujeres Talentosas II" (Talented Women II) in the district of Tarapoto, in the province of San Martin, in the department of San Martin. She lives with her boyfriend, is 23, and has two children who are her dependents. She has always been characterized by her fighting spirit and her desire to get ahead through her own means. This led her to start her own business selling craftwork, since she had been taking a course in this area, she didn't hesitate in executing this knowledge and starting her own business. Little by little, she made herself known among her customers and today she tells us that it's going very well for her. Currently she is continuing with the same business, which is located in her house where she sells every day. She also goes out to offer her products to friends by going from house to house. With this loan of 800 PEN, she will invest in the purchase of a display case where she can show her products to her customers. Nelith feels very young, calm, and happy with what she does and is thankful to Manuela Ramos for contributing to her fulfilling her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy materials to make her products

loans.name: Sha Begam Group

texts.en:
Sha Begam is the group leader of this group. There are four members in this group. Sha Begam is a married woman with six children; four daughters and two sons. They are in school. She wants to take a loan for her general store. She hopes to improve her business by bringing new changes to her business. She is confident that she will repay her loan on time and will take the second cycle loan after the full repayment of the first cycle loan soon.

Sayada and Shogofa want to take a loan for their carpet-weaving business. They want to expand their business. Gull Zada wants to take a loan for her husband’s taxi business. He needs this loan because it enables him to run his business. They have requested a group loan of 40000 Afghani.

They want to thank all lenders to AFSG and Kiva for helping the poor people of Afghanistan.

loans.use: Buy necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: Midou

texts.en:
Midou A. is the divorced mother of three children. She works selling fabrics for clothing in the Kégué region of Lomé. She has approached WAGES for her first loan, which will be used to resupply her stock. She will purchase a variety of fabrics from popular brands such as HiTarget and Phoenix.

This loan will help Ms. A. support both her business and her family.

loans.use: To buy fabrics that will be used to make and sell clothing

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
La señora Jacinta es socia del Banco Comunal “Alto Alianza” desde hace 1 año, vive en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y  venta de ropa.

Jacinta nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo recibido del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital y comprar mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir.

Ella requiere un nuevo crédito  de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar ropa al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro es hacer crecer su negocio y así progresar junto a su familia.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros,la puntualidad y las charlas que imparte la promotora.
texts.en:
Jacinta has been a member of the community bank "Alto Alianza" for one year. She lives in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the department of Puno. She is 38 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children. She completed her primary education, and she sells and buys clothing. Jacinta told us that with the first loan she received from Movimiento Maneula Ramos, which was for 300 soles, she increased her business capital and bought a greater quantity of clothes. She requests a new loan of 2,000 soles ($725) with which she will buy clothes in bulk. Her dream for the future is to grow her business and in this way move herself and her family forward. The things she likes most about the community bank are the savings, the punctuality, and the talks that the organizer gives.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Samadhodja

texts.ru: Баходурходжаев Самадходжа проживает  в городе Куляб. Возраст, 52 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Баходурходжаев Самадходжа таксистом работает более 4 лет. Он занимается перевозками. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en:
Samadhodja B. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 62 years old, married and has 4 children. Samadhodja has been working as a taxi driver for over 4 years. He is involved in transport. He is requesting this loan for car repairs in order to provide safe service.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en: Ritchel, 28, is a rice farmer and hog raiser in Surallah, South Cotabato. She has a 7-month old child. She started her business in 2007. She's now requesting a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner, for 10,000 Philippine pesos. This will enable her to buy farm supplies and feed for her piggery. She manages a 1-hectare rice field and owns one pig. She wants someday to make her business successful.

loans.use: Farm inputs and feeds

loans.name: Fatoumata Néné

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Fatoumata Néné D. est une jeune commerçante au quartier Cité Niakh Thiès. Elle est âgée de 23 ans et vend le petit déjeuner, le diner et des habits depuis presque deux ans. Elle a héritée ce commerce de sa grande sœur qui lui a légué le business pour aller rejoindre son mari. Cependant Mademoiselle D. qui aidait sa sœur à ce travail pense que les rapports avec la clientèle est la plus importante dans le business.  
Membre de U-IMCEC depuis 2 ans, Mademoiselle D.,  après le prêt qu’elle a soldé il y’a 2 mois, sollicite un prêt de 200 000 FCFA pour s’équiper en robes, chaussures destinées á sa vente. Elle compte avec cet investissement placer à crédit ses produits à sa clientèle qui vont lui régler par fréquences pré-établies pendant la vente. Avec les bénéfices qu’elle espère gagner, Mademoiselle D. compte aider sa maman à la charge de la maison et régler ses propres.
texts.en:
Miss Fatoumata Néné D. is a young merchant in the Cité Niakh neighborhood of Thiès. She is 23 years old, and has been selling breakfast, lunches and clothing for almost two years. She inherited the business from her elder sister who left it to join her husband. Miss D., who previously helped her sister run the business, believes that customer relations are the most important part of doing business. Miss D. has been a member of U-IMCEC for two years, has finished reimbursing a loan two months ago, and is now requesting a loan for 200,000 FCFA to acquire clothes and shoes for resale. With this investment she intends to offer the option of credit payments to her customers, with a payback frequency established at the time of sale. With her projected earnings, Miss D. will assist her mother with household expenses and take care of her own needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Resupply products

loans.name: Erika De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La Sra. C. tiene 17 años de experiencia en el negocio, ella fue ere dedada de su mama en este rubro actualmente tiene una pulpería y un comedor para brindarle más atención al cliente. 
Ella esta solicitando el crédito para surtir su venta y comprar más productos de lo que no tiene ya que piensa vender ropa también.
texts.en:
Sra. C. has 17 years of experience in the business that she inherited from her mother. She currently manages a general store and a diner where she spends most of her time tending to her customers. The loan she is requesting will be used to restock her store by purchasing products that she does not have. She also has plans to sell clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her store with more merchandise

loans.name: Virgen Inmaculada De Concepcion (Virgin Of The Immaculate Conception) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Inmaculada Concepción D. Tambocucho, inicia su primer ciclo con 10 socias.
Las socias son D. L. Comunidad D. Tambocucho, L. población se dedica a L. crianza D. animales y L. agricultura.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. animales, cereales, abarrotes en general, crianza D. animales y L. agricultura.
Como es el Caso D. L. Señora. Teodora que es soltera y no tiene hijo, Teodora tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, además venD. animales menores, quesos que compra en su comunidad y también se dedica a L. agricultura, el préstamo que obtendrá será invertido en L. compra D. quesos que venderá en L. ciudad D. Ayacucho. Los sueños D. Teodora son que sus hermanos menores sean profesionales.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 100 soles, 200 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 3,500 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The community bank called Virgin of the Immaculate Conception in Tambocucho began its first loan cycle with 10 members. The members are from the community of Tambocucho, and this population raises animals and works in agriculture. The members have different businesses, such as selling animals, grains, and groceries, raising animals, and working in agriculture. Description of the case of Miss Teodora: she is single and does not have children. She has a store in her house where she sells general groceries. She also sells small animals and cheese that she buys in her community, and she works in agriculture. The loan that she will receive will be invested in the purchase of cheese that she will sell in the city of Ayacucho. Teodora’s dreams are that her younger brothers have professional careers. The members need different amounts of loans such as 100 soles, 200 soles, 1000 soles, giving a total of 3,500 soles of loans in the community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cheese

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios F. is a hardworking entrepreneur determined to improve her family's standard of living. She is already widowed with two children.  As a busy entrepreneur, she has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for almost three years.  

To build her business, Remedios would like to receive a loan of 10,000 PHP to increase the inventory of goods sold in her sari-sari store.  She is planning to purchase additional products such as cases of soft drinks, sugar, cooking oil, liquors, salt, shampoo and other supplies.  Remedios believes that offering a wide assortment of goods to customers will increase traffic to her store and maintain customer loyalty in the village.

Her long term goals are to provide a better future for her family, sustain the profitability of her store and start a savings account for her children’s future.  Through hard work and determination, Remedios is focused on improving her quality of life with the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her store.

loans.name: Centeno Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Centenos está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Martha Rosaria Martínez M. de 53 años quien decidió poner con la liquidación un pequeño negocio que consiste en la venta de gaseosa, quesos, helados y pollo en lo cual invertirá el préstamo.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Lucrecia del Carmen C. quien desde hace quince años vende delantales los cuales distribuye en el mercado Oriental y Güembés y Heling de los Ángeles S. hace siete años inicio con su pequeño negocio de bordados el cual ha mantenido.
texts.en:
The Los Centenos group is composed of three hard-working women one of whom is Martha Rosaria Martínez M., 53. She used her severance pay to set up a small business consisting of soft-drink, cheese, frozen treats and chicken sales; she will use the funds to buy stock merchandise. Her fellow group members are Lucrecia del Carmen C. who has sold aprons for the last 15 years in the Oriental y Güembés market and Heling de los Ángeles S. who started a small embroidery shop seven years ago that she still has.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For soft-drinks, cheese, frozen treats and chicken.

loans.name: Filerma Narciza

texts.es:
Filerma se considera una gran socia responsable del banco comunal Dulce Amistad que se reúne desde hace varios ciclos en el cantón Rocafuerte en la productiva y fructífera costa manabita, nuestra socia tiene como actividad confeccionar ropa para todas las edades.

La señora Filerma viene ejerciendo la profesión de modista desde hace 30 años para ello se preparó en varios cursos que se han dictado en el sector donde vive, para poner en practica lo aprendido estuvo por varios meses trabajando en un taller de creaciones donde solo trabajó con materiales de felpa para realizar manualidades, esto le sirvió de mucho para poder dedicarse de lleno a la costura y hacer de ella su sustento.

En los actuales momentos la señora Filerma esta muy dedicada a su trabajo, tiene que dedicarle mucho tiempo porque la demanda es alta, se dedica a confeccionar licras, pijamas y ropa deportiva, con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en comprar telas y todo lo necesario para coser, tiene que trasladarse hasta la capital manabita Portoviejo a realizar las comprar donde están los grandes almacenes con todas la novedades y de esta manera seguir con éxito en su labor y no quedar mal en los pagos de la Fundación.
texts.en:
Filerma is considered a great and responsible member of the communal bank Dulce Amistad (Sweet Friendship). She has attended since a few loan cycles ago in the Rocafuerte canton in the productive and fruitful Manabita coast. Our member makes clothes for all ages. Filerma has been in the profession of clothes making since 30 years ago. She prepared for this in various courses in the area where she lives. To put in practice what she learned she worked for a few months in a tailoring workshop where she worked with plush to make handicrafts. This served her greatly to be able to dedicate herself fully to sewing and use it to make her living. Currently, Filerma is very dedicated to her work. She has dedicated a lot of time to it as the demand is high. She focuses on making Lycras, pajamas, and sportswear. With this new credit, she could invest in buying fabrics and everything necessary to sew. She will have to move to the capital of Manabita, Portoviejo, to be able to buy where there are large warehouses, and in this way successfully continue in her work and not default in the payments to the Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Gerrit Larsen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cloths, zippers, buttons, and thread.

loans.name: Burombe Bakyara Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
A determined B. Robert, aged 50 years, is a diligently focused and determined man who has a dream of owning his own big shoemaking business in Rukungiri. At present, Robert runs a small business that he began fifteen years ago in Rukungiri Town selling shoes, socks and gumboots. This business earns him a profit of 400,000 shillings on a monthly basis.

The prospects of future success for this married father of seven, don't look bad given his enterprise and his milk-sales and pig-husbandry side-businesses that help him eke out more profits.

Robert began as a retailer before he, at length, decided he would have a niche in his current business. He wants to run a wholesale shoemaking business in the future and is looking at buying a shoemaking machine. This loan will, for now, help him restock his business with new shoes, shoe polish and gum boots for resale, thus enabling him to earn more sales revenue.

loans.use: To purchase new shoes, gumboots and shoe polish for his business

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard T. is from Iligan City. He is 20 years old. Richard is single. To make a living, Richard owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Richard has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Richard joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richard is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Richard from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora Luz Marina G. P., es una joven de 28 años casada y habita en el Barrio Laureles Norte, su esposo es comerciante y le apoya en la economía domestica, tienen un hijo pequeño de un año, ella se dedica a la venta de bisuterías, desde hace mas de 10 años, ya tiene su clientela fija a la que le oferta y son de muy buena paga.

Fue con el Apoyo de sus padres que le brindaron un apoyo económico para la compra de sus primeras mercaderías, dentro de  sus planes a futuro está la inversión en la compra de materiales para la instalación en un tramo del mercado central de Managua, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de cemento, laminas de zinc, perlines que le permitan las remodelaciones para su vivienda, su pequeño negocio a contribuido en gran medida al mejor progreso de toda su familia que beneficien sus niveles socioeconómicamente de todos los miembros de la familia.
texts.en:
Luz Marina G. P. is a young woman of 28 years. She is married and lives in Laureles Norte neighborhood of Managua. Her husband is a businessman and supports the household. They have a one-year-old son. Luz has worked selling costume jewelry for more than ten years and has regular customers. Her parents offered her economic support to get started, buying her first merchandise. In the future, she plans to open a stall in the central market of Managua. Luz is seeking a loan to buy materials to improve her house. She needs to buy cement, metal roofing and trusses. Her small business has contributed to the economic well being of her whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Jeffrey Hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, roofing, and trusses for home

loans.name: Takhmina

texts.en:
Takhmina A. is a 24-year-old woman who is married and has one son. Together with her husband, she breeds cattle.

Takhmina sells cattle to the local butchers for a profitable price and her monthly profit is 150-250 AZN. She has seven years of experience in this field.

Cattle breeding is the only source of income for Takhmina’s family. She applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in order to purchase two calves.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de Managua, la señora Adriana A. es propietaria de una pequeña ferretería donde ofrece todo tipo de productos en el ramo atendiendo una cantidad de clientes por lo que busca la manera de cubrir sus demandas de productos ferreteros.

Hoy en día, solicita el crédito para la compra de los productos ferreteros entre los que se encuentran zinc, perlines, pintura y tubería. Para esto espera que su crédito le sea otorgado y de esta manera proceder a la compra a los proveedores de estos productos.
texts.en:
Adriana A. owns a small hardware store in Managua's wholesale market. She offers all kinds of hardware products to her clients. She strives to please them by satisfying their needs through her inventory purchases. She now requests the loan to purchase hardware products such as zinc metal sheets, crossbeams, paint and tubing. She hopes her loan will be granted and she will be able to purchase the products from her vendors.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hardware

loans.name: Violette

texts.en: Violette is 35 years old and married to a tailor. She has four children who range in age from six to 13 years old. All of her children attend school. Violette makes a living by selling a variety of products, including sunflower oil, dried fish and cloth. She has been in this line of work for 14 years, and regularly travels to Burundi to buy the products that she sells in her town's local market. Her shop is popular, in part because she holds an annual sale where she provides goods to her clients for a discount. Violette has applied for a loan to buy more products to sell to her customers. Eventually, she hopes to open a wholesale business where she will sell various types of fabric, and use her increased income to buy her own piece of land.

loans.use: To buy new items to sell to her customers

loans.name: San Juana

texts.es: San Juana Díaz M. es madre soltera de un a niño al que quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y por quien sale adelante. Por el momento ella requiere un préstamo para levantar cimientos al frente de su vivienda para empezar a construir una barda y así su casa quede protegida de algún delincuente. Para poder realizar su proyecto pide el apoyo para comprar material de construcción.
texts.en:
San Juana Díaz M. is a single mother of a son for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life and for whom she attempts to gets ahead. At the moment she needs a loan to build the foundations to build a wall in front of her house so that her house will have protection against delinquents. To do this project she is asking for help to buy the building materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build foundations for a wall.

loans.name: Oam

texts.en: Oam P., 69, is married and lives with one of her children in the Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$1 each day and are supported by one child who works in a garment factory. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Oam P. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$700 to purchase fertilizer and a motorbike for her child to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and a motorbike.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Maruja; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de restaurant que queda ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca provincia de Anta, ella atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mesas para el restaurant.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “RICCHARY ANTEÑA” cooperative bank.  The bank is located in the Izcuchaca district, which belongs to the Anta province of the Cusco department.

She is Mrs. Maruja, a 39-year-old single mother with 3 children.  She alternates her daily activities in her restaurant, located in the Izcuchaca province of Anta.  She tends to the business from 9 am until 7 pm.  Through this enterprise, she helps her children get ahead.

The member would like to improve her restaurant, and requests a loan in order to buy tables for her business.  She thanks everyone who takes part in this dream of hers via this medium, and commits to making her payments in the time allotted.

loans.use: To purchase tables for her restaurant.

loans.name: Kenya Del Socorro

texts.es:
Kenya de  30 años de edad es casada con el Sr. Donald Sandoval Cucalon quien asume los gastos familiares, habitan en la Comarca El Jobo, jurisdiccion de Tecolostote; Kenia y su esposo poseen una pequeña parcela de 3 manzanas donde produce leche, cuajada y comercializan Ganado obteniendo asi sus propios ingresos mensuales el cual les permite desarrollarse economicamente y brindarle a su familia las condiciones necesarias del hogar.
 
Esta solicitando su primer credito para compra de ternero de desarrollo, y asi poco a poco ir acumulando su propio inventario ganadero que le permitira brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, Kenya se siente muy agradecida con el apoyo del Financimiento que brinda Kiva a estos Sectores pues asi puede irse desarrollando de manera individual en el mercado de la produccion .  

Su sueño es llegar a ser una persona con alta experiencia en el sector de la Ganaderia y poder sacar adelante a su Familia, pues es el patrimonio que dejara a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Kenya, 30, lives with her husband, Donald Sandoval Cucalón, who takes on the family expenses, in her house next door to the El Jobo School in Tecolostote.  She owns a 3 manzana plot where milk and cottage-like cheese is produced and sold.  She also raises cattle to earn her own monthly income to help their economic development.

She is asking for her first loan to buy a calf.  Kenya is very grateful for the financing Kiva offers to these sectors in order to get ahead in the production market.

Her dream is to become major cattle producer and thus move her family ahead in life.

loans.use: Compra de terneros

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma C. is from the village of Poblacion, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Gemma is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns and operates a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals to customers like chicken and pork adobo, paksiw, hot and spicy chicken and pancit to the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients and working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw ingredients and working capital.

loans.name: Dios Con Nosotros Group

texts.es:
El comité se formo en el Asentamiento 15 de Enero de la  Zona Espiritu  Santo del Barrio Barcequillo, por medio de otro grupo que trabaja en la misma zona, el comité cuenta actualmente con 15 integrantes todas vecinas entre si.
La Sra. Licia es una de las integrantes y cuenta con un depósito de mercaderías varias, tales como pañales, enlatados, golocinas, y todo tipo de productos no perecederos que los distribuye en menores cantidades para su venta en despensas, almacenes, etc.
Desea ampliar el negocio adquiriendo más variedad de mercaderías (enlatados, no perecederos), teniendo en cuenta la demanda existente y la calidad de sus productos, para así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This committee was founded in the 15 de Enero sub-division of Espíritu Santo district, in the Barcequillo neighborhood through another group which works in the same district.  The committee currently has 15 members who are all neighbors.

Licia is one of the group's members and she has a warehouse for various merchandise such as diapers, canned goods, candies and all kinds of non-perishable products which she distributes in smaller quantities to be sold in grocery stores, etc.

Licia would like to expand her business by acquiring a greater variety of merchandise (canned, non-perishable goods), taking into account the existing demand and the quality of her products, so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: To acquire non-perishable, canned goods for resale

loans.name: Hermilita

texts.en:
Hermilita is persistent in working towards her dream of making her doormat-making business more profitable. Despite having difficulty maintaining her business, Hermilita is hopeful that someday her dream will land in the palm of her hand. She cannot reinvest her profits into her business as it is also the main source of her family's daily expenditures. To make her dream happen, Hermilita wants to request a much larger loan to support the needs of her business and at the same time to sustain its operation. 

With her great passion for giving her children a better future and decent way of life, she will be willing to work hard and supplement her husband’s irregular income.

As a loving mother, Hermilita’s dreams are always for her three children and family. She wants to bring her children a higher quality of life, out of poverty. In 2006, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She hopes to secure access to capital for the continuation of her business. Her previous loans were carefully used as additional and rolling capital for her doormat-making business. 

Hermilita is hopeful that her business will grow and that someday she will have more customers around the village. She also dreams of sending all her children to school until college so that they can get better jobs.

loans.use: To support the needs of her business and at the same time to sustain its operation.

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng E. is a houswife. She is married and resides with her husband and a child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. 

The family has to spend US $30 on food, $5 on electricity, and $15 on other necessary expenses every month. 

Her child is employed at a hotel, earning an income of US $4 per day to help cover the family expenses. E. is requesting a loan of US $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her child to commute to work. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child to commute to work

loans.name: Jessica Mercedes

texts.es:
Jessica de 29 años, es una mujer divorciada que tiene dos hijos de 14 y 8 años a su cargo. Ella siempre quiso trabajar desde la casa para poder cuidar a sus hijos y tener dinero suficiente para darle lo que ellos necesiten.  

Comenzó a trabajar viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas como comerciante informal. Después de algún tiempo ella obtuvo su pequeño local en donde vende papelería, artículos de bazar etc. Trabaja desde las 08h30am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Vende juguetes, cuadernos, plumas, etc. 

Quiere en el futuro continuar con su negocio y agrandarlo mas por eso quiere comenzar comprando mas mercadería con el préstamo tales como juguetes, papelería, cuadernos.
texts.en:
Jessica, age 29, is divorced and has two children under her care.  The children are 14 and 8 years old.  She always wanted to work from her house in order to take care of her children and to have enough money to give them what they need.

She started to work as an informal merchant living in an urban zone called Orquídeas.  After some time, she got a small place where she sells stationery and bazaar items, etc.  She works from 8:30 a.m. until 10:00 pm. every day.  She sells toys, notebooks, and pens, etc.

In the future she wants to continue with her business and expand it.  To do so, she wants use the loan to start buying things like toys, stationery, and notebooks.

loans.use: Toys and stationery

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while the other one is still young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a retail shop for the past four years, selling retail to her neighbours and passersby. Mishi hopes to open a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and coconuts for resale

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en: Josianne, 39 years old and married to a doctor, has five children ranging in age from 10 to 17 years. Josianne owns a shop that sells snacks such as cakes and biscuits. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more snacks and make more profits which she will reinvest into her enterprise. This business, together with her husband's earnings, has enabled her to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: Buying snacks to sell

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando started his business 22 years ago.  He invested in rice farming.  He tills his land himself and plants rice crops.  He sells his harvest to his community.  Armando is happy that his business is improving little by little.  He is the provider in his family that's why he works hard to sustain his family.

Armando is applying for a loan of 20,000 PHP which he will use to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for his 3 children's education.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, de 40 años es un hombre evangélico. Él predica la palabra de Díos y a pesar de que no vive con su familia, se siente dichoso de habitar en la iglesia donde se reúnen con sus demás compañeros. Ubicada en la localidad de Sangani (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de medicinas naturales, para aquellas personas que sufren de alguna enfermedad, asimismo vende ollas quirúrgicas. Pero la verdadera actividad que le apasiona es la realización de injertos de plantas, los cuales realiza con el apoyo de un asistente. Los principales frutos que injerta son el cacao, cítricos y mango. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver crecer las semillas de los frutos. Según afirma son pocos los que se dedican a la elaboración de injertos; existe gran demanda porque la mayoría de los agricultores buscan injertos para sus plantaciones. Pero el principal inconveniente de Pedro, es el capital de trabajo, ya que para el proceso necesita un promedio de 10 mil soles. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Gedeon de los olivos”, y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde siente que puede encontrar el apoyo que tanto necesita para poder seguir con su actividad. Pedro, se está preparando para la campaña de siembra de cacao, por ello con el crédito que solicita, está pensando comprar semillas de cacao, que colocará en bolsas negras para la realización de los injertos.
texts.en: Pedro, 40 years old, is a protestant man. He preaches the word of God and although he does not live with his family, he feels fortunate to live at the church they attend along with their friends. The church is located in the town of Sangani, in the central Peruvian rainforest zone. Pedro earns a living selling natural medicines as well as stainless steel cookware. However, his third job, which he is most passionate about, is grafting plants. He does this with the help of an assistant. The main plants he grafts are cocoa beans, citrus fruits, and mangos. What he likes most about this job is seeing the seeds grow into trees. According to Pedro, there are very few people who work in grafting, yet there is a large demand since the majority of farmers seek out grafts for their farms. The main setback for Pedro is working capital since he needs an average of 10,000 soles for the process. He belongs to the "Gedeon de los Olivos" Communal Bank. This is his fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, through which he feels he can find the support he so badly needs to be able to continue his work. Pedro is preparing for the cocoa bean planting season, and for this reason he is planning to buy cocoa beans with the loan he is requesting, which he will place is large black bags for making the grafts.

loans.use: To buy cocoa beans

loans.name: Akos Mawusse

texts.fr: Madame Mawusse  est mariée  avec un enfant à charge.  Elle est née en 1987 à Agou et habite quartier Hedzranawoé. Elle fait le commerce de  produit générique à côté du marché local de Hedzranawoé.  Elle a commencé en 2006 et achète ces produits au Ghana à Accra. Elle espère augmenter son commerce et sollicite un crédit pour se réapprovisionner.
texts.en: Mrs. E. is married with one dependent child.  She was born in 1987 at Agou and lives in the Hedzranawoé district.  She sells generic products next to the Hedzranawoé local market.  She started this business in 2006 and buys her products in Ghana at Accra.  She hopes to grow her business and is requesting a loan to stock up.

loans.use: To buy generic products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a shop and expand her husband's business

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

For the past over one year, she has operated a cassava selling business, she sells at the market to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanapili dreams of expanding and establishing a food stall in the future. With the Kshs 40,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase sacks of cassava for resale at the market. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cassave for resale.

loans.name: Rosemaridel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosemaridel works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from cosmetics. Rosemaridel is borrowing 19,000 Philippines pesos through NWTF to buy an additional sidecar for her motorcycle for her tricycle-transport business.

Rosemaridel has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy an additional sidecar for her tricycle business.

loans.name: Abdou Samandi

texts.fr: Abdou Samandi est né le 09 Septembre 1981. Abdou Samandi est marié à Choukourath, une marchande. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, dont deux sont les leurs. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Abdou Samandi vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Abdou Samandi assure en grande partie les diverses charges de la famille, mais se fait aider parfois par sa femme. Abdou Samandi n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire, mais a appris ensuite le métier de couture, activité qu’il exerce depuis cinq ans et qui lui permet de nourrir sa famille. Abdou Samandi s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Afin de satisfaire davantage sa clientèle et de mieux équiper son atelier de couture par l’acquisition d’une machine à broder, Abdou Samandi sollicite pour une deuxième fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Abdou Samandi was born on September 9, 1981. Abdou Samandi is married to Choukourath, a seller. The couple is responsible for four children; two of them are their own. Some of the children attend school. Abdou Samandi lives together with his wife and children. He takes care of most of the family’s expenses but sometimes gets help from his wife. He only attended primary school but then learned sewing. He has been practicing this activity for five years, which allows him to feed his family. He gets his supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.

Abdou Samandi is requesting the support of ALIDé for the second time, in order to better meet his customers’ demand and to better outfit his sewing workshop with the purchase of an embroidery machine.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Buenadelia

texts.en: Buenadelia is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Buenadelia has a retail shop that sells tin made products like kitchen sinks & kitchen utensils. She has had this business for 34 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw materials needed to make the tin utensils. Buenadelia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Buenadelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed to make tin utensils

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: Emiliana de 29 años casado con Andrés de 33 años de edad con quien tiene 2 hijos, Kelly de 14 y Andrés de 5 años, con quienes viven en una casa propia  en el centro poblado de Canayre  del distrito de LLochegua. Emiliana se dedica en la compra y venta de cacao, actividad que lo realiza en compañía de su esposo durante 06 años. Considera muy rentable este negocio, ya que son muchos los campesinos que ofrecen los sacos de cacao que cosechan, dependiendo de la calidad es que Emiliana los compra por sacos, luego se convierte en una intermediara comercial para venderlos a varios ciudades. Su única dificultad es que debe transportarlos hacia el distrito de Pichari o LLochegua, que es ahí donde se encuentran las grandes acopiadoras, pues ellos no llegan hacia Canayre por el mal estado de las carreteras y más aún que no cuenta con movilidad propia. Es por tal motivo que Emiliana recurre a MFP para poder solicitar un crédito, para incrementar su capital y poder acopiar un volumen más alto, de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Emiliana es una mujer de buenos principios y  colaboradora en su banco comunal. Con los 3.000 nuevos soles acopiará más volúmenes de granos de cacao.
texts.en:
Emiliana is 29 years old and married to Andrés, age 33. They have two children, Kelly (age 14) and Andrés (age 5). Emiliana lives in her own home in the central village of Canayre in the District of Llochegua. She buys and sells cacao. Emiliana and her husband have managed this business together for the past six years. She considers her business to be profitable because there are many farmers who offer her sacks of cacao that they have harvested. Depending on the quality of the product, Emiliana will buy the sacks of cacao and sell them to a commercial broker who distributes them in different cities. Her only difficulty is transporting her goods to the either the District of Pichari or Llochegua, where the large collection centers are located. She is not able to travel to Canayre due to the bad condition of the roads as well as not having her own mode of transportation.

For this reason, Emiliana has returned to MFP to request a loan. She plans to increase her capital so that she can buy in larger volumes to earn more income. This will be her third loan with MFP and she hopes to obtain everyone’s support. Emiliana is a woman who is of good principles and collaborates with her Communal Bank. Her loan of 3000 PEN will help her acquire larger volumes of cacao beans.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cacao beans in bulk.

loans.name: Luna

texts.en: Luna is 34 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Luna has a fishing business in the Philippines. Luna requested a 11,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment. Luna has been in this business for four years. In the future, Luna would like to save enough money so she can purchase an additional fishing boat for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 50-year-old business lady. She is married with two children who are 12 and 5 years old. She has been cooking and selling beans and maize for the past 11 years, with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family members. 
  
She is applying for her first loan from KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Emily will use the loan to add to her stock of dry maize and beans. 

With the anticipated profit from her business, she will educate her children up to university level. Her hope is to open a hotel, which will help her with her children’s education.

loans.use: To add to her stock of dry maize and beans

loans.name: Kurmi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KURMI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Griselda. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, carpintería, tejido, venta de plásticos, salón de belleza, elaboración de pan, venta de peluches.

La señora Griselda,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de comida que inicio hace siete años, aprendiendo el mismo de su mamá. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de muebles (sillas y mesas) que servirá para la ambientación de su lugar de venta; posterior a la elaboración de los alimentos ella lo vende en la Av. Ayo Ayo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la forma de trabajo en unión.
texts.en:
The “Kurmi” community bank is about to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors which is headed by Griselda.  The businesses that the members of the community bank are engaged in are varied and include: selling food, carpentry, weaving, selling plastic products, beauty salon, making bread and selling stuffed toys.

Griselda tells us that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer and she joined the institution through an invitation from a friend.  She currently has a business selling food that she set up seven years ago.  She learned this business from her mom.

Griselda will use this loan to buy furniture (tables and chairs) for her sales location.  After preparing her food, she sells it in Avenida Ayo Ayo.  This work allows her to make money with which to support her family.  She lives with her partner and has three children.

When we asked Griselda what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes working as part of a group.

loans.use: to buy furniture (tables and chairs)

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es: Katherine, está actualmente en unión libre y vive con su marido. Ella con el crédito va comprar una vaca de leche. Actualmente ella cuenta con un terreno de pasto grande para la explotación de este animal en su máximo provecho. Ella pretende con la compra de esta vaca generar la leche para el consumo de la familia. Ella tambien quiere sacarle crias y cuidarlos para su posterior venta o el incremento de ganado a su poder. Ella quiere darle a su esposo una ayuda extra para así facilitarle algunos gastos y así tener un mejor bienestar y generar un ahorro para el futuro. Tambien pretende sacarle a las crias el mayor provecho a la hora de la venta en el mercado. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Katherine is in a common law marriage and lives with her husband. She is going to buy a dairy cow with the loan. At present she has a large lot of pasture to be able to use this animal to its full potential. She intends on generating milk for her family's consumption with the purchase of this cow. She also want to get calves from it to either sell or increase her number of cattle. She wants to give her husband extra help in paying some expenses to have more wellbeing and savings for the future. She also wants to get the best price for the calves at market. This is the first loan she has had with FUDECOSUR. She hasn't had any other loans before with regular banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with ease of payment and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Emma Laura

texts.es:
La señora Emma Laura es madre de dos hijos los cuales tiene que mantener una de 15 años y uno en edad escolar, ya que desde hace años se separo de su marido aunque le ayuda no es mucho para el sostén de ellos. Emma trabaja en un correo como secretaria, como la casa donde ella vive esta en una calle donde los vendedores ambulantes se instalan, construyo locales aun precio accesible para que no sufrieran las inclemencias del tiempo. Uno de los locales el techo es de lamina galvanizada y en el verano este material se pone muy caliente por ello quiere pone losa para  ofrecer un mejor servicio.
Para empezar este proyecto necesita material para la construcción y pagar mano de obra. Aparte de ayudar a estas personas en dar mas barato el local, tendría más ingresos para poder mantener a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Emma Laura is the mother of two children in her care, a 15-year old and another who is of school age. She separated from her husband years ago and he has not provided much help to support them. Emma works as a secretary at a post office.

Her house is located along a street where many traveling vendors set up their businesses. She built vending stalls and offers them at an affordable price so that these merchants don’t have to suffer during the inclement weather. One of these stalls has a galvanized tin roof, but this material gets very hot during the summer, so she wants to install a slab as a way of offering better service.

To start this project, Emma needs to obtain the necessary materials and pay for labor. In addition to helping people by providing a low-cost location to conduct business, she will have more income to support her two children.

loans.use: to install a slab in one of the vending stalls that she rents to her tenants.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
Femme mariée, âgée de 52ans, mère de 4 enfants dont  l’âge varie entre 12 et 24 ans.
Elle a commencée à vendre de la friperie depuis 2008 avec un capital de 95000 frs.
Accueillante, ses prix sont abordables et elle est stricte dans le choix de ses ballots. Ses ventes journalières varient entre 30000f et 50000F, et quand elle tombe sur un  ballot de mauvaise qualité, elle procède aux soldes  pour récupérer son capital
Avec l’actuel prêt, elle va renforcer  son activité en achetant : 1ballot de sacs, des draps, 1 ballot des serviettes (fin de série), ½ ballot des nappes de table et torchons et ces ballots sont acheter selon la saison.
Très motivée, elle compte vendre beaucoup afin  d’épargner pour se préparer au prochain cycle.
Son objectif est d’avoir plus de moyens, acheter une parcelle, construire un boutique de vente de friperie.
Elle contribue à l’éducation morale et financière de sa famille en  leurs assurant  un bien être.
Son entourage l’apprécie et pense qu’elle se débrouille bien  car elle ouvre au moins 2 ballots par semaine.
texts.en:
This woman is 52 years old, married, and a mother to four children ranging in age from 12 to 24 years old. She started selling second-hand goods in 2008 with a capital of 95,000F. She is friendly, her prices are affordable, and she is very discriminating in her selection of merchandise. Her daily sales average 30,000 to 50,000F. Poor quality items, if any, are marked down to allow her to recoup her investment. 

She will use the current loan to strengthen her business by buying one bale of handbags, some bed sheets, one bale of discontinued towels, and half a bale of tablecloths and tea towels. These are seasonal purchases. 

Highly motivated, she plans to sell a lot in order to save and prepare for the next cycle. Her goal is to increase her income, buy a plot of land, and build a store to sell second-hand merchandise. 

She helps to support her family both morally and financially by ensuring their well-being. Those close to her appreciate her, and they believe that she is doing very well as she sells at least two bales per week.

loans.use: to buy bales of handbags, bedsheets, tablecloths, tea towels, etc.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SILKINCHANY” el banco se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Angostura, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia Carolina; tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 7 meses de edad; la socia tiene su empresa de repartición de gas propano, la socia trabaja con su pareja y se encarga de recepcionar las llamadas de los pedidos y anotar las direcciones y su pareja lleva los balones de gas en moto, la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de balones de gas al por mayor para almacenar. La socia desea crecer como empresaria y a futuro comprar motos y poder repartir a más vecinos y a otros distritos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de gas al por mayor para almacenar.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Carolina, 23, is a member of the “Silkinchany” communal bank that’s located in the community of Angostura in Cusco Province and Department.

She has a spouse and a 7-month-old son.  She has a propane gas distributorship.  She works with her spouse and she takes care of receiving calls from customers placing orders and taking down their addresses.  Her spouse uses his motorcycle to deliver the gas tanks.  She wants to use the loan to buy gas tanks at wholesale to store.  She wants to grow as a businesswoman and in future buy more motorcycles to be able to deliver to more neighbors and to other districts.  She is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of gas at wholesale to store.

She is grateful for the support she’ll get and pledges to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy gas at wholesale to store.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Dionicio; el tiene 68 años de edad y es viudo y tiene 5 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de llantería, el es propietario de una tienda donde vende llantas, el socio trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de llantas. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas al por mayor.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Dionicio, 68, is a member of the “Kanchary” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  He’s a widower and has five children.  He alternates his daily chores with a tire shop.  He owns a store where he sells tires.  He works from 9am until 7pm.  Through this business he’s able to support his children.  He wants to expand the tire sale business and is asking for a loan to buy tires at wholesale.  He is happy about the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy tires at wholesale.

loans.name: María Ermelinda

texts.es:
María tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en Ambato que se encuentra en la Sierra Centro de Ecuador. Se describe como una persona trabajadora y le gusta aprender cosas nuevas que le van a servir para seguir adelante.

María trabaja con su hermana en la confección de pantalones de tela. Es el primer crédito que hace en Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de tela e hilo, que servirán para confeccionar pantalones y de esta manera aumentará su producción y sus ventas mejorando sus ingresos económicos, que le ayudarán para poder darles el estudio a sus hijos.

Su sueño es compra más maquinas industriales para contratar personal y tener una gran empresa.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old. She lives with her husband and their two children in Ambato, which is located in the central mountains of Ecuador. María describes herself as a hardworking person who enjoys learning new things in order to get ahead.

María works with her sister making trousers out of fabric. This is her first loan with FODEMI, which she will use to buy fabric and thread for making trousers. This will enable her to increase her production and improve her sales. As a result, her income will improve so that she can provide for her children’s studies.

Her dream is to buy more industrial machines so that she can hire workers and have a successful enterprise.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for making trousers.

loans.name: Lizzy

texts.en:
Lizzy is a widow who has raised six grown children. Lizzy operates a coconut and plastic utensil business. She sells her goods from home. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. Lizzy's other source of income includes earnings from her adult children. She describes her greatest business challenge as the low demand during the rainy season. Her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water.

Lizzy will use the 40,000 KES loan to purchase more coconuts. Lizzy aspires to continue growing her business and supporting her family in the future. She joined Yehu to access loans and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts.

loans.name: Ladislas

texts.en:
Ladislas is 50 years old and is married with children. He takes care of one relative who is 18 years old. Ladislas makes a living by selling potatoes. This is his 4th successful year in this business. Ladislas's business is open from 6.30 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day, except Saturday, and he currently employs 2 people to help him.

Ladislas has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more potatoes to sell. With any loan, Ladislas will hopefully earn more profit. This will allow him to keep reinvesting and saving for better financial stability so he will be able to renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Davgajamts

texts.en: Davgajamts is 25 years old and lives with his mother and sister in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. He started his meat and grocery retailing business earlier this year by renting a counter in a market. His business is going so well that his supplies are not enough to keep up with business. There are many buildings being built in a nearby area, which gives him an opportunity to expand his business. He is requesting 1,800,000 MNT to buy more vegetables and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and other supplies.

loans.name: Mbomele Group

texts.en:
John is the facilitator of the Mbomele group. John and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

John takes care of two children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, John had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 8 ½ bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  John was only able to harvest 3 ½ bags of maize on ½ an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to John and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, John will save for the future in order to hire another plot of farmland for more production and he will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mbomele group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, John is pictured with his group members. Standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Umurzok

texts.ru: Умурзок мужчина 35 лет, женат, имеет пятерых детей. Сам по специальности мастер строитель и дополнительно к этому он занимается откормом и продажей скота. Сейчас у него много голов мелкого рогатого скота. На полученный кредит он хочет увеличить количество скота. Жена домохозяйка, занимается воспитанием детей и заодно помогает мужу ухаживать за скотом. Умурзок с детства помогал отцу по уходу за скотом, поэтому у него есть опыт в этом бизнесе. Он рад, что имеет возможность получить кредит и сотрудничеству с нами.
texts.en: Umurzok is a 35 year-old married man, who has five children.  He is a construction foreman by trade and is also involved in fattening up and selling livestock.  Currently, he owns many heads of small livestock.  Umurzok wants to use this loan to increase his livestock quantity.  His wife is a homemaker and is involved in raising the children, and also helps Umurzok with caring for the livestock.  Since childhood, Umurzok helped his father with caring for livestock, and this is why he has experience in this business.  He is happy that he has the opportunity to obtain this loan and partner with us.

loans.use: to increase livestock quantity

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La señora Susana tiene ya mas de nueve años dedicándose a la venta de ropa nueva en diferentes partes de la ciudad. 
Doña Susana es divorciada y tiene bajo su responsabilidad una hija adolecente que esta estudiando la universidad, siempre se ha dedicada al negocio de venta de ropa esta es la fuente de ingreso que tiene, actualmente esta pagando su casa donde actualmente viven. Solicita el préstamo para aprovechar la temporada de navideña, incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias.  Y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija y su negocio siga creciendo teniendo más inventario.
texts.en:
Señora Susana has been working for nine years selling new clothing in different parts of the city.
Susana is divorced and supports her teenaged daughter, who is in university. This business is Susana's source of income. She is currently paying down their home. She is requesting this loan in order to take advantage of the Christmas season by increasing her sales and making a better income. This way she will improve her quality of life and that of her daughter--and her business will continue to grow through having more inventory.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for sale during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 39-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She's had a business of selling charcoal in bulk in South Sudan for four year.

Christine is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 41 years old and a resident of Litein, South Rift, Kenya. He earns income through farming as well as lumbering. He has been in farming for four years growing potatoes, vegetables, sorghum, and tea, all of which he sells in the local market.

Joseph is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which he will use to venture into the poultry business. He has witnessed great progress in poultry farming through other local farmers and is hopeful that he will be able to expand his business, supply far off markets, and provide for his family's  basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una persona que a pesar de todas las adversidades ha podido salir adelante junto con sus 2 hijas gracias a las ganas de trabajar que siempre la han caracterizado. Margarita quedó viuda hace aproximadamente 8 años, por lo que quedó como una madre soltera a cargo de sus 2 hijas, y con el ánimo de generar los ingresos necesarios para su sostenimiento, montó una tienda general en la que actualmente trabaja todos los días y la que le permite tener una buena calidad de vida. Margarita pudo sacar sus 2 hijas adelante y actualmente pueden acceder a una educación universitaria que las prepara para un empleo bien remunerado. Margarita, con el ánimo de surtir su tienda, busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar para surtir su tienda y ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
Margarita espera que de esta manera pueda ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos y estos vean su tienda de manera más atractiva, de modo que sus ventas aumenten considerablemente. Margarita sueña con tener una gran tienda y con ver a sus hijas profesionales, por esto trabaja todos los días fuertemente para garantizar el dinero necesario para pagar sus estudios universitarios.

loans.use: Compra de productos de la canasta familiar para surtir su tienda y ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en: Mr Erdenetsogt is 40 years old and lives with his 4 children and wife in a ger in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife, Altantuya, is 40 years old. His daughters, Chuluuntsetseg, Chuluunchimeg, Chuluunkhishig, Undrah, aged 18, 16, 13 and 9 responsive.His older daughter is a collage student. His younger three daughters are a second school student.  He started wool trading business in 2007, with his wife. He buys a wool form herder. He is planning to increase a working capital of his business. His income is little than his family cost.  He well-experienced an d hardworking man. He is asking 1 000 000 MNT to buy a more wool for his business.

loans.use: To buy a more wool for his business

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
