She is very pleased because, little by little, she has managed to get ahead.  She still remembers when she started with only some groceries.  Now she even sells gas by the gallon to her neighbors.  As an enterprising woman, she plans to expand her store’s facilities in the future.  She also plans to stock it with a greater variety of products.

This is her third loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments on time.  She does not want to disappoint the people who make this loan possible.  The loan will allow her to continue working in the pursuit of progress.

María will use the requested loan to buy a display case and a freezer that she needs in order to improve her business.  This is the way she hopes to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy a display case and freezer for her business

loans.name: Ana Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Divinas.

Hace dos años la hermana le llevo a la señora Ana para que ingresara al Banco Comunal y desde entonces algunas cosas para ella han cambiado para bien ya que con los créditos que ha recibido de parte de la Fundación Espoir ha mejorado mucho su negocio y su vida. Tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo un hijo que ya es mayor de edad y es independiente. Su esposo es mecánico de motocicletas. Ella hace muchos años se graduó de modista en la Fundación de modistas FUNDAPASH.

Tiene un taller de costura en su casa, confecciona todo tipo de ropa, pero confiesa que lo que más le gusta es  confeccionar ropa niñas y niños, les cose a las personas que necesitan de sus servicios,  trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 20h00 pero que a veces se queda trabajando hasta más tarde cuando tiene mucho trabajo. Trabaja en sociedad con  su hermana con las que comparten el trabajo y las ganancias en partes iguales.

Este crédito es para comprar telas  y materiales para la costura. Su sueño es tener un taller de costura más grande e industrializado.
texts.en:
Members of the Las Divinas (The Divine Ones) communal bank meet every two weeks in the La California neighborhood of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí province, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Two years ago Ana’s sister took her to enroll in the communal bank and since then things have changed for the better because loans she’s gotten from Fundación Espoir have greatly improved her business and her life.  She is 44 years old, married and has a son who is now adult and independent.  She graduated several years ago as a Dressmaker from the FUNDAPASH Dressmaking Foundation.

She has a sewing workshop in her home.  She makes all kinds of clothes but confesses that what she enjoys making the most is children’s clothes.  She sews for everyone who needs her services every day from 8am until 8pm but sometimes even later when there is a lot of work to complete.  She works in partnership with her sister.  They share the workload and the profits equally.

This loan is to buy fabric and sewing supplies.  Her dream is to have a larger, industrialized shop.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel G. M., age 27, is married to Mary, and together they have a 1 year old child. He lives in Kiwanja near Kenyatta University where he also runs his business.
	
Samuel has been running a retail shop for four years and earns a monthly profit of 10,000 KES, which he uses to cater for the basic needs in the house. He was introduced to Kadet by the loan officer in charge of the Thika Road office.

After getting this loan, Samuel intends to buy stocks of cooking oil and fat, sugar, rice and flour to uplift his business and increase his profit. If the loan boosts business, Samuel plans to use the extra income to increase his inventory and grow his business to become a wholesaler.

Samuel, who has very happy customers, is hardworking and has big dreams for the future.

loans.use: To buy stocks of cooking oil and fat, sugar, rice and flour

loans.name: Carlos Asmel

texts.es:
Carlos, reside en San Rafael oriente, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de medicina química, vive junto a su esposa, sus suegros, cuñados y su primer hijo de 1 año de edad. El negocio lo inicio con su suegro y juntos trabajan salen a visitar a los clientes todos los días, no tienen un horario fijo.
Actualmente tiene el plan de invertirle al negocio por lo que solicita un préstamo y realizar dicha inversión comprando medicina con una cantidad mayor y diversificar las clases de medicina; con esta ayuda el estará cumpliendo su plan para mejorar sus ingresos e ir creciendo poco a poco dentro del mercado.
Su aspiración es convertirse en un gran comerciante mayorista, distribuidor de medicina, para apoyar a su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in San Rafael Oriente in the San Miguel department.  For work, he sells pharmaceutical medications. He lives with his wife, his wife's parents, his in-laws and his first son, who is one year old. He started his business with his father-in-law and together they make house calls for their customers every day. They don't have a set schedule. 

He requested the loan in order to help him to invest in his business. He'll be able to do this by purchasing a larger quantity and a greater variety of medications. With the help of this loan, he'll be able to achieve his goals of increasing his income and growing his business bit by bit. He aspires to become a major wholesale vendor and distributor of medications in order to support his family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase of medications

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Francis Odhiambo

texts.en:
Francis O. is 29 years old and is from Kisumu city, Western Kenya. He is married to Lucy, who has a charcoal business, and they have a one-year-old child named Lenox. 

Francis runs a second-hand clothing business at Kibuye market, a large open air market just a few meters from the heart of Kismu city. He has been operating this business for the last six years and makes a monthly income of 8,000 KES. 

Francis is requesting his first loan from Kadet Ltd to buy a new stock of second-hand clothing. Second-hand clothing is cheaper and Francis anticipates making greater sales as the December festivities approach. Francis hopes to increase profits and expand his business to improve his family’s living standards by providing for their daily basic needs.

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 37-year-old mother of five. She worked as a babysitter from her home in the past and began running a part-time daycare. After discussions with the municipality, she is opening a half day nursery/daycare center for young children. It is a much-needed business in her area, allowing other women the peace of mind regarding childcare while they leave home for work.

Faten has taken this loan to complete renovations and purchase toys and supplies for her daycare. 

In January, she will open the daycare center for five young children. In the future, Faten wants to provide a full day nursery running until 5pm.

Due to reasons of modesty, Faten's husband is pictured at the location currently being remodeled for the daycare.

loans.use: To pay for renovations and purchase toys and supplies

loans.name: María Gabriela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 11 De Septiembre. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 27 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 4 y 2 años. El marido es comerciante de venta de mariscos.
 
Tiene un negocio de venta de toda variedad de mariscos en su casa, en el vende pescado, camarón, langostinos, pulpo, entre otros, trabaja en la atención de sus clientes todos los días desde las 7h00hasta las 15h00 o hasta más tarde ya que el negocio lo tiene en su casa, compran sus productos en San Jacinto lugar hasta donde llegan los pescadores.

Este crédito es para comprar camarón, pescado, ostiones, etc. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque en él ha encontrado mucha ayuda para su negocio. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
The 11 de Septiembre communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This place is known for its traditional culture and for being just minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where we find María, 27.  She is in a common law relationship and has two children who are 4 and 2 years of age.  Her husband is a fish merchant.  All kinds of sea food is sold in her house.  She sells fish, shrimp, prawns and octopus, among others.  She tends to customers every day from 7am until 3pm or later since the business is in her house.  They buy their products in San Jacinto which is the place the fishermen come to.

This loan is to buy shrimp, fish, oysters, etc.  This is the second cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because she has found much help for her business in it.  Her dream is to own her own house because she currently rents.

loans.use: To buy shrimp, fish, oysters, octopus, prawns, etc.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra Sustiquer lives in the community of Banga, South Cotabato. She is 48 years old with five children.

Sandra grows rice and corn for a living. She began this business because she wanted to improve the family’s financial situation and support her children’s studies. She also runs a sari-sari (variety) store. Recently, however, Sandra has begun to face financial difficulties. She doesn't have enough money to reinvest in her business. As a result, her sales and profits have gone down. Thus, Sandra has requested a loan from CEVI in order to purchase fertilizers and seeds for the farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Kancilida

texts.en:
Kancilida is 48 years old and she is a mother of 4 children. Her eldest child is 24 years, while the youngest is 11 years old. All her children are in school. 

Kancilida has a restaurant and sells clothes as well. She has done this business for 16 years, and she is proud of her work. Since her husband died she has been responsible for raising her family on her own. Kancilida is requesting a loan in order to buy more restaurant equipment and increase her capital. With the profits that she hopes to make, she plans to pay rent on her house.

loans.use: Buying restaurant equipment

loans.name: Ma. Dahlia

texts.en:
Ma. Dahlia R. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Ma. Dahlia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Dahlia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. She also buys and sells green bananas. Ma. Dahlia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Ma. Dahlia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Dahlia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ma. Dahlia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HHSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: LA señora Josefina C.: es de 62 años de edad tiene 3 años de confeccionar ropa variada y nececita un refinanciamiento para comprar mas tela para la confeccion de pantalones ya que ella solo se dedica a la elavoracion y no cuenta con suficiente personal para que le elavoren mas prendas ahora  ella invertira en playeras por el tiempo de verano ya que a ella le ayuda porque todos los fines de semana sale a vender a diferente pueblos y unos de sus clientes  le hacen pedidos. el mayor deceo de ella es que su ultimo hijo estudie y le ayude al mismo tiempo para asi generar mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Josefina C. is 62 years old.  For three years she has been making clothes and she needs a loan to buy more fabric for making pants (trousers).  She makes her products alone and doesn't have the staff to make more clothes.

Josefina will invest in t-shirts for the summer season because every weekend she travels to different villages to sell her products and some of her customers make orders for them.  Josefina's biggest wish is for her youngest son to study and help her at the same time so that she can make more profits.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making pants and t-shirts

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary M. Musa is 32 years old and married. Her husband is a mechanic and they have six chidren aged between 8 months and 17 years old. Mary has been selling chicken to the local people for 15 years. Her business is located in the town center known as Athi River. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business going well. Mary is using her loan of KES 10,000 to add more chicks to develop her business and to meet her customers' demands. She hopes to expand her business and diversify to a food kiosk. She describes herself as determined and innovative.

loans.use: to buy chicks

loans.name: Jackson Musee

texts.en: Jackson is 31 years old, married and has a two-year-old child. He makes a living by running a retail shop where he sells food and other items such as cooking oil, flour and soap. He has been in this line of work for 11 years and is applying for this loan from KADET to expand his business and earn greater profits. Most of his customers live nearby, and he would like to sell them more products because this will allow him to give his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Amancio

texts.es:
Amancio tiene 42 años, está casado con la Sra. Floriana Fernández, no tienen hijos, ambos viven en un asentamiento en la ciudad de Paraguarí.
Amancio es taxista, empieza sus actividades diarias a muy tempranas horas de la mañana y regresa muy tarde a su casa, ya por la noche, pues posee mucho trabajo gracias a su buen servicio, pero sabe que a pesar de que no puede compartir mucho con su familia, él es la fuente de ingresos de su familia y debe luchar cada día por el sustento económico, y más aún para poder tener hijos bajo el amparo material necesario.
El tiene su parada a una cuadra de la oficina de Fundación Paraguaya, fue así que contactó con la institución para poder solicitar el crédito a Kiva.
Desea el crédito para la reparación de su vehículo, pues es el único medio de trabajo que posee.
texts.en:
Amancio is 42 years old and is married to Floriana Fernández. They do not have children, and they live together in a neighborhood of the city of Paraguarí.

Amancio is a taxi driver. He starts his daily work at a very early hour in the morning and returns home very late, when it is already night, since he has a lot of work thanks to his excellent service. He knows that although he cannot spend much time with his family, he is their source of income, and he needs to struggle each day for economic sustenance, and even more so that he can have children and provide for their material needs. 

He has his taxi stand one block from the office of the Paraguaya Foundation, and that is how he came to contact the institution to request a Kiva loan. 

He would like the loan to repair his vehicle, since it is the only means of work that he possesses.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 30 years old and married to Lucy, who also contributes to the family income. He has been running his motorcycle business for a period of about two years with an income of approximately $64 per month. 

This is his first loan cycle after being introduced to KADET by a staff member. He wants to use the loan to buy a piece of land jointly with other group members. He hopes to improve the living standards of his family and to expand his transport business.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land with his group members

loans.name: Dantye

texts.en:
Dantye is a 48-year-old entrepreneur. He is married with three children: Yosmi, 10 years old and in the fourth grade of elementary school, Angel, 6 years old and in the first grade of elementary school, and Farah, one month. 

Dantye owns a kiosk selling everyday items such as sugar, coffee, soaps, gasoline, and mobile phone recharges. He has been running the business for 10 years and is able to support his family's daily needs and provide a good education for his children. As an entrepreneur, Dantye dreams to improve his business. He wants to add more products and sell more mobile phone recharges in his kiosk to meet customers' needs. 

Dantye tries to seek more capital so is requesting a loan. Fortunately, Dantye met a TLM field officer who introduced him to TLM's lending program. Dantye thinks this is a good opportunity for his business and has submitted an application to TLM. He is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000 to add stock for his kiosk, and to start a broiler business in order to generate money for his family. He hopes that TLM will help him by providing the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar, coffee, soaps etc. and to start a broiler business

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: Lea is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Lea has a retail shop that sells her homemade beauty soaps. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy ingredients to make the beauty soaps. Lea is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lea hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make beauty soap

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with six children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household items like maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar. She faces a challenge of competition from other retail shop operators. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar for her shop. Fatuma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar for her retail shop.

loans.name: Claudia María

texts.es: Claudia María D. cuarenta y cuatro años D. edad vive con su familia. Ella posee una sala D. belleza y venta D. productos para el cuidado personal; es la mejor estilista D. la zona pues la prefieren por la calidad D. trabajo que realiza y claro por los precios accesibles, sus clientes siempre terminan satisfechos con su trabajo y con el buen servicio que Claudia les presta. Para ella el éxito no es la clave D. la felicidad. La felicidad es la clave del éxito. Si amas lo que haces serás exitoso; y su labor es lo que más ama en la vida es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cremas, cosméticos, peines, acondicionadores, shampoo entre otros D. esta forma mantendrá a flote el negocio y podrá seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad D. la clientela. Claudia María tiene la confianza que con esto lograra llevar seguridad económica para su familia.
texts.en: Claudia María is forty-four years old and lives with her family.  She has a beauty salon and sells personal care products; she is the best stylist in the area because customers prefer the quality of work that she does and of course her affordable rates.  Her customers always wind up satisfied with her work and with the good service that Claudia provides.  For her, success is not the key to happiness, happiness is the key to success.  If you love what you do, you will be successful, and her work is what she loves most in life.  This is why she is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL which will allow her to purchase creams, cosmetics, combs, conditioners, shampoo and others things like this.  This will allow the business to remain afloat, and it will be able to continue to meet the needs of its customers.  Claudia María is confident that this loan could potentially lead to economic security for her family.

loans.use: to buy creams, conditioners, combs, conditioners and shampoo.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
El Sr Teodoro, tiene casa propia, es casado, vive en la ciudad de Santani.
Comenta que tiene una despensa por medio del cual puede paliar los gastos de la familia. Dice que la despensa la pudo tener por medio de mucho sacrificio ya que es una persona de escasos recursos. El objetivo de el es poder generar mas ingresos para ir así, de forma gradual, mejorando su calidad de vida, no solo de el sino de aquellos que dependen de el.
El solicita el credito para la compra de Bebidas, carnes, verduras, leche y demás para abastecer su negocio. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le esta brindando, ya que de obtener el credito le sera de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Teodoro has his own house, is married, and lives in the city of Santani. He told us that with his store he is able to help with his family's expenses. He said he was able to get the store by means of a lot of sacrifice since he does not have very much money. His goal is to be able to generate more income and gradually improve his quality of life and that of those who are dependent upon him.

He is asking for a loan to buy beverages, meat, vegetables, milk, and more to stock his store. He is thankful to the Foundation for the opportunity they are providing him, as getting a loan will be a big help to him.

loans.use: buy meat, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Hermes

texts.es:
Hermes tiene  41 años de edad, el vive en un caserío del distrito de Tambogrande en el departamento de Piura, en el norte del Perú, por vivir en una zona rural la vivienda de Hermes aun no cuenta con  cuanta con servicio básicos.

Hermes cuenta con 1 hectáreas de terreno agrícola en el cual siembra limón y cosecha semanalmente, también cuenta con ganado ovino el cual cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y posteriormente  comercializa en el mercado  local 

Hermes  desea comprar fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón y así lograr una mejor producción de su cultivo,ademas también quiere comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales, lo que permitirá que logren un mejor peso y tamaño y venderlos a un mejor precio,por ello está solicitando un préstamo a  Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles. 

Hermes  es conocido en la zona por ser una persona trabajadora, responsable y desea más adelante poder seguir creciendo en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Hermes is 41 years old and lives in a small village in Tambogrande district, in Piura department, in the north of Peru.  As he lives in a rural area, Hermes' home does not have basic services.

Hermes has 1 hectare of farmland where he grows lemons and harvests them weekly.  He also owns sheep which he raises in pens located behind his home.  He later sells them in the local market.

Hermes would like to buy fertilizers for his lemon crop and thereby achieve a better production.  He would also like to buy balanced feed for his animals which will mean they will achieve a better size and weight and he will be able to sell them for a better price.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Hermes is well known in the area as a hard-working, responsible person and, in the future, he would like to be able to continue growing in his businesses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops and balanced feed for his sheep

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Desde hace 20 años Francisco se ha dedicado a vender mercancía en las calles de Medellín, un municipio del departamento de Antioquia, tiempo en el cual ha aprendido todo lo necesario para sacar su negocio adelante, enseñarle a su esposa y dejarle un legado a sus dos hijos quienes se han interesado en su negocio por el afecto y la tenacidad con la que Francisco se ha dedicado a las ventas. Ya cumple 10 años de estar vendiendo en un mismo lugar ya que por su experiencia pudo visualizar que en dicho lugar sus ventas han aumentado.

A sus 65 años de edad Francisco sueña con brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, y sostener su negocio hasta donde la vida se lo permita pues en un futuro sabe que sus hijos se harán cargo del negocio con el mismo empeño que el mismo. Sin embargo hoy en día Francisco ve la necesidad de surtir su negocio, comprar suficiente mercancía para mejorar las ganancias, pero el no cuenta con este capital que le ayudará a invertir en su negocio por lo cual solicita un préstamo que no solo le ayude a hacer crecer su negocio si no también a brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco has sold merchandise for 20 years in the streets of Medellín, a city in the district of Antioquia.  In this time he has learned everything he has needed to nurture his business, teach his wife, and leave a legacy for his two children, who have been interested in the business because of the emotion and tenacity with which Francisco has dedicated himself to sales.  For 10 years he has been selling in the same location, since experience showed him that his sales had grown there.

Now 65, Francisco dreams of giving his family a better quality of life and of keeping his business as long as life allows.  He knows that in the future his children will take over the business with the same effort that he himself showed.  Nevertheless, at present Francisco sees the need to stock his business with sufficient merchandise to improve his earnings, but he doesn't have the capital that will help him invest in his business.  For this reason he is requesting a loan that will help him not only to expand his business but also to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his business.

loans.name: Reyna Yaneth

texts.es: Reyna de 24 años es casada y tiene 2 niñas una de 1 mes de nacida y otra de 6 años que en este año inicia su primer ciclo escolar en la primaria; ella trabaja 10 horas diarias en una maquiladora como operadora desde hace 2 años, su esposo trabaja como operador en una maquiladora. Reyna y su esposo además del empleo que tienen cada uno de ellos  se dedican a la venta de Gorditas en espacio que acondiciono en su mismo domicilio, los días que ella vende son Jueves, Viernes y Sábado, solicitan un apoyo para acondicionar bien este local; pintarlo, comprar mesas  y un poco de publicidad para atraer nuevos clientes; esto con la ilusión de que algún día Reyna pueda dejar de trabajar y poder atender su hogar  y el negocio familiar.
texts.en: Reyna, 24, is married and has 2 children.  One of her children is a 1-month old baby, and the other is 6 years old and is in first grade.  Reyna works 10 hours a day as an operator  in a maquiladora.  She has been doing this work for 2 years, and her husband is also employed as an operator in a maquiladora.  In addition to their jobs, Reyna and her husband also work selling gorditas (traditional Mexican snacks) in a space that they set up in their own home.  They sell on Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays.  They are requesting support to set up this space better; they will paint it and buy tables, and also buy a bit of advertising to attract new customers.  They are doing this with the hope that someday Reyna will be able to stop working and devote herself to her home and the family business.

loans.use: to make improvements to her business premises

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, he has operated a mobile phone accessories and charging business. His potential customers are neighboring community members. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. Gabriel dreams of expanding his business and purchasing a piece of land in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, he wants to purchase phone battery chargers for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase phone battery chargers for resale.

loans.name: Ivania Mercedes

texts.es:
Ivania, de 32 años de edad, nacida en la ciudad de León, soltera, ella es comerciante se dedica a vender comida, también vende ropa. Ella heredo este negocio de venta de comida por medio de una tía que le enseño a preparar comida y a venderla pues su tía realizo esta labor durante 30 años y ella le ayudaba y esto le sirvió de experiencia, decidió  vender ropa como segundos ingresos también trabajo como domestica pero hoy en día es la que dirige este negocio de venta de comida.    
Solicito el préstamo para comprar ropa para dama y C., invertir en compras de carnes, verduras que son ingredientes que ocupa para vender y preparar comidas, gaseosas. Con esta inversion Tendrá disponibilidad de productos para prepara sus platillos y mercadería para vender. Sus metas son poner una tienda de ropa en general, comprar maniquís y vitrinas para poner en exhibición sus productos. Desea superarme como mujer micro empresaria y tener la capacidad de brindar empleos a mujeres como ella que tengan deseos de superación.
texts.en:
32-year-old Ivania was born in the city of León.  She is single and her business is selling food.  She also sells clothes.  She inherited the food business from an aunt who taught her how to make food and sell it.  Her aunt carried out this business for 30 years and she helped her.  This gave her experience.  Ivania decided to sell clothes as a second source of income.  She also worked as a domestic but now she runs the food business.

Ivania requested this loan to buy men's and women's clothes; to invest in buying meat and vegetables, which are the ingredients she uses to prepare and sell her meals; and to buy soda.  With this investment, she will have products available with which to prepare her dishes and also merchandise to sell.  Her goals are to set up a general clothes store and to buy mannequins and display cases with which to display her products.  She would like to do well as a small businesswoman and have the ability to provide jobs to women such as herself who have a desire to do well.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothes; to invest in buying meat and vegetables, which are the ingredients she uses to prepare and sell her meals; and to buy soda

loans.name: Yelba Del Rosario

texts.es: Yelba, de 44 años habita en la ciudad de Granada, esta casada, es comerciante, tiene una pequeña pulpería, tiene 18 años de tener este negocio. Inicio a los 28 años comenzó vendiendo queso, después con el tiempo poner una pulpería y lo logro aunque la dificultades fueron muchos pero eso no la  hizo rendirse y siguió adelante y ahora de ese negocio sobrevive. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar inventario a su pulpería tales como jabón, aceite, azúcar, frijoles, arroz , leche, huevo, cosméticos, jugos enlatados, productos para limpieza del hogar. Con esta inversión quiere levantar sus ventas, hacer más atractivo su negocio , ella en lo futuro le gustaría convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora de alimentos.
texts.en:
44-year-old Yelba is married and lives in the city of Granada.  She is a shopkeeper and owns a small grocery store.  She has had this business for 18 years.  Yelba started out at the age of 28, selling cheese.  Then, over time, she set up a grocery store.  She managed this despite the many difficulties that she encountered.  These difficulties did not make her give up and she kept moving forward.  She now lives off her business.

Yelba needs a loan to buy stock for her grocery store such as soap, oil, sugar, beans, rice, milk, eggs, cosmetics, canned juice and household cleaning products.  Through this investment, she would like to increase her sales and make her business more attractive.  In the future, she would like to turn her grocery store into a food wholesalers.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store such as soap, oil, sugar, beans, rice, milk, eggs, cosmetics, canned juice and household cleaning products

loans.name: Marivel Mirian

texts.es: La señora Marivel tiene la actividad de peinadora ya hace bastante tiempo,  tiene un local  en la zona de Villa Fátima donde a ella le va muy bien porque tiene muchos clientes por el buen servicio que brinda, ella antes era solo peinadora empleada, pero ya con la experiencia que tenia decidió abrir su propio salón de belleza, su esposo es radiotécnico el negocio del esposo no es estable porque a veces tiene contratos y a veces no, la señora desde muy joven estudio para ser peinadora y por suerte ella esta haciendo lo que mas le gusta que es el peinado, sus hijos son niños que están estudiando en nivel primario, el crédito será invertido en el adelanto de su alquiler para el local de su salón de belleza, es una persona dinámica con ganas de superación su deseo es el de mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en: Marivel has been a hairdresser for some time, and has a shop in the Villa Fátima region. She does well there because she has many customers who appreciate her quality service. Before, she was just an employee, but now with her experience she has decided to open her own beauty salon. Her husband is a radio engineer, and his business is not stable because sometimes he has a contract, and sometimes he does not. Marivel has studied to be a hairdresser since she was very young, and, luckily, she is doing what she likes most, hair styling. Her sons are studying in first grade. The loan will be invested in advance rent payments for her beauty salon. Marivel is a dynamic person with desires to get ahead. Her wish is to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To invest in advance rent payments.

loans.name: Urumbek's Group

texts.en:
Urumbek, 47, is a member of this group. He is a  construction worker and his wife is a housekeeper. They are raising a son and a daughter. Urumbek owns land which he received in 1996 in his village of Tyup. Every spring he plants various types of vegetables, grains and fruits. This autumn has gifted all local farmers a rich harvest with plenty of sun and water. Currently Urumbek, with the assistance of his son, is gathering all his crops. 

He plans to sell some part of it now, and to save the rest for spring. The later sale will bring him a lot of extra income. The proof of financial success was a purchase of a long-waited automobile, which has made the transportation of products easier. 

A monthly income from harvest is 5 000 soms. Urumbek earns a supplementary income by working in various types of construction. The purpose of his loan is a purchase of seeds of a rare type of potatoes for spring, because the price of the seeds is lower in the fall. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Sorn is a 43-year-old mother of five children, two of whom are sons living with the family and still in school. She is a farmer who grows vegetables and rice. She has been in this business for fifteen years. 

Sorn leads a group of two members and is applying for a first loan with VisionFund. The other member has been with VisionFund for one year. 

Sorn wants to buy seeds for her vegetables plantation and some fertilizers for her rice field. This loan will help her to plant more vegetables and increase her yield which will enable her to earn more income to feed her family, build some savings to buy necessary household items, and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy seeds for vegetables plantation

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en:
Ofelya was born in 1958. She is married and has two daughters who are married and live on their own. Ofelya lives with her husband in the town of Ijevan. She worked as an accountant in one of Ijevan's factories for many years prior to its liquidation.

Since 2004, she and her husband have made a living selling bouquets and wreaths from a stall they rent in the town market. Thanks to the success of this business, Ofelya has been able to repair her house and pay for her daughters’ education and weddings. She likes her work because it allows her to hear many romantic stories related to her bouquets.

With her first Kiva loan, Ofelya bought a big lot of flowers for her business. With income from trade, she was able to enlarge and to repair her stand.

Now Ofelya is seeking a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy flowers, baskets, colored ribbons and wrapping paper in advance of the Christmas and New Year’s holidays.

loans.use: to buy flowers, baskets, colored ribbons and wrapping paper in advance of Christmas and New Year’s holidays

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en:
Mr.Otgonbaatar, 29, runs an inter-city passenger transportation business in Mongolia. He has been doing this for 3 years and already has permanent customers. He carries one passenger for 5 buks from city to city. Otgonbaatar lives with his wife and 4 children in a boundary district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 
Recently he bought a small piece of land in a suburban area of Ulaanbaatar with his business earnings. It is located in a good place with a healthy environment. 
Now he is planning to build a small house on his new land in the spring of 2012. Therefore, he is starting preparations by purchasing building materials. The loan he is taking will be used to purchase building materials needed to build his family house as soon as possible.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to build his family house

loans.name: Leparakuo

texts.en:
Leparakuo, who is a livestock farmer, had previously serviced a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings which he used to buy sheep. He was able to make a good sale. He has now become more focused in his business and he hopes to grow his clientele.

Leparakuo has requested for another loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Chimboco 2 Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Chimboco 2 esta conformado por tres señoras quienes tienen su negocio propio independiente uno del otro, el nombre de Chimboco fue porque las tres señoras viven en la zona Chimboco, la presidenta es la Sra. Florencia quien es casada y tiene 3 hijos pequeños, la Sra. Florencia tiene casa propia justo frente a una unidad educativa, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras en el centro de Cochabamba, ella vende todos los días, el puesto es de su suegra, quien le dejo debido a que la señora era ya mayor y ya no podía ir a vender, de esta manera dejo el puesto de venta y en un buen lugar a la Sra. Florencia quien esta agradecida con su suegra por esta oportunidad que le brinda, con el dinero del crédito comprara verduras al por mayor.
texts.en: The Chimboco 2 community bank has three members, all women, each with her own independent business.  The community bank is named for Chimboco, the area where the members live.  Sra. Florencia is the president of the community bank.  She is married and has 3 young children.  The family lives in a house across from a school.  Sra. Florencia operates a vegetable-sales business in central Cochabamba.  She goes there to sell every day.  The vegetable stall belongs to her mother-in-law, an older woman, who no longer operates it.  Sra. Florencia operates it now and says that she is grateful to her mother-in-law for letting her take over the business.  Sra. Florencia will use this loan to buy wholesale supplies of vegetables that she will resell.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies of vegetables for her retail business.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom, 40 years of age, is a sewing and embroidery expert who works for her neighborhood clients. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. Her husband is a salesman by profession. Since his income is not enough for the family, Kalsoom started her business a few years ago. Kalsoom has one son and 6 daughters; her son is a welder and her eldest daughter is also a seamstress. Four of her 5 remaining children are enrolled in local schools and getting their education.

Kalsoom has applied for a loan from KIVA's partner, Asasah, for her embroidery business. She will use the loan to purchase clothes, embroidery thread and beads in larger quantities to allow her to offer better quality services to her clients and to increase her sales and profits. Kalsoom has been operating her business for some time now and is very confident that an investment will help her earn more profits.

Note: In the photo, Kalsoom is holding a book (called Asasah passbook).

loans.use: To buy beads and embroidery thread

loans.name: Lelia Orfelia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Lelia, tiene 72 años  de edad, está separada hace varios años pero de esta relación tuvieron 7 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de  edad e independientes. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque sus compañeras son como su familia ya que siempre están allí cuando las necesita.

Ella hace varios años puso un pequeño bar en su casa en el cual  vende aguas, sodas, energizantes, hielo, cervezas, entre otras bebidas, en la actualidad está preparando y vendiendo empanadas y corviches los mismos que vende al igual que sus otros productos, ella aprovecha que frente a su casa se reúnen todos los días personas que llegan a hacer deporte pues allí hay unas canchas de football y de voleibol. También ella prepara deliciosos helados de frutas, lleva más de 10 años en esta actividad.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito y va a utilizar este crédito para comprar sodas, aguas, jugos y otros víveres para preparar los alimentos.  Nos cuenta que los créditos  le han permitido salir adelante sola y  que   gracias a ellos cada vez que necesita algo no tiene que pedirle a nadie sino que con lo que le queda de ganancia puede solventar sus gastos, también con el ultimo crédito pudo además de vender bebidas también pudo vender empanadas y corviches con lo cual tiene otros ingresos que le vienen muy bien.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets every two weeks in La Sequita Parish in Montecristi, a canton known for the famous straw hats that are highly regarded both within the country and abroad.

We met Leila, 72, here.  She’s been separated for several years but she had 7 children who are all now independent adults.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because her fellow members are like family to her because they are always there when she needs them.

Several years ago she opened a small pub at home where she sells water, soft-drinks, energy drinks, ice and beer, among other beverages.  She’s currently also making turnovers and “corviches” [Dough made from grated plantain, deep fried and stuffed with spicy fish or minced meat, topped with salad, mayo, chili] to sell along with her other products.  She takes advantage of the fact that folks interested in playing sports gather in front of her house every day because there are soccer fields and volleyball courts there.  She also makes delicious fruit ice-cream and has been in business more than ten years.

She is repeating the loan and will use it to buy soft-drinks, water, juice and other foodstuffs to make her food.  She tells us that the loans have made it possible for her go get ahead by herself and that thanks to them whenever she needs something she doesn’t have to go ask anyone for help but can use her profits to cover expenses.  She was also able to use her previous loan to sell turnovers and corviches besides beverages which produces additional income that suits her quite well.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, water, juice and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Julia Jacinta

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer muy trabajadora de tiene 56 años, pero tiene una vitalidad y la alegría de una joven de  20 años, ha pasado por muchas adversidades, una de ella es la pérdida de su esposo a quien aun quiere muchísimo, ya que más que un esposo era su amigo y su mejor compañía, a raíz de este suceso ella tuvo que armarse de valor y luchar por sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos, los cuales ahora ya son mayores de edad, pero se convirtieron en su razón de vivir y el motivo por el cual sigue adelante.  Con cada amanecer Julia sale a trabajar en su pequeño negocio de venta de periódicos y revistas, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente; ella cree que está saliendo adelante con su negocio por su amabilidad con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene un ángel que la protege desde el cielo.

Julia está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá solventar los gastos de su tratamiento dental, ya que debido  su edad le es necesario realizar este tratamiento, y poder mejorar su salud y su calidad de vida y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un local propio”.
texts.en:
Julia is 56 years old and a hard working lady.  She has the vitality and happiness of a 20 year old.  She has had many adversities, one of which is the loss of her husband, who she loved very much and who was more than a husband; he was her best friend and her greatest company.  Because of this she needed to arm herself with bravery and fight to get her three children ahead.  They are all adults now, but they became her reason for living and getting ahead.  Each morning Julia goes out to work her small business selling newspapers and magazines.  She works about 10 hours a day and is able to serve about 15 customers.  She believes that she is getting ahead because of her friendliness to her customers and above all she has a guardian angel.

Julia is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their help, which has allowed her to pay for her dental treatments that she needed because of her age.  She was able to improve her health and quality of life and continue working to achieve her greatest dream, “To have her own business.”

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Viviam

texts.es:
Viviam es de la ciudad de Pilar, es la mayor de tres hermanas, a la par que estudia también está trabajando para poder cubrir sus gastos de universidad.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, y por medio de sus estudios quiere poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a poder seguir estudiando.

loans.use: Pagar cuotas de universidad

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by five entrepreneurs hailing from the island village of Carabane at the mouth of the Casamance river in southern Senegal.  The group is represented by Ibrahima N., who submitted the following business proposal:  

“The activities to be undertaken are: traditional net fishing, which will be done with traditional pirogues (handmade wooden canoes).  We are going to sell the fish not only to the tourist hotels and restaurants, but also to the surrounding villages.  We have already targeted the markets for the sale of our products.  We are going to do our best to sell at prices that are affordable for the local population.  We will also have the option of processing our products (fish and other seafood) into dried fish.  All of these factors will allow us to earn money, to build up our savings and to repay this loan on time – because us islanders, we know how profitable net fishing is because fish is a real necessity here.  

For the budget we need: 

5 pirogues                               *  80000 F      =  400000 F

5 roles of string                        *  7000 F        =  35000 F

5 * 70 net weights                    *  25 F            =  8750 F

5 buckets                                 *  1000 F        =  5000 F

5 oars                                      *  2000 F        =  10000 F

5 nets                                      *  23000 F      =  115000 F

Towing fees for the pirogues   15000 F * 5    =  75000 F

Unforeseen expenses (price increases etc.)      =  16250 F 

Net budget                                                      =  683750 F

Net budget + unforeseen expenses                  =  700000 F” 

 

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group.  Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities.  Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members.  However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income.  This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities.  Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing canoes

loans.name: Makhluga

texts.en:
Makhluga has her own plot of land. You can see in the picture her vineyard. She has been farming for 8 years.
She lives in the Salyan region, Khaladj village Makhluga is married has 2 children and  is 47.
Makhluga needs a loan of $1000 to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Aivale

texts.en:
Aivale is married and has four children. She lives in the Samoan countryside, where she works a small taro plantation. Taro is a staple of the Samoan diet.

She is dedicated to working hard on her farm in order to help her family. Aivale takes her taro crop to market twice a week, and she can generally sell her supply and bring home the ST 300 – 400 (USD 120 – 160) that her large family lives on. A loan would enable Aivale to purchase some natural fertilizers, which could help her increase her crop yield.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Vo Thi

texts.en: Mrs. L., 41, lives in a small town in central Nghe An Province, one of the poorest regions of Vietnam. She is working for the local Women's Union. But her salary plus her husband's (he is working for the local government)  are not enough to pay for the education of her son, 19, a university student in Hanoi, and her daughter, 13. So Mrs. L. has opened a small shop to sell shoes, shirts, and cosmetics. Hats sell especially well, since all Vietnamese girls consider white skin the ideal of beauty and are afraid of getting a sun tan.

loans.use: buy goods for her shop

loans.name: Eteulina

texts.en:
Eteluina started her business creating planters and urns four years ago. She works in the backyard of her house with the help of husband. Eteluina and her husband create about 60 planters each week, varying in size and shape. It takes about 2 hours to complete each load and they usually can make seven in each load. If the weather permits and it does not rain, they can finish their work for the week within three days. They use the sun and the wind to dry the cement.

Eteluina and her husband are suppliers for a few companies. Every week they fill up a truck to deliver the urns to their clients in other cities.

Eteluina and her husband are also parents of five children. One of their children is working in Spain and the other four occasionally help them with their work. Before starting their business, they worked selling outdoor wear clothing, such as Champion. They are in need of a loan to buy sand to use in their mixture to create cement.

loans.use: Purchase sand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To replace his cab engine that is beyond repair

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane M. is a 42 year old married mother of 6 children (ages 22, 18, 14, 14, 12, 10) who has a retail business and a piggery. She wants the loan to increase the stock in her retail store. From the profits she wants to build a residential house.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase her stock in her retail store

loans.name: Hamisa

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Hamisa M.. She is married with three children, ages 12, 15, and 17, and has one other dependent, who is her niece. In 2001 Hamisa established a clothing business and now requires a loan of $450 in order to expand her range of clothing. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her range of clothing.

loans.name: Srey Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Aun P. , 21, and her husband have been married for three years and have one son. Srey Aun and her family live across the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

She has been a silk weaver since 2003. It’s a skill she learned from her sister. Her husband grows rice and runs a horse cart in the village. She is requesting a loan for the third time, in the amount of $200. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria belongs to the communal bank Ayllu, which means "Familia" in Quechua. She has been a member for 7 years and has learned how to save and be responsible with her money.

Maria is 30 years old and is a single mother of three children. She sells propane gas from a store she rents and has employees that deliver her product to customers. Additionally, Maria has a tire shop where her employees fix and sell tires. She needs a loan in the amount of 1500 soles to purchase a motorcycle for the delivery of propane gas.

Maria's dreams are owning her store (instead of renting), expanding her business, building her house and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Ayllu que significa “Familia” en quechua hace 7 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar y ser responsable.

Maria es madre soltera, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda donde vende gas propano, en un local alquilado y también reparte a domicilio para lo cual cuenta con empleados. Además Maria tiene una llantería, donde cuenta con empleados que brindan servicio de arreglado y venta de llantas.

Maria necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una motocicleta para el reparto de gas.

Los sueños de Maria son tener local propio, mejorar su negocio, que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle for the delivery of propane gas.

loans.name: Milpa 2 Group

texts.es:
Catarina is a single mother and does artisan work and plants and sells flowers. She sells her flowers from the state capital. She buys the seed in San Cristobal and resells them in Tuxtla. The cost of transport is a pretty big burden to her. All the income she generates is used to support her family. With the loan she receives she would like to buy more seeds and fertilizers so that she can grow a greater variety of flowers. The other members of Catarina's group are: Rosa H. A., Maria A. H., Maria P. H. and Maria H. P.. They all do artisan work.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

CATARINA ES SOLTERA Y SE DEDICA A LA ARTESANIA Y A LA SIEMBRA DE FLORES EN PEQUEÑA CANTIDAD, LAS CUALES LLEVA A VENDER A LA CAPITAL DEL ESTADO, ALGUNAS FLORES LAS COMPRA EN SAN CRISTOBAL Y LAS REVENDE EN TUXTLA, SE GASTA MUCHO EN TRANSPORTE DICE, LO QUE OPTIENE DE LAS VENTAS SE DESTINA AL GASTO FAMILIAR, CON SU CREDITO LE GUSTARIA COMPRAR SEMULLAS Y FERTILIZANTES PARA PODER CULTIVAR MAS VARIEDAD DE FLORES, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: ROSA H. A., MARIA A. H. , MARIA PÉREZ H. Y MARIA H. PÉREZ SON ARTESANAS.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase products for a small convenience store, firewood, and raw materials to make fabrics

loans.name: Noe Magdiel

texts.es:
Noe is married to Mrs. Ma. Guadalupe Arriaga Piñón who is a homemaker. They have two children: Cinthia who is 11 years old and Erick who is 6 years old. Both are in elementary school. Noe began his business as he had always liked sales and it allowed him to bring in extra income to give his family a better quality of life since his salary, as an employee, was very low and it didn't allow him to meet his growing financial obligations. Additionally, his children were constantly requesting more things for school and Noe didn't have the money. As a result, he searched for another activity, which would allow him to continue to work his regular job without neglecting his family -- he found sales. He began in March 2006 when a neighbor invited him to help her sell jewelry. He began to offer these products to his work colleagues who began to buy items for their wives and daughters. Noe realized that it was a good business and he decided to go out on his own to earn more money. In this way, he began his business.

Noe needs a loan of US $300, which will be repaid in four months, to purchase merchandise and fulfill his customers' order and increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Noe esta casado con la Sra. Ma. Guadalupe Arriaga Piñón, quien se dedica a las labores del hogar Tienen 2 hijos: Cinthia de 11 años y Erick de 6 años, ambos estudiantes de primaria. Inició el negocio por que siempre le han gustado las ventas y además de esta forma obtiene un ingreso extra para darles un mejor nivel de vida a mi familia, ya que su salario como empleado era muy bajo y no les alcanzaba ya que sus compromisos economicos eran cada vez mas grandes, sus hijos cada vez pedían mas cosas para la escuela y no tenía dinero, por eso busco alguna otra actividad a la cual dedicarse sin descuidar su trabajo y su familia y lo encontré en las ventas. Comenzó en Marzo de 2006, cuando una vecina lo invitó a que le ayudara a vender joyería y el empezó a ofrecerla entre sus compañeros de trabajo los cuales le empezaron a comprar para sus esposas e hijas y como se dío cuenta que era buen negocio decidío independizarse para obtener más ganancias y fue así como inició su negocio.

El necesita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir los pedidos de sus clientes y asi incrementar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Sarah Sserunjoji's Group

texts.en:
Sarah S., 28 years old and the married mother of four school-aged children, is the leader of a group of five women. Sarah lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season. She has been running her small retail shop for the last eight years. The market for Sarah's business is moderate, her greatest challenge being the fact that many customers prefer cheap commodities.

Sarah decided to begin working with MCDT so she could set up her retail shop. She plans on using this loan to expand her business. In the past she has paid back 19 loans and has used the money to increase her personal income and standard of living.

loans.use: To expand her business.

texts.es:
Yovana nació en la comunidad de Checca – Distrito de Ilave, tiene 23 años de edad estudió quinto de secundaria, es conviviente, madre de dos hijas de 03 y 05 años, actualmente vive en el Jr. Santa Cruz s/n,  Mazocruz.

Es socia hace un año del Banco Julia Jiménez  distrito de Santa Rosa  Provincia del Collao – Puno, hace seis años instaló su taller de carpintería donde trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, generalmente confecciona  muebles como: roperos, mesas, sillas, reposteros y otros.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará madera por el valor de mil nuevos soles y 20 planchas de triplay.

Su sueño es tener una tienda de muebles y una ferretería en la misma población de Mazocruz, y así  poder educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.

loans.use: Compra de madera y triplay al por mayor.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra D. est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle habite à WOme, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togo. Revendeuse des produits d’alimentation générale, Abra souhaite accroître la taille de son commerce en s’approvisionnant en achetant des cartons de boîtes de conserves, de savons, desvsacs de riz et autres produits ainsi que de louer un magasin. Elle compte sur cette chance pour améliorer les conditions de sa vie
texts.en:
Abra D. is 45 years old. married, and the mother of three (3) children. She lives in Wome, a village located approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Abra sells basic necessity products. She would like to increase the size of her stock and business by purchasing cartons of boxes, jams, soap, sacks of rice, and other products as well as paying for the rent of her store. She hopes that this opportunity will improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cartons of boxes, jams, soap, sacks of rice, and other products and paying for the rent of her store.

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es: El señor José habita en el barrio tres ochenta, barrio que se ubica en la capital Managua, tiene 29 años de vivir en su casa propia,  el señor José tiene 41 años de edad, se encuentra casado con la señora Marlene Haydee Cruz, que es comerciante vende refresco   y repostería, ella le  ayuda a su esposo en los gastos de la casa, ambos tienen tres hijos de diferentes edades de 20,  19 y 16 años de edad. Actualmente el señor José se desempeña como operario de limpieza en la  Alcaldía Municipal, teniendo 8 años de laborar en la institución, el aspira poder apoyar a su familia a través de ir mejorando su casa y poder en un futuro  establecer una pulpería para obtener mas ingresos para su hogar, el crédito que esta solicitando es para poner techo a su vivienda, por tanto el esta necesitando la cantidad de C$ 5, 000 aun plazo de 9  meses que es lo que requiere para la compra de zinc, puertas tablero y hierro para verjas.
texts.en:
Jose live in the 380 neighborhood in the capitol city of Managua. He is 41 years old and has lived in his own home for 29 years. He is married to Mrs. Marlene Haydee Cruz who sells refreshments and pastries, helping her husband with the costs of the home. They have three children of 20, 19, and 16 years of age. Jose is employed by the municipality, where he has worked as a sanitation operator for 8 years. He aspires to be able to support his family through improving his home and in the future to be able to open a general store to obtain more household income. The loan he is requesting is to put a roof on his home. He needs a loan of $275 for a period of 9 months. He needs the loan to purchase zinc, plywood, and iron for framing.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put a roof on his house.

loans.name: Mrs. Salorn Meak Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of seventeen people is located in Kandal Kraom village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Salorn M. is the  village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a 0.3-hectar plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Morn Samoeurn, uses his motorbike as a carry cart in order to transport goods and passengers for an income. The business is not going well because his cart is too old. This makes his passengers feel uncomfortable. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Salorn M. decided to ask for a loan to fix her husband’s cart to enable him to re-start his business. Mrs. Salorn M. is 28 years old and the mother of two children. One child is enrolled in the local school, while the youngest one is  five years old. 
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% to Kiva.

loans.use: To fix her husband’s cart to re-start his business.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Mrs. Sao R., age 59, runs a rice store in her home. She purchases rice from a farmer and resells it to her customers for profit, and has been in this business since 1998. She takes care of five children, four of whom are students and one is a farmer. Her husband, Mr. Nob Ra, 42, is a rice farmer. She has applied for a loan to increase the amount of rice in her store, and to buy a secondhand motorcycle and a bicycle to make transportation easier for her family. They all reside in Pursat Province.

loans.use: To buy more rice, a secondhand motorcycle, and a bicycle.

loans.name: Seepa

texts.en: Seepa M., 31, is married with 1 child.  She has 3 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers and general public 6 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 650 Tala (~270 USD).  SPBD loans are Seepa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase plant sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, fertilizer

loans.name: Chinnerau

texts.en:
Mr. Chinnerau U., 33, and his wife, Mrs. Theary Moeurn, 30, have been married for ten years. They have two children: one son and one daughter, both of whom are still young. The family lives in a small village across Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Chinnerau has been a security guard in Phnom Penh for three years. His wife has been selling silk fabric for four years. She buys them from a market in Phnom Penh for resale at the other provinces. Chinnerau is requesting his first loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike and a passenger trailer to drive a motor taxi (Tuk Tuk).

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a passenger trailer to drive a motor taxi (Tuk Tuk).

loans.name: Tiem

texts.en:
Mrs. Tiem K. is a villager in Thkouv village in Takeo province. She is a Khmer cake seller. Her husband, Mr. Um Vath, is a construction worker. Aside from this career, he is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. Even though they try to work hard, they still don't earn enough income to support their household.

In order to improve their income, Mrs. Tiem K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She is a 35-year-old mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Kitimbwa Mixed Group

texts.en:
Proscovia Nairuba is a wedding coordinator. She does all the arranging of the wedding cake, the wedding clothes, and the decorations. In Uganda, it is traditional for special gift baskets to be prepared and given to the bride and groom in a very ceremonial way at the wedding. These baskets should be covered with decorations that match the decorations at the rest of the wedding. All of the cars involved in a wedding also have some ribbon tied around that matches the wedding’s colors. Proscovia is responsible for all of these arrangements.

For the wedding clothes, Proscovia has a dress that she rents out for 100,000 USH. This allows her to make a large profit because she can either loan her own, which makes her the most money, or she can rent one from a friend for about 40,000 USH. This means that she can earn anywhere between 60,000 – 100,000 USH just on the clothing for the wedding. Then for decorations she can earn anywhere from 80,000 – 100,000 profit per wedding.

Proscovia has 2 workers that help her with all of the arrangements needed for this business. She also has a side business selling women’s tops and bracelets. She employs two people who sell these items for her in the surrounding markets.

Proscovia and her husband have 3 kids together that they care for, and she has one, who is the oldest, that is just hers and that she provides everything for. With the money that she makes, she is now able to send this oldest girl to boarding school. This is a dream come true for her.

Proscovia is requesting a loan of 700,000 USH to purchase two veils for weddings she is coordinating this month. She will also use part of the loan to buy some more women’s tops and bracelets for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase 2 veils, some women's tops, and some bracelets

loans.name: Fulvia

texts.es:
La Señora Fulvia G. es de la Ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Ycua Pai. Ella tiene su casa propia. Fulvia tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera con 4 hijos, queines son todos mayores de edad y que trabajan en forma independientes.

Se dedica en las compras y ventas de productos de carne en el mercado municipal de Santani. Tiene buenos ingresos, mediante una buena clientela y buenos servicios.

Posee exelentes referencias comerciales y personales, es una señora muy trabajadora y conocida en el barrio.  El cliente sueña en construir un salon de material en su domicilio para poner su negocio y asi poder trabajar desde su propia casa.
texts.en:
Fulvia G. lives in the City of San Estanislao, Ycua Pai Neighborhood. She is a home owner. Fulvia is 48 years old. She is single and she has 4 children, all of them of age and independent. She buys and sells meat products in the municipal market in Santani. Her income is fairly good, as she has a nice clientele and she provides good service. She has excellent business and personal references. She is very hard working and well known in her neighborhood. Her dream is to build a new brick room in her house to open a shop and, then, be able to work from home

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a new room in her business

loans.name: Akpene

texts.fr: Akpene K. est une jeune femme de 35 ans, mariée et mère d’un garçon. Elle est productrice et revendeuse de jus de fruits au bord de la route à Lomé. Elle livre aussi ses produits à d’autres revendeuses. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de on commerce afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de ses clients. Elle bénéficie de son premier crédit chez FECECAV et promet des remboursements à temps.
texts.en:
Akpene K. is a young women, 35 years old, married, and the mother of a boy. She produces and sells fruit juices along side the road to Lomé. She also delivers her goods to other retailers. She would like to use this loan to increase her business capacity in order to respond better to the needs of her customers. She’s benefiting from her first loan with FECECAV and promises to make the payments on time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and a refirgerator

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John A. is 32 years old, married and has three children, all currently in school. He makes a living selling spare parts for cars, and is also an auto electrician. He buys spare parts in bulk, and retails them to his customers. As a result of his rich experience as an auto electrician, he has earned the trust and confidence of many clients, who come to service their vehicles in his shop.

John enjoys his trade very much, but does not have enough money to support his family as he would like, especially because many of the parts he buys have gone up in price lately. He has applied for a loan to buy a new stock of spare parts and scrap metal to sell to his customers. He believes that this loan will allow him to save more to finance his children's education and also build his own shop. John is a member of a loan group called Mawulawe (which means "things are in God's hands") Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee and support one another when making loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and scrap metal in bulk to sell to his customers

loans.name: Zirahon

texts.ru: Набиева Зирахон-1965 года рождения, замужем,  имеет 3-х детей . Её муж уехал в Российскую Федерацию, чтобы там зарабатывать деньги, как и многие рабочие мигранты, которые не могут найти здесь нормальную работу. Зирахон  занимается продажей мелких товаров ,таких как хозяйственные товары, электроприборы и т . д. Её торговая точка расположена  на Центральном рынке Спитаменского района и поэтому торговля у нее идет хорошо. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и открыть еще одну точку продажи.
texts.en:
Born in 1965, Zirahon N. is married and has 3 children. Her husband went to Russia to earn money, just like many migrant workers, who could not find work here at home. Zirahon is involved in sales of small goods, such as household products, electric appliances, etc. Because her retail outlet is located at the Central market of the Spitamen district, her sales are going well. Zirahon wants to expand her business and open one more retail store.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open another store

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mr. Mai R., 37, and his wife, Mrs. Sarum Tun, 44, have been married since 1985. They have five children: three sons (all of whom are construction workers), two daughters (one is in school and another daughter is still young). The family lives along National Road Number one, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mai has been a construction worker for over 20 years. He works in his village and in the nearby district. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. He hopes to support his daughters’ further education. Mai’s materials and tools are old and some parts break down; it upsets his business because he cannot work smoothly. The construction work is the main source of income for the family. So, he is requesting his first loan of $500 to purchase new construction materials and tools to continue the business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials and tools for his business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
