Alice is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is single and has two children who are currently in school. For the past seven years, Alice has been working hard to manage her brickmaking business, in which she sells bricks and firewood. 

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more firewood for resale, and it will help Alice to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Alice hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her supply. 

Alice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more firewood for resale,

loans.name: Katima

texts.fr:
Katima est une femme  âgé(e) de 34 ans. Elle est mariée å un  déclarant en douane. Elle a 02 enfants, 01 scolarisé. Le premier a 06 ans et le dernier a 03ans.
Katima travaille comme revendeuse de charbons  de bois (combustible utilisé dans la cuisine)depuis 2005. Elle vend seule à la maison et achète à Lomé.
Katima a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de charbons de bois. Elle veut diversifier l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Katima voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Katima is 34 years old. She is married to a customs officer. The couple have 2 children, aged 3 and 6. The eldest child attends school. Since 2005, Katima has been selling charcoal for use in kitchens. She gets her supplies in Lomé and resells them from her home.

Katima is requesting her 3rd loan from WAGES in order to restock on charcoal. In the coming years, she would like to diversify her activities and expand her business. She plans to use her profits to take care of her family´s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a business-lady who runs a boutique to earn a living.  She has been in the business for two years.
  
Winnie, who is a single mother of a two-year-old child, works hard in her business so as to provide for her child.

Winnie desires to expand her business in five years for more income generation.  She has requested 
80,000 Kenya shillings to buy beauty products.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Soraida

texts.es:
La señora Soraida a sus 41 años de edad es madre de tres hijos de 20, 18 y 12 años de edad, desde sus 13 años de edad la señora Soraida aprendió el manejo de maquinas de confección en un colegio de monjas en un pueblo de Antioquia donde estudiaba. Debido a dificultades económicas la señora Soraida y sus padres tuvieron que desplazarse para la ciudad de Medellín, desde entonces la señora Soraida empezó a trabajar como operaria de maquina plana.

La señora Soraida por un tiempo paro de trabajar, pero debido a que su esposo se quedó sin trabajo retomó desde su propia casa con un pequeño taller de confección que le permite conseguir los ingresos para el sustento de su hogar. La señora Soraida requiere de la compra de insumos como hilos y telas y además realizarle mantenimiento al motor de dos de sus maquinas, que le permitan mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Soraida, 41, is the mother of three sons, who are 20, 18 and 12 years of age. When she was 13 years old, Soraida learned how to operate sewing machines in a school run by nuns in a town in Antioquia, where she was studying. Due to economic difficulties, Soraida and her parents had to move to the city of Medellín, where she began to work as a flat machine operator. 

For a while Soraida stopped working however, due to her husband’s lack of employment, she has resumed working from her own home in a small workshop, which allows her to earn an income to support her household. She needs to purchase supplies, such as thread and fabric, and also to have the motors of two of her machines serviced, which will permit her to improve her income and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to service two of her sewing machines and to purchase supplies such as fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Fyuduruva

texts.en: Fyuduruva is 28 years old, married and has two young children. Her husband is a fisherman and she earns a living by selling fish which she brines and salts.  She is applying for this loan to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alma Yanett

texts.es: La señora Alma de 33 años es casada tiene 3 hijos y desde hace 2 años ella con el ayuda de su esposo el Sr. Ramiro decidió iniciar un negocio el cual le permitiera apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y que al mismo tiempo le permitiera atender las labores del  hogar como lo son lavar, planchar, cocinar, limpiar la casa y llevar y traer a los niños a la escuela. Buscando Alma la manera de no descuidar ninguna de estas actividades decidió vender hamburguesas y papas fritas en su domicilio acondiciono una área de su cocina para preparar las hamburguesas y poder venderlas sus ventas se han incrementado gracias a la receta y su buen trato con los clientes. La señora Alma requiere el apoyo para compra de equipo como lo es una plancha y una cortadora de papas y poder facilitar el trabajo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Alma is 33 years old, married and has three children and two years ago, with the help of her husband, Ramiro, she decided to start a business which would allow her to help her husband with the household expenses and at the same time permit her to take care of the housework such as washing, ironing, cooking, cleaning the house and taking the children to and from school.

Alma, searching for a way not to neglect any of these activities, decided to sell hamburgers and french fries from her home. She fixed up an area of her kitchen in order to make and sell hamburgers. Sales have increased thanks to the recipe and her good manners with the customers. 

Alma needs help to buy equipment such as a griddle and a potato cutter in order to make it easier to do her work.

loans.use: to buy a griddle and potato cutter

loans.name: Pajo Metal Works Group

texts.en:
Paul is the group leader of Pajo Metal Works. He is 48 this year and happily married with five children. His children are 27, 21, 19, 15 and 9 years old, respectively. All five of them are currently attending school. Paul lives with his family in Cape Coast, the regional capital of the Central Region of Ghana. Paul owns a welding company. He has been in business for the past 20 years. He is the founder of the company and has built the company up from scratch. Today, he has five permanent employees and more than 10 part-time workers. His company manufactures a whole range of products, including housing features and household appliances. His company is even able to remodel scrapped cars. Paul is beloved by the local community due to  his innovations. Prior to this invention, Ghanaians in his community used natural materials such as bamboo and palm leaves to build makeshift shelters for outdoor events such as funerals and soccer matches. These lacked structural integrity and did not provide adequate shelter in rain; in fact, when the rain came, people would abandon the shelter and run away! An extremely enterprising and creative man, Paul designed a cost-effective canopy comprising a metal framework with a waterproof canvas. This product was immensely well-received by consumers. Even then, he did not remain content with this breakthrough and has continually improved this product based on consumer feedback. He has since furnished the design with fluorescent light and electric fans, allowing these temporary shelters to provide not only safety, but also utility and comfort. Paul's most recent endeavor is the manufacturing of clean-cook stoves (a.k.a the Elsa biochar Stove) that utilise waste-products, such as palm-kennel shells, as fuel. This stove is the product of a research project by the African, Caribbean and Pacific (ACP) Group of States and co-financed by the European Union (EU). He is now applying for a micro-loan to purchase raw materials such as metal plates in bulk to take advantage of large discount to reduce material cost. Paul is very ambitious and excited about this product. He has secured an agreement with local distributors and plans to sell these stoves to consumers in the entire Central Region, and eventually expand the market to the whole country. Your loan will go a long way, not just in helping Paul achieve his ambitions, but also in providing Ghanaians with a safer means of cooking that is free of indoor and outdoor pollution and reduces deforestation.

Patrick is taking another loan because he needs it to buy additional raw material to complete his work.He will use the current loan to buy new set of equipments and new raw materials for the production of Elsa Biochar Clean Cook Stoves.The loan has help advance the nature of his business.The previous loan helped raised the living standards of his family. The lady who was part of the previous loan has relocated because of marriage hence the changes in membership.

loans.use: to buy metal plates for the production of Elsa Biochar Clean Cook stoves for resale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is an active member of Kabuta ladies in action and a hardworking business lady. She is married and with 4 children one in primary and the other in secondary school.

Virginia started her business over 10years ago. She has 3 different businesses namely Jaribu wholesaler & retailers, oceanic bar & restaurant and Coro bar. All her businesses are in Sagana town. Jaribu wholesale/retailers is the business she expects to expand. She makes sales of usd100per day. Her main products are foodstuffs, household items such as soap, salt, rice, wheat flour & detergents. She employs 7 workers in all her businesses and currently they are doing very well.

loans.use: Virginia wants to stock more rice and be able to supply Muranga clients who are more reliable and offer high prices than Sagana.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pamela would like to buy 150 chicks for rearing

loans.name: Savili

texts.en: Savili is a married mother of six who operates a lawn mowing business targeting locals and businesses that request assistance in mowing the lawn. Today, this business is highly in demand as more and more people in Samoa have decided to live by themselves instead of with their extended families. She is successful because she says she allows credit and also her fees are reasonable so she has many loyal clients.

loans.use: To buy a new weed eater

loans.name: Hawa K.

texts.en: Hawa B. is twenty-eight years old, married with four children.  Her husband is a government employee whose earnings are not sufficient to pay for all the family’s needs.  Hawa started a small stall shop in the open market where she sells onions, hot peppers, salt and spices to supplement her husband’s income.  Hawa is happy with her business because she can earn income to pay for the education expenses of her children.  She is requesting the loan funds to enable her to purchase the business items in wholesale bulk to reduce frequent travels of purchasing the goods in small quantity thus increasing her profit.

loans.use: Purchase food items inventory in bulk from wholesalers

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 48 years old and is married to Roberto, who is 49. They have been together for 25 years and have raised six children who are their pride and joy and their reason for being.

They met when they were very young and even back then worked selling clothing, sheets and blankets. They still have the same business and nowadays their children help out as well. They are pleased with their income so far, as it has allowed them to build a small but comfortable home and to furnish it with furniture and electric appliances.

They have always invested the proceeds of their loans in merchandise and they plan to use this loan to purchase sheets, blankets, etc. to meet increased demand.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Genara tiene 48 años y está casada con Roberto quien actualmente tiene 49 años de edad. Hace 25 años que viven juntos y han logrado criar a 6 hijos que son su orgullo y razón de vivir. Se conocieron cuando eran muy jóvenes y ya desarrollaban la venta de articulos de todo tipo como ser: sábanas, frazadas, ropas de temporada, etc. Hoy día continúan realizando la misma actividad y sus hijos le ayudan con la tarea. Están muy conformes con las ganancias que obtienen con sus ventas pues gracias a ellas han logrado construir una pequeña pero acogedora casa, además de adquirir todos lo necesario para equiparla como ser los muebles y electrodomésticos. Siempre recurrieron a los préstamos para invertirlos principalmente en la compra de mercaderías. En esta oportunidad necesitan el crédito para comprar más mercaderías como sábanas, frazadas, etc. debido a que tienen mucha demanda de las mismas.

loans.use: To purchase blankets and sheets

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru:
Bahtiyor makes “non” – Tajik national bread. His whole family is involved with his business. Bahtiyor is 46 years old. He is married and has 3 children. He has been in business for many years and inherited his profession from his father. Early every morning Bahtiyor starts rolling dough and by 7am one can buy freshly made hot bread. Several small retailers buy fresh bread wholesale from Bahtiyor and sell it in retail at the same market. There are other buyers who come from far away to buy his bread. Bahtiyor has been doing business with MicroInvest for past 2 years and the loans he received helped him to expand his business. He is planning to use new loan to buy flour wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers

Бахтиер занимается выпечкой лепешек – национального таджикского хлеба. В этом бизнесе занята вся его семья. Бахтиеру 46 лет, он женат и имеет 3 детей. В этом бизнесе он уже много лет и эту профессию он унаследовал от своего отца. Ранним утром он начинает раскатывать тесто и к 7 часам утра уже можно купить готовые горячие лепешки. Розничные продавцы покупают у него оптом и продают здесь же на рынке в розницу. Также у него много покупателей которые приезжают издалека за лепешками. В Микроинвест он кредитуется в течении 2-х лет и займы помогли ему в расширении его бизнеса. На новый займ он собирается закупить оптом муку.

loans.use: Bye flour wholesale

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
Cabanillas is home to young, enthusiastic, 23-year-old Lili, who decided to leave her home town and go to the city of Juliaca in search of a better future. With a great deal of effort, Lili and her sister Teodora – who provided unwavering support – were able to set up a small stall selling clothes. Thanks to their perseverance, the variety of their merchandise, and above all the modest prices they offer, their business is providing a reasonable income.

It is Lili’s wish to have more capital to invest in a greater quantity and variety of merchandise, with the goal of generating more income in order to pay for her secondary education, which she is currently completing at a city approved high school. To implement her plans, Lili is requesting a loan, which, thanks to your kind contribution, will allow her to meet her objective.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

El distrito de Cabanillas es el pueblo natal de Lili, joven entusiasta de 23 años que decidió partir en busca de un mejor porvenir hacia la ciudad de Juliaca; actualmente con el apoyo incondicional de su hermana Teodora y con mucho esfuerzo han podido constituir un puestito de ventas de prendas de vestir, negocio que gracias a su perseverancia, variedad de mercadería y sobre todo a los preciosos módicos con las que los ofrecen están obteniendo satisfactorios y beneficiosos ingresos.

El deseo de Lili es contar con más capital para invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería con el objetivo de incrementar sus ingresos económicos para cubrir satisfactoriamente los gastos de los estudios superiores que viene realizando en un reconocido instituto de su ciudad. Para concretar sus planes solicita un préstamo de dinero que gracias a tu gentil colaboración le permitirá cumplir con su objetivo.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of clothing to sell in the local city market.

loans.name: Khin

texts.en: Mrs. Khin S. Neang,39, is married with four school-aged children and lives in Bathambong province, Cambodia. She is a housewife cooking food for her family, while her husband works as a carpenter, making tables, chairs, beds, cabinets and other wooden furniture, making on average around $10/day. Mrs. Khin S. Neang hopes to use this loan to purchase more carpentry tools and other supplies for her husband to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more carpentry tools for her husband to expand his inventory.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! Teddy K. is a 34-year-old single woman with one child, who is 15 years old. In 2002 Teddy established a soft drink business. Teddy has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and she now seeks another loan in order to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks in bulk. Undoubtedly, Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or 'words" in the world. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of "bar" selling Coke, Fanta, and Guinness; Teddy notes that Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the less-populated areas, but she is sure that Pepsi is working on expanding into those areas too!). The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing, which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture regardless of whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd. in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

About SELFINA:
SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing whereby SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA will purchase equipment from said client, extend a loan to her, and then lease the same equipment back to her – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, financial institutions do not consider Tanzanian women to be credit-worthy because they lack tangible assets that could serve as collateral. As a result, Tanzanian women with low income receive poor financial support and meager access to basic needs and services. SELFINA thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Mrs. Him C. is 40 years old. She sells food in front of the garment factory in the Banlar Saet village near Phnom Penh City. She sells mostly to garment workers and earns about $3.00 a day.

Her husband, Mr. Roem Roschea, is 40 years old and drives a motorcycle taxi. He can earn up to $2.50 a day. They have four children, one of whom can contribute about $2.00 a day to the family by working in the garment factory.

Him's business can earn just enough to support the daily expenses. The materials are old and out of date. She will use this loan of $700.00 to upgrade her business. She is applying for the loan from HKL because she is satisfied with their methodology.

loans.use: To expand her business in order to attract more customers

loans.name: Doctora

texts.en:
Doctora P., mother of four children, is a budding entrepreneur who lives in the Los Alcarrizos community of Santo Domingo. One year ago, she took from FSMA a loan with which she started a small business selling silver jewelry. The entrepreneur invested the funds wisely and she has managed to make her business successful. Currently she has a well-established clientele which is growing.

Doctora plans on using her loan to enlarge her stock, adding new styles of earrings and rings which are in high demand by her customers. Doctora’s business supports her children’s education and the rent for the family’s house.

loans.use: purchase of silver jewelry for her small business

location.town: Buenos Aires community of Santo Domingo

loans.name: Asuntina

texts.es:
Ausuntina is a loving mother and model wife in the area of Apurimac, because of work she decided to situate herself in the city of Juliaca, with the little money she earns she was able to obtain a tricycle that she can use to sell her delicious vegetable stew in a traveling manner, before her husband worked as a chauffer for a transportation company with the hopes of increasing their income and bettering the quality of life of his beloved family. After saving a sufficient amount with the help of her husband they decided to obtain a place to open a restaurant, nowadays this small but cozy space is being converted into one of the most crowded in her area, because she cordially attends to her customers and above all because of the variety and delicious plates that they prepare. Thanks to this business that they want to improve, this loving pair is able to cover their daily expenses and furthermore the education of their 4 small children.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Asuntina es una madre muy amorosa y ejemplar esposa natural del departamento de Apurímac, por motivos de trabajo decidió radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca, desde entonces con el poco dinero que contaba se dispuso a adquirir un triciclo para vender sus deliciosos potajes en forma ambulatoria, en tanto su esposo trabajaba como chofer en una empresa de transporte con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos económicos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su amada familia.Luego de ahorrar lo suficiente con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo decidieron alquilaron un local para abrir un restaurante, actualmente este pequeño pero acogedor espacio se está convirtiendo en uno de los más concurridos de su localidad, por la cordialidad con la que atienden y sobre todo por la variedad y deliciosos platillos que preparan.Gracias a este negocio que desean ampliar, esta encantadora pareja está logrando cubrir sus gastos primordiales y sobre todo la educación de sus 4 menores hijos.

loans.use: To increase the space of their restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of candies and sweeties to sell in her community

loans.name: Sima Duong Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Mrs Sima D. and this group comprises of five members in Dem Popel Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs Sima D. is currently in the business of Khmer noodle selling and she requested a loan in order to expand it since her business activity is working very well. Her husband, Mr Sophal Chea, is a fish seller in the local market.

Mrs Sima D. is 49 and the mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in school while the other two are staying at home because they are still too young to work or study.

One of the group members, Mr Vin N., could not come to take a loan so he is not presented in the photo, but his wife came instead. Thus, she is presented in the picture.

loans.use: To expand her Khmer noodle selling in order to improve her living condition.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Mr. Mamadou D. is 38 years old and lives with his son and wife in a monogamous family in the district of Heremakono in Bougouni in the Sikasso region in the Republic in Mali. Early on, he left his studies in order to start businesses that generated income, notably repairing motorcycles, a skill he learned at a young age from his uncle.

With 10 years of experience, he has a great reputation and a perfect mastery of this business in the city of Banimonotié Bougouni.

In order to obtain the financial resources needed to meet the ever growing demand of his clients, he has asked for a loan through Soro Yiriwaso. It is his first loan with this institution.

With this loan, he hopes to buy motorcycle parts in Bamako, the capital of the Republic of Mali, and resell them retail at his store for cash and sometimes credit.

Mr. Mamadou hopes to have a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA, which he will use to pay the interest on the loan, expand his business, and provide for the expenses of his family. `

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Mamadou D. est agé de 38 ans et vit avec son enfant et son épouse dans une famille nomogame au quartier Heremakono de Bougouni Région de Sikasso République du Mali Très tot il a interompu avec la fréquentation scolaire pour se entreprendre les activités génératrices de revenus notamment la réparation des motos qu’il a apprise dès son jeune âge auprès de son oncle. Avec une experience de 10 ans, il jouit d’une grande réputation et une parfaite maitrise de cette activité dans la cité du Banimonotié Bougouni. Pour obtenir une ressource financière afin de faire face aux demandes sans cesse croissantes de sa clientèle il sollicite la collaboration de Soro Yiriwaso.Il est à sa prémière expérience avec l’institution. Avec ce pret il compte achéter les pièces détachées pour moto à Bamako capitale de la République du Mali et les revendre sur place dans sa boutique en détail au comptant et quelques fois à crédit. Monsieur Mamadou compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA qu’il utilisera à payer les intérêts du prêt, aggrandir son entreprise et assurer les depenses de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle parts

loans.name: Ni Made Wiarti

texts.id:
I Komang Sumertama is very proud of her wife: Ni Made Wiarti. Born in 1975, Ni Made Wiarti is a faithful and hard working wife. She does not only housewife tasks but also raises piglets. The mother of I Nengah Edi Erawan (9 years old) is able to earn almost as much as her husband’s income.

Before the increase of fuel price, Ni Made Wiarti was able to earn IDR 700,000 per cycle, but the increase of goods price as the effect of the increase of fuel price, decrease her income. To purchase a piglet, she has to have IDR 325,000, and more to purchase the fodder. With the loan from DInari, Ni Made Wiarti expects to be able to increase the number of pigs she manages, which will be able to increase the income. She wants to save some of the income as a reserve for her boy’s education fund in the future.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana DK, Kiva volunteer.

I Komang Sumertama sangat bangga mempunyai Istri Ni Made Wiarti .Wanita kelahiran tahun 1975 ini begitu ulet dalam melakukan pekerjaanya, baik selaku ibu rumah tangga maupun membantu pekerjaan suaminya yang berprofesi sebagai petani dan semua pekerjaan itu dikerjakannya dengan cekatan dan telah menjadi rutinitas setiap hari mulai jam 8 pagi setelah menyelesaikan pekerjaan di dapur. Namun begitu, disela sela kesibukan itu, Ibu dari I Nengah Edi erawan (9 Th ) ini juga memiliki satu usaha yaitu beternak babi .Bahkan hasil yang di dapat tak beda jauh dengan pendapatan suaminya. Pendapatan yang cukup untuk menambah biaya kebutuhan hidup sehari-hari. Diawali dengan 2 ekor penggemukan yang di pelihara dalam waktu 6 bulan. Dulu Ni Made Wiarti bisa meraih keuntungan Rp. 700.000.- / panen . Namun setelah terjadinya perubahan perekonomian akibat kenaikan BBM semua barang barang pun ikut naik. Begitu juga halnya dengan bibit babi maupun pakannya. Untuk membeli satu ekor bibit babi sekarang I Made Wiarti harus menyediakan uang Rp. 325.000.- belum lagi biaya pakan yang sangat tinggi. Namun, Ni Made Wiarti tak mau menyerah begitu saja walau dengan modal pinjaman dari Dinari, ia tetap menjalankan usahanya ini bahkan jumlah peliharaanya pun lebih banyak. Tentunya juga dengan harapan hasil panennya lebih banyak sehingga keuntungannya jadi meningkat. Dengan demikian Ni Made Wiarti bisa menabung untuk persiapan biaya pendidikan anaknya.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and fodder

loans.name: Berha Aurora

texts.es:
La Señora Bertha, socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Banda de Shilcayo. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la confección de todo tipo de prendas de vestir tanto para damas como para caballeros y niños. El taller está ubicado en el Jr. Recreo Mz G Lt- 7, lugar donde confecciona y vende. También trabaja en base a pedidos.

Las ventas y pedidos han aumentado gracias a su responsabilidad, puntualidad y buen acabado de sus confecciones, con ello espera mejorar su condición económica y disponibilidad de capital. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1200, el cual pagará en 06 meses, comprará hilos de diferentes colores, blondas, cierres, telas de diversas variedades, colores y acabados, y de esa manera poder contar con lo necesario cuando tiene que realizar sus trabajos en la confección de todo tipo de prendas de vestir que le solicitan sus clientes, lo cuales muchas veces sólo le piden dan el modelo para que ella los confeccione y los venda.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres de la Colina II,” she lives in the region and province of San Martin in Banda de Shilcayo state. For 10 years she has dedicated herself to making all kinds of clothing items for men, women and children. The workshop is located on Jr. Recreo Mz G Lt- 7, where she makes and sells her items. She also takes orders.

The sales and orders have increased thanks to her responsibility, punctuality and good quality of her work, and she hopes to improve her economic situation and have more capital available.

With this loan of S/.1200, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy different color threads, silk lace, zippers, a variety of fabric of different colors and finishes, and in this way she will be able to have everything necessary in order to complete her work making all kinds of clothing items that her customers request, which many times they only have to ask and she will make and sell the items.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase threads and fabrics

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en: Alijon has been in an agro-business for more than 6 years. He grows onions and wheat, and also has a business fattening cattle. That is how he supports his family. He wants to buy more fertilizers and use them on onions to get a higher yield. With the money from his yield and business, he wants to help his son to marry.

loans.use: To purchase chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Nurali

texts.en: Nurali is 48 years old and lives in Khachmaz town. He is married with two children. He has been in the taxi business for seven years. He would like a loan of 800 AZN in order to buy spare parts.

loans.use: to buy the spare parts

loans.name: Slamas

texts.en:
Mrs. Slamas H., 49, is a widow with one son who is twenty-eight years old. He assists his mother in selling fish. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Slamas has been selling fish for nineteen years. She buys them from fisherman along the Mekong River for re-sale to the middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a boat and an apparatus for fishing.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and an apparatus for fishing

loans.name: Vaialalua

texts.en: Vaialalua U., 29, is single with no children.  She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public 3 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (about $187 USD).  SPBD loans are Vaialalua’s only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase Gromoxone, sting, chemicals, and bush knives for her farming business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 60-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Ali has been working as a farmer for 4 years. He sells vegetables. He is requesting a loan of $1100 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase seedlings.

Ali has been a microcredit client for 7 years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans have influenced his work as well as his life in a good way. Thanks to his loans, he was able to improve and expand his business and his family situation at the same time. His clients are his friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans to expand his business by growing more vegetables.

loans.use: Purchase vegetable seedlings to plan

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao C., 39, is married to Kheoun, 40, a local construction worker. They have three children, all of whom are still young and attending school. Kheoun works very hard and has profited from his work. Recently, due to the family's expenses, he has been working every day. He would now like to spread his service to more people in Phnom Penh. C. works in a garment factory. She is a responsible mother and good to her family and her neighbors. She is requesting a loan of $200 to buy more construction supplies for her husband. The loan will help her family achieve a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more construction supplies for her husband

loans.name: Maria Antonia,

texts.es:
Con la idea de hacerse de un ingreso extra para algunos gastos en el hogar, Maria Antonia se animo a ayudara una amiga muy cercana a vender cosméticos por catálogo. Poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia en el negocio, así que se convirtió después de dos años en una socia del negocio de su amiga prácticamente.

El cuidado de su casa y de sus menores hijos es lo que le ocupa la mayor parte del tiempo a Maria Antonia; sin embargo, en un futuro ella quisiera ser titular del negocio de productos de belleza y poder vender en mayores cantidades. Por ahora es su esposo, quien trabaja como electricista, y las hijas mayores son quienes se encargan de velar por el mantenimiento de la casa.
texts.en:
With the intention of earning some extra income for household expenses, Maria Antonia decided to help a close friend sell cosmetics from a catalog. Little by little she gained experience in the business. After two years she became business partners with her friend. The majority of her time is spent taking care of her house and her youngest children. Nevertheless, in the future she would like to run her own beauty products business and be able to sell larger quantities. For now her husband, who works as an electrician, and her oldest daughters are the ones who are responsible for providing for the upkeep on the house.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help pay for the studies of her youngest daughter, who studies languages at the university.

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
Berta es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita.
Berta es casada, tiene 60 años y 2 hijos,  Berta tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, además los días sábados y domingos vende comida típica, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.
Berta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Berta son mejorar su negocio y surtir con mas productos su negocio.
texts.en:
Berta is a partner of the Communal Bank Santa Rita. She is 60, married with two children. She has a warehouse at home from which she sells groceries and vegetables. On Saturdays and Sundays she sells typical meals with help from her husband. Berta needs a USD $325 load for the purchase of rice and sugar. Berta's goals are to improve her business and provide more products for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice and sugar

loans.name: Elías

texts.es: Elías tiene 65 años, es casado y tiene 6 hijos que ya viven fuera de casa, vive con su esposa en su casa propia. La agricultura es parte de su vida, y le permitió educar a cada uno de sus hijos, pero él sigue labrando la tierra como cuando sus hijos eran pequeños; hasta el momento ha sembrado 6 hectáreas divididas entre papa, alverjas y maíz. Pero de todas las siembras que realiza la que le genera más ingresos económicos es la papa, solo que en esta temporada tiene dificultad con algunas de sus chacras a las que le afectó una plaga, las hojas se vuelven de color negro, y merma el desarrollo del producto, por lo que su actual preocupación es de salvar los cultivos. Aparte de lidiar con este tipo de dificultades, Elías se siente muy contento por sus otros cultivos, y cuando llegue la época de cosechar los podrá negociar a un buen precio, para que pueda comprarse una mula para llevar sus cargas. El es un cliente muy puntual, viene trabajando su 4to préstamo con MFP y en cada reunión de su banco comunal asiste puntualmente y siempre sugirió ideas para mejorar. El dinero que solicita es para comprar insecticidas para el controlar el mal de sus plantas.
texts.en:
Elías is 65 years old, is married with six children that don't live at home. He lives with his wife in their own home. Agriculture is part of their life, and has enabled them to educate each child, but he continues to work the land while like when his children were young. At the moment he has planted six hectares of land divided into potato, peas, and corn. Of all the crops the potato yields the most profit, but this season he has more difficulty because some of the land is affected by pests, the leaves turn black, reducing the development of the product. His current preoccupation is to save the crops.

Apart from dealing with these difficulties, Elías feels very happy with his other crops, and when the time comes to harvest he will be able to negotiate a good price, so that he can buy a mule to carry his loads. He is a very punctual customer, who is working on his fourth loan with MFP, each village bank meeting he attends on time and always suggests ways to improve it. The money he requests is to buy insecticides to control the bad parts of his plants.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de insecticidas

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina was born in 1987 and comes from the big village of Petrovo. She lives with her husband and 2 children. Her husband is employed and he pays for their daily costs. Marina takes care of the household and their children. She keeps herself busy in the garden producing vegetables for her family. But now she decided to start raising vegetables for sale, and she requests the loan from WWI in the amount of 1200 KM. Marina will use this loan to buy potato and corn seeds. This will increase her household income and provide a higher living standard.

loans.use: To purchase seeds

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce B. is thirty-nine years old and married with four children. She sells provisions and drinks. She hopes for a loan to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry-feed and feeding equipment

loans.name: Muiz

texts.en: Muiz is a 20-year-old single man . He has a hairdresser shop in the middle of Ramallah city, Palestine. He has requested a loan of 1250 US dollars from Ryada in order to purchase a chair for his salon. He is very thankful in advance to all who wish to support him.

loans.use: To purchase a chair for his salon

loans.name: Kav's Group

texts.en:
The four persons shown in the photograph above are low-income people who are jointly requesting a loan. They are all living in Siem Reap Province, in Cambodia. One of these people, Mr. Kav C., age 40, has been selected to be a leader by the other group members.

Kav C. and his wife currently have a fishing business in and around the Tunle Sap River. This couple has been fishing in the river for more than nine years and earn an average of $5 per day to contribute to their three school-aged children, including school fees.

Due to the coming rising water and fishing season, the river is full of fish. Kav C., however, is lacking equipment to fish and that is why he requested a loan to purchase nets, traps, and other tools for his fishing operations.

There are three other borrowers who have requested a loan as follows:

Mrs. S. will be using her loan to better support her fishing business.

Mrs. S. makes a living by fishing and is asking for a loan to buy a boat engine to improve her business.

Mrs. S. will be using the Kiva loan to buy more nets and traps to fish better.

loans.use: To purchase nets, traps, and other tools for his fishing operations

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita F. of Brgy. Nayon, San Enrique, Negros Occidental is a 51-year-old married woman with five children. She is single-minded in her mission to assist her husband in improving their family's quality of life.

For over fifteen years now, Mrs. F. has been engaged in buying and selling fish and shrimps in the community and other neighboring towns. This earns for the family Php 8,000 per month and she says that the income is a big help. The goal that she had when she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon - to improve her family's condition, is slowly being fulfilled. Strong determination, hard work, courage, perseverance and patience are the keys to her success.

Mrs. F.' new loan of Php 15,000 from Project Dungganon is her 13th. The loan will be utilized as additional capital for her business. She plans to invest in a transport vehicle so that she can deliver her products faster and with more efficiency.


About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. is married to Luke N. and they are blessed with two children, Joel and Monicah. Mary is 53 and runs a nursery school in Chaani, Kiembeni. She has been operating the school for a year and has 41 pupils so far. The location of her school is strategic and she hopes to improve in recruitment of new children with time.

This will mark Mary's first borrowing from KADET and with the money, she plans to buy desks, tables and office stationery for her pupils. 

She says that it is her passion to work with children and she hopes to one day own a modern schooling facility in the locality.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Buying desks, tables and office stationery

loans.name: Lualhati

texts.en:
Lualhati is 35 years old and married to Santiago.  The couple were blessed to have thee children: April, 9  years old, elementary student; Tristan and Jamie are still very young and not yet studying. The family lives in Barangay Calao East, Santiago City, Isabela.

Her husband is expert in repairing different kinds of appliances. With this they were able to put up a small repair shop in their village where she also helps her husband manage their business.  Aiming to improve their poor living condition, she wanted to borrow an additional business capital from KIVA lenders an amount of PHP 4,000.00 to develop their repair shop. She also hopes that with their shop, they can continue to support the education of their children.

loans.use: additional business capital

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco T. tiene ya más de once años con su negocio de abarrotes, el cual le está haciendo falta más mercancía, ya que se enfermo y no pudo atender el local. 
Don Francisco está solicitando un préstamo para poder surtir nuevamente su negocio y empezar con las ventas. 
Planea pagar el préstamo con las ganancias del negocio ya que los gastos familiares los cubre con la pensión que recibe con maestro.
Ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente.

loans.use: Comprar mercancía para el negocio

loans.name: Much

texts.en: Mrs. Much K. lives in Pour village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Meach Mous, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field is infertile soil which it is a bad to affect to his crops. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Much K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make the crops more productive. She is 58 years old and the mother of 58 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a tailor training while the others are farmers.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make the crops more productive.

loans.name: Saica

texts.en:
Saica M. is from the village of Santo Niño, Tukuran, which is in the province of Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 30 years old. Saica is married and has two school-aged children.

To make a living, Saica owns and operates a specialized retail business that sells fish. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Saica has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2008, Saica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Saica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Saica is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Saica from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices, covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokheng K., 29, and her husband, Mr. Phally Chlam, 47, live in a small village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for 1 year and just have a young daughter.

Sokheng has been a silk weaver for five years, a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband raises chickens at home.

Sokheng is requesting her first loan of US$200 to buy silk materials for her weaving business and to help provide capital for her husband to raise chickens.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and capital for her husband's business

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy C. is from the village of Comon Poblacion, Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 25 years old and single. To make a living, Joy owns and operates a business making and selling food. She sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Joy has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $107 a month from these activities.

In June 2009, Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Joy is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Chidiebere

texts.en: Chidiebere is a well known business man in Agbor, Delta state. He sells cooking oil at retail prices to his customers. He has been in this business for a long time. He hopes to be a major cooking oil distributor in the future. His greatest joy in his business is the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He sells for long hours to enable him support his family and meet their basic needs. He is 37 years old, married without children. He is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more supplies of cooking oil to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Vida works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She trades in children’s clothing such as dresses and panties. She sells door-to-door and also treks to nearby communities to sell. She buys her goods from Accra. Vida has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to increase her stock. It is her desire to give all her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy infants’ layettes (complete outfits of clothing and equipment for infants)

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Alejandrina es casada, tiene 59 años y 6 hijos, Alejandrina tiene una fabrica de Yeso llamada Yesera Cocharcas, que esta ubicado en local alquilado, sus ventas los realiza a las ferreterías al por mayor.
Alejandrina necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de piedra y leña.
Los sueños de Alejandrina son que su negocio se amplíe y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the village bank Ccori Ayllu, which means "golden family." Alejandrina is 59 years old. She is married and has six children. She rents a space out of which she runs Yesera Cocharcas, which makes plaster. She sells wholesale to hardware stores. Alejandrina needs a loan of 2500 soles, which she will use to buy stone and firewood. Her dreams are for her business to grow and her children to find good jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone and firewood

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Madame Maguette D. est une femme de 46 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 4 et 21 ans. Elle est soutien de famille car elle a aussi 2 personnes en charge .Son activité de départ était la vente de tissus et de parfums ceci depuis 1999.Mais actuellement elle est orientée exclusivement vers la vente de foin et d’aliment de bétail. Son choix d’activité s’est porte sur le commerce car elle n’a pas su réussir dans les études. Elle a aussi une expérience dans la couture car elle a même obtenu son diplôme en broderie. Mais néanmoins sa passion est portée sur le commerce qu’elle exerce. Ses moments d’entrées de fond sont les périodes qui l’intéressent le plus dans son activité. Et grâce a son dynamisme et son ambition elle est parvenue à se procurer un terrain grâce a son commerce. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs. L’objet de ce prêt sera d’acheter du mil de l’arachide et des poissons fumes afin de renforcer et de diversifier ses activités. Son grand rêve est de voyager sur Doubaï. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins personnels et d’ assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maguette D. is a 46-year-old woman, married and mother of six children, whose ages vary between 4 and 21 years. She is seen as family support, since she cares for two other persons. In 1999, she started in business by selling fabrics and perfume. Currently she has chosen a different orientation: selling exclusively hay and cattle feed. She chose to develop commercial activities as she was not successful in school. She has also some experience as a seamstress, and even obtained a diploma in embroidery. However, her passion remains centred on her current business. What interests her most is when earnings are realised. Thanks to the dynamism and ambition she demonstrates in her business, she was able to acquire a parcel of land. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs. The loan will be used to buy mil, peanuts, and smoked fish, to reinforce and diversify her activities. Her great dream is to travel to Dubaï. Her earnings currently satisfy her personal needs and ensure her children’s education.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen working capital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old, married, with 2 children who are 15 and 18 years old. Josephine and her family live in Kayonza, situated in the eastern province of Rwanda. Josephine has been in the business of selling cosmetic products including soaps, body lotion etc. Josephine has been doing this business as a wholesaler. This is her 13th successful year in this business which she starts early in the morning and continues until late in the evening.

After this long period of experience in her business, she is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing more cosmetic goods. If her business keeps its sustainability, she hopes to start wholesaling bags, new clothes for women, and some other products requested by her customers. Through this Kiva loan, Josephine has a hope for the future.

loans.use: Additional cosmetic products for sale

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata B. is 53 years old, is married with five children, and lives with her family in Tegbeh town, Freetown. The oldest three children are in secondary school and the last two children are in primary school.

Fatmata sells milk, sugar, butter and toothpaste in Tegbeh town market and has been a LAPO, SL client for over two years. She is a member of a credit union (loan group) in LAPO, SL and has taken four previous loans since she joined. With her previous loans and profits she bought the same type of goods for sale.

Fatmata wants to use her present loan of 1,500,000 leones to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more milk, sugar, butter and toothpaste to sell

loans.name: Pedro Ramon

texts.es:
Don Pedro Ramón S. O. es un productor que se dedica  a las actividades de trabajo agropecuarias sembrando granos básicos y a la compra y venta de ganado el cual vende a comerciantes que compran el ganado en la misma localidad para después venderlos a los mataderos.
Este crédito lo utilizara para comprar 4 novillos para engorde, don Pedro Ramón S. quiere comprar estos novillos con el objetivo de engordarlos por tres meses y después  venderlos una vez estos alcancen un mayor peso y tener una ganancia en el momento que realice la venta de estos. Este productor comenzó este tipo de trabajo sembrando granos y con la ganancia y el apoyo financiero que se le otorga por parte de Ceprodel comenzó comprando 2 novillos los cuales el vendía y de esa manera él ha venido invirtiendo la ganancia en la compra de mas reses para tener una mayor operatividad de trabajo y a la vez esto le genere más ingresos, antes de comprar ganado este productor solamente se dedicaba a la siembra de granos básicos como el cultivo de frijol y maíz esto para consumo y otra parte comercializarlo, con este financiamiento para la compra de novillos el espera que le genere más ingresos  ya que el solamente obtenía ingresos en épocas de invierno con las cosechas de los granos básicos ahora el tendrá  otra alternativa de trabajo en todo tiempo sobre todo en épocas de verano, esto le ayuda a resolver sus necesidades básicas en su hogar, el es casado tiene tres hijos dos de sus hijos estudian la primaria en una escuelita que hay en la comunidad del vi jagual de yali comunidad donde él vive. Este cliente tiene cuatro años de trabajar con Ceprodel en todo ese periodo se le han otorgado 5 créditos para este mismo rubro o actividad de trabajo. 
El impacto y beneficio de este apoyo financiero ha venido siendo notable y de mucha importancia para este cliente debido a que esto le ha permitido mejorar y obtener otros ingresos que son de mucha ayuda a su familia, esto de alguna manera da un aporte al desarrollo del núcleo familiar y mejora su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro Ramón S. O. works in agriculture and livestock, growing basic grains and buying cattle which will later be sold for slaughter. He will use this loan to buy four young bulls for fattening. Pedro Ramón S. wants to buy these bulls in order to fatten them for three months and then sell them once they have gained weight so that he will make a profit on the sale. He began this type of work by growing grains, and with the profits and financial support from Ceprodel he bought two bulls which he later sold. He has continued investing the profits in the purchase of more cattle in order to have more work and higher income. Before he started buying cattle, he only grew basic grains like beans and corn for personal use and for sale. With this loan for the purchase of young bulls, he hopes to create more income. In the past he had income only in the winter with the harvest. Now he will have another option for work at all times but overall in the summertime. This will help him to meet basic needs in his home. Pedro is married and has three children. Two of the children attend a small primary school in the community. This customer has been working with Ceprodel for four years. In that time he has taken out five loans for this same purpose. The impact and benefit of this financial support have been very important for this customer because they have allowed him to improve his income and create new sources of income, which is very helpful to his family. This helps in a way to support the development of the nuclear family and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of four young bulls

loans.name: Older Wilmer

texts.es:
El señor Older Wilmer P. B. se dedica principalmente a la ganadería tiene 15 años de estar trabajando con este rubro. Es su primer año de estar laborando Con CEPRODEL-El sauce, habita en la comarca san Nicolás municipio Achuapa, se dedica a la actividad de repasto de novillo.
 El crédito solicitado  es para la compro de 2 ternero de desarrollo, tiene su propia finca la inversión la realiza en su propiedad para así sacarle aprovecho y obtener un mayor ingreso y abastecer la necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Older primarily raises livestock and has been doing so for the past 15 years. This is his first year working with CEPRODEL-El Sauce. He lives in the San Nicolás region of the city of Achuapa. He raises steers. He will use the money from this loan to buy two plots of land to develop [for raising livestock]. He has his own herd and this investment will allow him to take better advantage of it and improve his income in order to better provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Land for raising livestock

loans.name: Julieta Cotingjo Group

texts.en:
Julieta C. is from the village of Colupan Alto,Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Julieta is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Julieta is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different food products in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Julieta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Razia Sultana's Group

texts.en:
Razia Sultana is married to M. J. A..  She lives in Pakistan, in the city of Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. 

Razia is 31 years old, and she owns a two-room brick house, where she has been living with her family for more than 5 years. She is a mother of three children: one son and two daughters. Her son is in school, but the other children are not old enough for school yet.

Razia is a very caring lady who stays at home and takes care of her family and manages the domestic chores. Her husband makes a living driving an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).  He also sells fresh flowers in morning, supplying the flowers to the flower shops to generate income. He has two businesses to improve the family's standard of living and to provide a better future for the children.

Razia is a regular client of the Asasah microfinance institute in Pakistan. She has successfully paid back three previous loans from Asasah and now   is applying for a loan to expand her husband’s flower-selling business.

loans.use: Purchase flowers for husband's business

loans.name: La Joya Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento "LA JOYA  " es un grupo  que se encuentra en su octavo ciclo, en todo este tiempo demostraron ser  personas responsables, puntuales  y trabajadoras, este grupo esta representada por las siguientes socias: 

Como Presidenta esta la Sra. Sandra  quien es la lider y fundadora del grupo, tiene el negocio D. venta D. salchipapas  en el mercado 10 D. febrero  por las noches ella es  casada  y tiene 4 hijos pequeños, su esposo es taxista juntos trabajan por el bienestar D. su familia, con el dinero del credito comprara insumos para poder realizar sus salchipapas y tambien la compra D. garrafa D. gas licuado. 

Como Secretaria esta la Sra. Nilda quien es madre soltera  y tiene 4 hijos pequeñas y su negocio es una tienda D. barrio en su propio domicilio esta señora a pesar D. ser su segundo ciclo a demostrado ser     una persona muy responsable y puntual con sus cuotas, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia al por mayor

La Tesorera  es la Sra.  Luisa quien es casada  y  tiene 5  hijos es separada y tiene su pequeño taller D. costura dentro se su domicilio pero ella  sale a vender ambulando por los mercados D. Cochabamba especialmente en las ferias zonales, es una persona  activa y amable con sus compañeras, con el dinero del credito comprara tela para la confeccion D. sus productos. 

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.

OJO: En la foto se encuentran los integrantes por separado, ya que una D. las socias no pudo venir a la reunion y tuvieron que sacarle despues una foto.
texts.en:
The La Joya Communal Bank is in its eighth cycle. In all of that time they have shown themselves to be responsible, punctual, and hard-working people. This group is represented by the following members: Sandra is the president. She is the leader and founder of the group. She has a business selling “salchipapas” (a traditional dish maD. from fried potatoes, fried sausages and condiments). She sells in the 10 D. Febrero market in the evenings. She is married and has four small children. Her husband is a taxi driver. They work together for the well being of their family. She will use the loan to buy supplies to be able to make salchipapas. She will also buy a cylinder of liquid gas. Nilda is the secretary. She is a single mother with four small children. Her business is a neighborhood store, which is in her house. Even though this is her second cycle, she has demonstrated that she is a very responsible person who is punctual with her payments. She will use the money from the loan to buy wholesale merchandise. Luisa is the treasurer. She is married and has five children. She is separated. She has a small seamstress shop in her house. But, she leaves to sell as a street vendor at the Cochabamba markets and especially in the fairs in the area. She is an active person who is kind to her colleagues. She will use the money from the loan to buy fabric to make her products. All of the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in granting the loan. Note: In the photo the members are separated because one of the members could not come to the meeting. They had to take her photo afterward.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Wevina's Group

texts.en:
Wevina C. is from the village of Antipolo. She is 58 years old and the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is C. Group.

Wevina is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Wevina has a business providing general  alteration and tailoring services. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,600 PHP a month.

In 2008, Wevina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wevina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Wevina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used for her college daughter's tuition fees and to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Wevina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for her daughter's college tuition and to buy fabrics and materials

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
N. Justine is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka area of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  Justine has a business running a small restaurant in Kyotera.  Justine has had her business for approximately three years.

To expand her business, Justine is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more food stocks to use in her restaurant, and also to invest in the restaurant’s upkeep.  Justine hopes to bring more clients to her restaurant, and generate greater profits for her family.  

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: Food stocks and upkeep for restaurant

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto tiene 60 años, reside en el Municipio de Concepción Batres, departamento de Usulután  es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa, el vende productos de primera necesidad, el negocio tiene por nombre “Tienda Hernández”.
Inicio el negocio gracias al apoya de una hermana quien fue le enseño y le dio las herramientas para mantener la tienda, atiende el negocio en un horario de 7:00 am- 6:00 pm. Actualmente necesita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería (aceite, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, café, leche en polvo) y satisfacer la demanda de los clientes. Este préstamo le permitirá ampliar la líneas de productos que incrementara las ventas y generar ingresos, la desventaja es que las ventas bajen.
Los sueños de Humberto son ampliar el negocio y satisfacer las necesidades básicas, mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Humberto is 60 years old and resides with his wife in the town of Concepción Batres, Department of Usulután. They have two children. Humberto sells basic necessities at his business named “Tienda Hernández”.

He started this business with the help of his sister who taught him and gave him the necessary equipment to maintain his store. Humberto operates his business from 7am until 6pm. He currently needs a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise (oil, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, and powdered milk) so that he can satisfy the demands of his customers. The loan will allow him to expand his product lines, increase his sales, and generate more income since his sales have dropped.

Humberto dreams of expanding his business, meeting his basic needs, and improving the quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oil, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, and powdered milk

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita F. is from the town of Surallah. She is 39 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She hopes to be successful in her business, just like other entrepreneurs. She also wants her children to finish college and does her best to achieve it.

Anita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Anita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: La señora Juana Francisca tiene 57 años. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de manualidades y ropa por lo que tiene más de 5 años de tener esta actividad, este no es el primer financiamiento que realiza pues ha tenido muy buena experiencia. El sueño de Juana es mantener seguir manteniendo este negocio ya que es el único medio de vida que tiene. Es una persona responsable y lleva al día sus cuotas. Es por eso que este financiamiento es para la compra de tijeras, telas, agujas, cobertores, hilos y algo de ropa.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Francisca is 57 years old. Her business involves producing and selling handicrafts and clothing, which she has been doing for more than five years. This is not the first loan she has obtained since she has plenty of experience.

Juana dreams of maintaining her business since it is the only livelihood that she has. She is a responsible person who makes sure that her payments are up to date. This loan will be used to buy scissors, fabric, needles, bedspreads, thread, and some clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase scissors, fabric, needles, bedspreads, thread, and clothing

loans.name: Sonia Pilar

texts.es: La Señora Sonia se dedica a la venta D. medicamentos en su farmacia, dicha actividad lo realiza hace doce años, cuenta con gran clientela  motivo por el cual esta Inaugurando una nueva farmacia cerca del hospital Viedma en Cochabamba, tiene dos niñas D. doce y diez años, el padre D. las niñas se encuentra en Brasil se fue para buscar trabajo y le fue muy bien, el  colabora económicamente a la familia. El destino del crédito es para la compra del letrero y muebles D. la nueva farmacia, la Sra. Esta muy contenta con este nuevo emprendimiento y muy agradecida a Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Sonia sells medications in her pharmacy, a business she has had for two years. She benefits from a large client base, which is why she is currently trying to open a new location, one closer to the Viedma hospital in Cochabamba. She has two daughters, 12 and 10 years old. They father of the children went to Brazil to find better work. He sends money to the family. This loan will be used to have a sign maD. and to purchase furnishing for the new pharmacy. She is very happy with the new business she is undertaking and she is very grateful to Emprender (Kiva Field Partner) and to Kiva for the trust they have imparted in her and for granting her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sign for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es: Leoncio, de 48 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Eva y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. En la comunidad de Miraflores (ubicada en el distrito de La Merced), se encuentra el negocio de Leoncio, del cual se encuentra instalado dentro de su domicilio, en donde vende gallinas, patos y gansos. Es así que procura tenerlos bien alimentados y cuidados, ya que depende de eso para poder venderlos más rápidamente. Se siente contenta con los ingresos que obtiene de éste negocio, y por tal motivo debe trabajar muy duro para poder intensificarse en esta actividad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es alimentar a sus aves, ya que los cría con mucho cariño, sin embrago requiere de mucho tiempo dedicarse a ellos. Para el futuro, planea alquilar una tienda donde pueda brindar a sus clientes una mejor comodidad a la hora de atenderlos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y está dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y responsable. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más alimento para sus aves, ya que tienen que estar grandes y sanos.
texts.en:
Leoncio is 48 years old and is a very simple, hard-working man. He lives in his own home with his wife Eva and he tries to work as hard as he can to improve their quality of life. In the Miraflores community (in the district of La Merced) Leoncio runs his business out of his home; he sells chickens, ducks and geese. He does his best to keep them well-fed and well taken care of so he can sell them more quickly. He feels content with the money her earns through his business and would like to work harder to do even better in this line of work. His favorite part of his job is feeding the birds as he feeds them a great amount of love; nonetheless, it takes a lot of time to take care of them. In the future, he plans to rent a storefront where he can offer better attend to his customers. This is his 3rd loan through MFP; he knows that he must make his payments punctually and he is willing to do so. In his village bank, he is a very happy and responsible member. With the 1500 soles (~$550 USD) that he is seeking, he will buy more food for his birds so they will grow larger and more healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food for his poultry

loans.name: Zakia's Group

texts.en:
Zakia (pictured with her hand raised) lives in a small city called Kasur, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan. She is 41 years old and lives in a 2-room brick house with her husband and children. She is the mother of 4 sons and a daughter. Her 2 eldest sons are loaders by trade, and help their father in his loading business, which provides transport facilities to its clients for delivering items to their designated places. Her third son has a leather selling business in the local market, and her remaining children are getting their education from a local school in Kasur. 

Zakia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s loading business.
