He will use the money to buy new tires to replace the old ones on his truck, which are almost worn out, making it difficult for him to drive the truck and deliver goods. Zakia is hopeful that after buying the new tires her husband will be able to work better and provide better transport facilities to his clients. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years she has maintained good credit and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: to replace the tires on her husband's truck

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La  Sra. María de 33 años de edad, soltera y desde muy joven  se dedicó  a la artesanía de ao po’ i realiza.
Ella confecciona,  manteles, sabanas, individuales, servilletitas y otros, todos realizados en forma artesanal con bordados y encajes.
Actualmente ella quiere confeccionar ropas para la temporada y necesita comprar gran cantidad de metería prima por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas.
 Ella quiere aprovechar las ventas que normalmente se tiene en el verano ya que las confecciones de este tipo de telas son bastantes frescas y comodas para la época de calor.
texts.en:
María, 33, is single and has been an “ao po’i” artisan since she was very young.  (“Ao”  means cloth or clothing in Guaraní and po´i  means fine or thin. Ao po´i developed as a result of the isolationist policies of Paraguay´s first post-colonial leader, and dictator, Dr. Gaspar Rodríguez de Francia. Without access to imported cloth Paraguayan women had to make their own fabric starting with raw cotton which was spun into thread, woven into cloth and later decorated with embroidery. Nowadays much ao po’i cloth is made by machine but still hand sewn and embroidered. There remain a few artisans who do the entire process by hand.)

She makes tablecloths, sheets, place mats, napkins and others, all artisanal with embroidery and lace.

She now wants to make seasonal clothing and needs to buy a large quantity of raw materials.  She is asking for a loan to buy fabric.

She wants to take advantage of sales that are common in summer because this type of clothing is quite cool and comfortable for hot weather.

loans.use: To buy "ao po´i" (typical Paraguayan embroidery) fabric.

loans.name: Marlon Jose

texts.es: El señor Marlon Jose V. R., tiene la edad de 47 años, es casado y su esposa labora como secretaria de una empresa privada, tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad que se dedican a estudiar y apoyar a sus padres en las actividades del hogar,  el señor Marlon es agricultor contando con más de 20 años de experiencia, tiempo en el cual se han enfrentado a diversos problemas de plagas que has disminuido las cosechas, es para sus cultivos que solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y fungicidas que favorezcan a una mejor producción, esta inversión le permitirá a corto plazo mejores condiciones que brinden recursos para solventar los gastos del colegio de sus hijos, mejorar la infraestructura del hogar, esto son unos de las  principales prioridades de la familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Marlon Jose V. R. is 47 years old and married. His wife works as a secretary for a private company. They have three grown children who are students and help them with the household activities. Sr. Marlon is a farmer with more than 20 years of experience. At the moment, he is confronting various pest problems that have diminished his harvest.

Therefore, he is requesting a loan for his crops. He will buy fertilizers and fungicides that will help improve his production. This investment will allow him to experience better conditions in the short-term, provide income to cover his children’s educational expenses, and improve the infrastructure of his home. These are some of his family’s main priorities.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and fungicides

loans.name: Reson Ene

texts.en:
Reson has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last year.  She is 25 years old and is married to S. Ole Kaoyian. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy goats and sheep to resell at a profit.

In the future, Reson hopes to build rental houses to supplement her income.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es: Magaly, de 33 años, convive con Roberto de 40 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Roberto de 14, Medaly de 12 y Milagros de 8 años. En unión familiar, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en L. localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Está mujer trabajadora, se dedica a muchas actividades, pues es muy activa, hace 15 años que viene dedicándose a L. agricultura, sus principales cultivos constan de café, plátano y palta. Los que después de cada cosecha los comercializa a su vecina Nadia, que es una comerciante mayorista de frutas, que distribuye a diferentes lugares del país. Ya en las tardes se dedica a L. venta de comida, ya que conocedores de su buena sazón; los profesores de L. localidad L. contrataron para su alimentación diaria. En sus diferentes negocios elL. se siente desarrollada, y para el futuro tiene muchos planes, uno de ellos es acondicionar su casa para alquilar cuartos, y ya comenzó con el alquiler de una habitación. De L. misma manera desea poner una pequeña panadería en su localidad, comprando un horno artesanal, como primer paso. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y, en todo el tiempo que está trabajando en su banco comunal se siente satisfecha por el apoyo mutuo que se brindan unas a otras; logrando así su desarrollo. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar 500 mamones (plantas de plátano) para renovar sus plantaciones sus platanales y, si el dinero le alcanza podrá adquirir 3 sacos de abono que osciL. entre 120 nuevos soles cada uno.
texts.en:
Magaly is 33 years old and lives with her partner, Roberto, who is 40 years old. They have three children: Roberto (14), Medaly (12) and Milagros (8). They live in their own house located in Puente Paucartambo (central Peruvian jungle).

She is a hardworking woman and works in many activities, as she is very active. She has been working in agriculture for the past 15 years and her main crops consist of coffee, bananas and avocado. After each harvest, she sells them to her neighbor, Nadia, who is a wholesale fruit merchant and distributes them to different places in the country. In the afternoons, Magaly works selling food and since they are familiar with her good seasoning, the professors in her area hired her to make their daily food. She feels developed in her different businesses and has many plans for the future, one of which is to set up her house to rent rooms. She already started with the rental of one bedroom. Similarly, she wants to set up a small bakery in her area, purchasing an artisanal oven as a first step.

This is her fifth loan with MFP and throughout all of the time that she has been working with her communal bank, she feels satisfied with the mutual support that they provide to one another, thus achieving their development. With the loan acquired, she plans to purchase 500 ‘mamones’ (banana plants) to revitalize her banana plantations and, if there is enough money, she will also be able to get three sacks of manure that tend to be around 120 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) each.

loans.use: To purchase 500 banana plants and 3 sacks of manure

loans.name: Stephen Nyoro

texts.en:
Stephen has practiced dairy farming in Njabini town for the last 20 years.  He is 47 years old, married to Jane Njeri, and they have eight children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He repaid his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In future, Stephen hopes to buy a lorry which he will be using to transport his milk to the market.  He will also be charging other farmers to transport for them.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo S. is 31 years old and sells vegetables in Kampong Chhnang province. Her business has been around for about ten years and she makes US$ 7 every day. Her husband works collecting palm juice to refine to palm sugar. On average, he makes US$ 3 of profit each day. Selling vegetables has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. She is asking for a loan of US$ 400 to invest in her vegetable business.

loans.use: To invest in her vegetable business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses D. is 46 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. Moses has a grocery business, which he has run for less than a year.
To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Moses hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more items for resale

loans.name: Bolot

texts.en:
Bolot A. is a 48-year-old farmer who lives in Sarybulak village, in north Kyrgyzstan. He is married and has four children. Bolot has been engaged in animal breeding for 20 years. As a very purposeful and positive person, Bolot has worked hard to support his family and achieved success – today his farm amounts to three milch cows, one heifer and seven sheep. Using his starting capital of only 3,000 KGS, he managed to earn about 10,000 KGS in a month through selling milk to the local dairy plant. 

Now Bolot plans to use this loan of  75,000 KGS to buy one milch cow and help his wife in broadening her grocery business by purchasing more goods to resell. In the future, Bolot plans to build a huge barn for his cattle.

Bai Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target especially vulnerable people. Bai Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase a milch cow

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia vive en alquiler con su hija, en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; el costo del alquiler de la casa donde vive es alto y el trasladarse de casa en casa por cambiar de sitio de alquiler ocasiona que deteriore sus pertenencias, es por ello que necesita una vivienda en anticretico pues en ella encontrara mayor estabilidad y su gasto se reducirá considerablemente, además que podrá ahorrar.
Amalia es contadora, con el crédito ella podrá obtener un anticretico ( anticrético es una forma legal de vivir en un departamento, habitación o casa, medante un acuerdo con el dueño de casa, por un tiempo dfinido al término del cual, el dueño de casa devuelve el dinero al inquilino), y así mejorar las condiciones de vida.  
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO.
texts.en:
Amalia lives with her daughter in a rental property in the Pasankeri area in the city of La Paz.  The rent she pays is very high and having to move from rental place to rental place takes a toll on her belongings.  She needs to acquire usufruct rights so she can live somewhere with more stability and which will allow her to reduce her expenses considerably so she can save.

Amalia is an accountant.  She plans to use the loan to obtain usufruct rights (usufruct is a legal form of living in an apartment, room or house through an agreement with the landlord for a defined period of time at the end of which the landlord will return the money to the usufructor), in order to improve living conditions.

This is her first loan through IMPRO.

loans.use: To cover usufruct costs so she can move into a more comfortable home

loans.name: Ayawovi

texts.fr: Madame Ayawovi  est mère de 3 enfants et a 50 ans. Elle est née à  Aného et habite quartier Kégué.  Elle est revendeuse de charbons de bois  et céréales à la devanture de sa  maison.  Elle a  commencé en   2000 son activité  et  s’approvisionne à  Anié.  Elle sollicite un  prêt  pour  acheter  50 sacs de  charbons  de  bois.
texts.en: Mrs. Ayawovi is a mother of three children. She is 50 years old. She was born in Aného and lives in the Kégué district. She sells charcoal and cereals in front of her house. She launched this business in 2000 and stocks up in Anié. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase 50 bags of charcoal.

loans.use: Purchasing charcoal

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es: Maria Ofelia B.: ella trabaja todos los dias vendiendo ropa tipica es comerciante ambulante, tambien se dedica a la crianza de pollos solicita este crediro para la compra de blusas y cortes tipicos y consentrado para sus pollos tambien para la compra de hilo para sus bordados, su sueño es agrandar mas su negocio y mejorar sus ganancias para ayudar al sustento de su familia.
texts.en: Maria Ofelia B. works every day selling clothing as a street vendor.  She also dedicates herself to raising chickens.  The loan is for the purchase of blouses and other typical clothing, as well as for the care of her chickens.  She would like to also buy thread for her embroideries.  Her dreams are to expand her business and augment her earnings so she can help support her family.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, embroidery thread, and feed for chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 24-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents. He has been working in a clothing store since the beginning of 2010. He works hard to earn a good income. At the same time, he is pursuing his education. 

This young man knows how to manage his time between his job and his education. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his university education fees. In the future, he is planning to start his career in a proper company to gain experience and be able to help his parents with his income.

loans.use: to pay his university education fees.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos (de edades 26,18,15,10). Pertenece al Banco Comunal Triunfo II. 
Solicita un crédito de S/. 2 000.00.
Se dedica a la venta de ropas y golosinas. 
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías como : ropas y golosinas.
Juliana viaja a la feria de Iquicha los días miércoles, los jueves a la feria de Uchuraccay, a la feria de Jano los viernes y domingo a la feria de Tambo, donde vende ropa  para damas, caballeros y niños, también lo surte con la venta de golosinas. Los días que no viaja vende golosinas en el parque María Parado de Bellido.  
Ingreso al banquito por la invitación de una socia. Le gusta porque puede ahorrar.
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y que su negocio siga prosperando.
texts.en:
Juliana is 49 years old, is married and has 5 children (ages 26, 18, 15, 10).  She is a member of the “Triumfo II” communal bank.  She sells snacks and is asking for a loan of 2,000 PEN (~$725) to invest in merchandise, such as snacks and clothing.

Juliana goes to the Iquicha fair on Wednesdays, to the Uchuraccay fair on Thursdays, to the Jano fair on Fridays, and to the Tambo fair on Sundays, where she sells women’s, men’s, and children’s clothing and snacks.  She sells snacks in the María Parado de Bellido park on the days where she doesn’t travel.

She joined the communal bank after being invited.  She likes it because it gives her a chance to save some money.  She wants her children to develop professional careers and to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Esperanza Idalia

texts.es: Esperanza Idalia P. D. S. D. 43 años D. edad habita en casa propia con sus tres hijas que se encuentran estudiando y su esposo que es agricultor. Doña Esperanza es una mujer emprendedora que ha hecho D.  su casa un negocio. Ella posee un pequeño comedor en su casa D. habitación, ubicado en el Municipio D. Ciudad Arce del Departamento D. La Libertad. Es muy conocida en la zona  y goza D. muy buenas referencias gracias a los deliciosos platillos que prepara.  Los cliente solicitan mucho su comida y muchas veces ella desea poder contar con los recursos necesarios para poder ofrecer más variedad D. platillos a sus clientes. Esto la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en los insumos necesarios como: Verduras, frutas, carnes, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, etc. Con la esperanza D. poder aumentar sus ventas y logras mejores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Esperanza Idalia P. D. S., age 43, resides in her own home with her three school-age daughters and her husband who is a farmer. Doña Esperanza is an enterprising woman who has established a home business. She manages a small diner at her house located in the town of Ciudad Arce in the Department of La Libertad. Esperanza is well-known in the area and enjoys excellent references because of the delicious food that she prepares. Her customers request her food and there have been many times when she wanted to have the necessary resources to offer them a wider variety of dishes.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral to invest in the following supplies: vegetables, fruits, meats, rice, beans, sugar, corn, and other items. Esperanza hopes to increase her sales and earn better income so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruits, meats, rice, beans, sugar, corn, and other items.

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Bwera Group

texts.en: Forty-one-year-old W. Sarah has been operating her fresh fruit- and vegetable-selling business for the last 10 years. The mother of six operates from Jinja Central Market. Before she got involved in this business, she was working in a maize-milling factory. She says this business generates her 120,000 shillings as profit weekly. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more fresh fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Nanok

texts.en:
Nanok has been practising poultry farming in Nakuru town for the last six years.  He is 41 years old, married to Anwara and they have one child.  

Nanok was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy chicks, which he will raise and sell at the local market after maturity.

In the future, Nanok hopes to get major contacts around Nakuru town to supply chickens as he grows his business.

loans.use: To buy more chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Nadiegueton 3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe NADIEGUETON 3 est constitué de cinq hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4  enfants et vivant  dans des  familles polygames à Flazambougou un des villages de la commune de Sikasso et situé à environ 12 km de Sikasso ville, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien  remboursé.
La spéculation  principale cultivée est le maïs.  
BREHIMA,  compte acheter, avec son prêt, des 200 kg d’engrais, 4 bidons d’herbicides ,  les petits matériels et payer les frais de désherbage d’ entretiens . 
La production est vendue après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au niveau du village, au marché  de Sikasso . 
BREHIMA  compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90 000FCFA par campagne. Son bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et  de réaliser les évènements sociaux de la famille.
Il souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et son partenaire KIVA afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The Nadiegueton 3 group is composed of five married men who are on average 43 years old with four children. They live in polygamous families in Flazambougou, one of the villages in Sikasso township, located about 8 miles from the city of Sikasso, Mali's third administrative region.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to complete their agricultural activities during wintering. They are on their third loan with the organization, previous loans having been repaid correctly.
The main cultivar in which they deal is corn.
With his loan, Brehima plans on purchasing 200 kilos of fertilizer, 4 cans of herbicide, and small equipment; it will also pay for routine weeding expenses.
Production is sold after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women, at the village level, at the Sikasso market.
Brehima plans on making an average benefit of 90,000 CFA per cultivation cycle. His benefits will allow him to pay back his loan and to carry out the family's social events.
He wishes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso and its partner Kiva in order to operate an even larger cultivation space, the better to increase his profits.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural supplies and labor costs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills and clothing.

For the past four years, she has operated a cosmetics shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also operates M-pesa (mobile money transfer), which contributes another source of income. She faces a major challenge of competition from other cosmetic shop operators. 

With the KSHS 50,000, she wants to purchase beauty products, a hair dryer and repair her computer. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and a hair dryer and repair her computer.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea, a 28-year-old cosmetics seller, is the divorced mother of two children, 11 and 8 years old. Her monthly expenses include $30 for food, $5 for electricity, $10 for  house rent, $10 for school fees, $10 for transportation, and $15 for other expenses. 

Sophea is requesting a loan of $500 to buy cosmetic products to sell. Her career is going well, and she expects to extend her career by selling more cosmetic products to earn more income to support her two children when they go to university.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: La señora Erika  tiene dos movilidades que trabajan en el transporte publico de pasajeros. Así obtiene los ingresos mensuales necesarios para mantener a sus dos hijas y ella misma. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción ya que hará la refacción de una habitación en su casa .Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona San Antonio de la ciudad de La Paz; Erika es madre soltera y tiene dos hijas. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO y de Kiva.
texts.en: Erika has two vehicles that provide a public passenger transport service.  This makes her the monthly income that she needs to support her two daughters and herself.  She needs this loan to buy building supplies as she will refurbish a room in her home.  She lives in her own home which is located in San Antonio district, in the city of La Paz.  Erika is a single mother and has two daughters.  This is the first time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to refurbish a room in her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a pick-up truck for the business.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana de 29 años vive al suroccidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 7 y 8 años, allí se dedica al comercio de productos de salud, negocio que inició desde el año 2010, con un préstamo del promotor de estos productos, sus ventas las realiza a crédito en dos pagos quincenales, sus clientes iniciales fueros sus amigos y familiares, pero gradualmente se ha ido extendiendo por el número de referidos que estos le hacen. Su meta más adelante es tener un almacén especializado en estos productos, que funcione en su propia vivienda, pero tiene un gran desafío y es el insuficiente capital de trabajo para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para iniciar su crecimiento, con este credito comprará productos para la salud, en sus líneas bioterapia, cabello, cuerpo, pies, natural y aromaterapia, productos de gran aceptación entre su clientela pues han tenido la experiencia de sus beneficios. Mientras Diana trabaja y se esfuerza, para lograr su sueño de crecimiento, mantiene una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 20,59% y una rotación de inventarios de 9 días.
texts.en: Diana is 29 years old and she lives in the city's southwest with her common-law husband and their two children, aged 7 and 8. She sells health products, a business she started out in 2010 with the help of a loan granted to her by a promoter of these products. She completes her sales on credit, with two bi-weekly payments. Her first clients were her friends and family but gradually her clients have increased for the referrals that have been made. Her goal in the future is to have a specialized store featuring these products, operating from her own home. But she faces a great challenge and that is insufficient capital funds to achieve her goal. This is the reason why she requests a Kiva loan. It is the first loan she accesses through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and it will help her stimulate growth. With this loan she will purchase health products, including biotherapies, and natural and aromatherapy treatments for hair, body, and feet. These products are very well accepted by her clientele, especially having observed benefits from their experience. As Diana works and expends her efforts she strives to achieve her dream of expanding her business. She maintains a profit margin of no less than 20.59% and an inventory rotation of 9 days.

loans.use: to purchase health products, including biotherapies, and natural and aromatherapy treatments for hair, body, and feet.

loans.name: Jean D’Amour

texts.en:
Jean d’Amour is a father of three children, the eldest of which is ten years old. Jean d’Amour is a rice farmer, a job which he has been doing for the past 11 years. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: preparing seedlings in the nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding against birds, and, lately, in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor for his rice farm

loans.name: Deyra María

texts.es:
La joven Deyra María es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre de una niña, se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en un colegio de la localidad con muchos años de experiencia.
Cuenta con su propia vivienda la que ha ido mejorando gracias a todos los créditos que le ha otorgado Ceprodel sobre todo el techo que estaba en mal estado.
Una de las necesidades que tiene esta joven en estos momentos es adquirir un crédito para comprar medicamentos y pago de consultas médicas para curar a su pequeña hija la cual está enferma es por este motivo que solicitó su cuarto crédito para llevar a cabo su necesidad.
texts.en:
Deyra María is from the town of El Sauce. She is the mother of a little girl and works as an elementary school teacher in a local school. She has many years experience. 

She has her own house, which she has improved thanks to loans from Ceprodel. The roof, especially, was in bad condition.

One of the things this young woman needs at this time is to adquire a loan to buy medications and to pay for doctor visits for her little daughter, who is sick. That is the reason she has asked for her fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy medicine and pay for doctor visits for her little girl.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 48 years old and lives in Gumbil, Tudela, Misamis Occdiental. She is married with 2 children. 

Elsie has a shop that sells canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles etc. She has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase goods such as canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles etc. for her shop.
 
Elsie has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Elsie hopes to see her children finish college.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles etc. for her shop

loans.name: Martir

texts.es:
Martir, es una persona responsable, opto por un nuevo prestamo ya que esta iniciando nuevamente el cultivo de maiz.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar herbicidas, abono y semilla para sembrar con el objetivo de que sus cosechas sean mejores este año y pueda venderlo y dejar una parte para el consumo de su familia.
El sueño de Mártir es seguir trabajando todos los años con la institución, y mejorar en sus ingresos ya que los prestamos le han permitido mejorar los cultivos.
texts.en: Mártir is a responsible person who opted for a new loan because he’s once again starting to plant corn.  He will use the loan to buy herbicides, manure and seeds to plant with the goal in mind of having better harvests this year to sell and have part left over for his family’s consumption.  Mártir’s dream is to continue working with the Institution every year and to improve his income since the loans have made improved crops possible.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Francisco Gabriel

texts.es: Francisco Gabriel  es un padre de dos hijos pequeños de 12 y 9 años. Vive junto a su esposa e hijos él se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, desde hace más de 9 años. Inicio este negocio junto a su esposa que lo apoyo para que empezara con pocos productos, actualmente cuenta con una gran variedad de clientes que le solicitan variedad. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes entre otros.  El tiene planes de incrementar su mercadería y aumentar su inventario, como todo buen padre su más grande anhelo es poder ver a sus hijos profesionales y sobre todo dar una mejor calidad de vida a toda su familia.
texts.en: Francisco Gabriel is the father of 2 small children aged 12 and 9 years. He lives with his wife and children. He has been selling new clothes for more than 9 years. He started the business with his wife who supported him so that he could start off selling with a few products. He currently has a wide variety of customers that askk for variety. The reason for the loan is to purchase trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses and more. He has plans to increase his merchandise and his inventory. Like any good father, his greatest dream is to see his children become professionals and above all else be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses and more.

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Барно замужем и любящая мать 4 детей. Она умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Более 16 она занимается откормом скота и выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. В основном Барно выращивает пшеницу, лук и кукурузу. Барно хочет расширить свой бизнес с целью получения желаемой прибыли. Барно хотела бы получить займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота и семена лука.
texts.en: Barno is married and is a loving mother of four children.  She is a smart and hardworking woman.  She has been involved in fattening up livestock and growing agricultural crops for over 16 years.  Barno primarily grows wheat, onions and corn.  She wants to expand her business in order to make a desired profit.  Barno wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of cattle and onion seeds.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and onion seeds

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 1 child.

Marife has a retail shop that sells clothing, footwear, and umbrellas. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more clothing, footwear, and umbrellas.

Marife is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy inventory including clothing, footwear, and umbrellas

loans.name: Khursheeda's Group

texts.en:
Khursheeda is 33 years old. She is an embroidery and sewing expert and works for her community clients. Due to her good quality work, she receives regular orders every month. Her husband sells fertilizers. His customers include farmers who purchase fertilizers from him to use on their crops.

Khursheeda is the mother of two sons and two daughters. None of them is able to attend school due to the poor financial conditions of Khursheeda and her husband.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her brother who also runs a fertilizer retail business and who is currently facing low stock problems. With the help of a loan he will purchase different brands and variety of fertilizers for his shop to generate more sales and profits. He has been operating this business for many years and Khursheeda is hopeful that a loan will help her brother increase his business profits.

Note: "In the picture, the lady holding a book called Asasah passbook is Khursheeda."

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her business

loans.name: Didjao

texts.fr:
Didjao est une femme  âgé(e) de 34 ans. Elle est mariée  å un  commerçant. Elle a 02 enfants, dont 01 scolarisé. Le premier a 06ans  ans et le dernier a 1an6mois. 
Didjao travaille comme revendeuse d’ignames depuis 2008. Elle vend de façon ambulante. 
Didjao a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des ignames. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Didjao voudrait rendre l’activité durable. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit s’occuper de l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Didjao is a 34-year-old woman. She is a married merchant. She has two children, one of whom attends school. The first is 6 and the second one is a year and 6 months. Didjao has been selling yams since 2008. She sells from place to place. Didjao has asked for her first loan from WAGES to buy yams. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Didjao would like to continue her business. She says that with the profits, she foresees paying for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy yams

loans.name: Diamaguene Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Diamaguene  a été crée le 17-04-2010. Il est composé de 12 femmes issues de la même localité. Elles exercent la même activité qui est le commerce de détails.		

Madame Fatou Mac (debout à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants. Elle a aussi en charge 6 enfants de sa coépouse . 

Elle développe un petit commerce d'arachides, de mil et d'huile. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années. 
		
Avec son prêt reçu, elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en arachide, du mil et de l'huile pour revendre.	
	
Ses recettes lui permettront d'aider son mari dans prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The Diamaguene solidarity group was set up on the 17 April 2010. It is made up of 12 women who are all from the same area. They are all active in the retail business.	

Fatou Mac (standing on the right of the photo) is the group leader. She is 41 years old and married, with 9 children. She also supports the six children of her co-spouse. 

She has a small business selling groundnuts, millet and oil. She has much experience in this activity as she has been in the business for many years.
		
With her loan, she will increase her supplies of groundnuts, millet and oil for reselling.
	
Her income will allow her to help her husband support the family.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts, oil and millet.

loans.name: Mougne Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 09 juillet 2002. Il  est  composé de douze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Mankagno qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle a aussi en sa charge cinq autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de bananes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…).
texts.en:
This microcredit group was formed on the 9th July 2002. It is made up of twelve women who live in the same quarter. They sell various goods for a living. 

Madame Mankagno is on the right of the picture with her hand raised, and is the group leader. She is 54 years old and married with one child. She also had another five children entrusted to her care by her parents. 

She sells bananas for a living, and has been successful in this line of work as a result of several years' worth of experience. 

This loan will enable her to boost her working capital and better develop her business. Her profits would enable her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothes etc).

loans.use: to purchase bananas

loans.name: Hosiyatmo

texts.ru: На сегодняшний день Хосиятмо продолжает свою деятельность. Она хочет расширить свою деятельность. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Today, Hosiyatmo continues her business.  She also wants to expand her business.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of bulls.

loans.use: to purchase bulls

loans.name: Sarlyn

texts.en:
Sarlyn is married and has three children. She is 35 years old and lives in La Esperanza, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 
Sarlyn own and operate a business venture planting and harvesting flowers for sale to earn a living. She has been running this business for three years. Each month, she earns 2,500 PHP from the business. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 
In 2011, Sarlyn joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

location.town: La Esperanza, Rizal, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: La Rosa De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: La Nueva Alcancía Comunal “La Rosa de Guadalupe” es un grupo conformado por 07 integrantes entusiastas de comenzar a trabajar con el Programa – Prosperidad. Constanza tiene 70 años de edad es casada con 05 hijos independientes, en el transcurso de su vida Constanza se ha dedicado a distintas actividades como al lavado de ropa, limpieza entre otros, con el buen uso que dio a sus ingresos pudo invertir y de ese modo cumplir una de sus metas el de contar con un negocio propio la cual instalo una bodega en su domicilio, Constanza se siente orgullosa pues con su esfuerzo a logrado que sus hijos sean profesionales, actualmente sus ingresos lo utiliza para capital de trabajo, y también apoya a sus nietos en su educación.  El deseo de Constanza es de seguir trabajando positivamente y así seguir ayudando a sus nietos. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos, y leche. La Alcancía Comunal “La Rosa de Guadalupe” están agradecidos con el crédito brindado ya que hacen posible su progreso.
texts.en: The communal bank "La Rosa de Guadalupe" is comprised of seven members who are anxious to begin working with the Prosperity Program.  Constanza is 70 years old, married and has five independent children.  Throughout her life Constanza has had different jobs such as washing clothes or cleaning, among others.  Using her income well she was able to invest and meet one of her goals which was to set up her own store at home.  Constanza is proud that through her hard work she has been able to help her children become professionals.  Currently she uses her income as working capital and also supports her grandchildren in their education.  Her goal is to continue working in a positive way so she can help her grandchildren.  She is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, noodles and milk.  The communal bank "La Rosa de Guadalupe" is grateful for the loan which allows them to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy sugar, noodles and milk.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es:
Norberto tiene hace aproximadamente unos 8 años un taller de reparación de bicicletas y motocicletas con el cual genera los ingresos para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. La actividad la aprendió gracias a su hermano mayor y desde entonces ha venido trabajando fuertemente para crecer con su taller y aumentar sus clientes. Norberto busca un préstamo para comprar repuestos como son llantas, tuercas, neumáticos, pinturas, entre otros y así poder responder a la demanda de sus clientes.

De esta manera su negocio podrá salir adelante y sus ingresos aumentarán considerablemente, ya que en la actualidad sus clientes le hacen numerosos pedidos que no puede cubrir por la falta de repuestos. Su sueño es tener un taller grande donde pueda generar empleo y tener su propio almacén de venta de repuestos.

loans.use: Comprar repuestos como son llantas, tuercas, neumáticos, pinturas, entre otros y así poder responder a la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es:
María del Pilar es una mujer de 47 años trabajadora y madre de dos hijas de 25 años. Estudió contabilidad, esta soltera y actualmente vive en Pachuca, Hidalgo en donde tiene una tienda de abarrotes.
María inició su negocio hace 7 años y prosperaba muy bien. Hace poco tiempo, tuvo que cubrir gastos médicos de una de sus hijas ya que necesitaba una cirugía y esto le provocó bajas en las ventas de su tienda, pero pronto se recuperó y su tienda volvió a prosperar. 
Con las ganas de seguir creciendo su negocio, María solicitó un crédito para ayudarse a comprar mercancía, frutas y verduras y así hacer que las ventas sigan incrementándose. Hoy su negocio es próspero y sueña con tener otra tienda pero más grande y así hacer fluir más su dinero.
Su motivación más grande son sus hijas, quienes ya no dependen económicamente de ella pero les ayuda en lo que necesiten, así como sus ganas de tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia teniendo una situación económica más estable.

loans.use: comprar mercancía, frutas y verduras

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a lady who inspires other ladies in her group because of her work. She is the secretary of Mercury Women Group a post she got without contesting with any one. She is a mother of six; five are independent while the last-born is in college. She encourages fellow group members to educate their children because it is the only everlasting gift a parent can give to a child. She is a farmer and grows bananas, maize, beans and tea on a small scale. She also sells milk from her dairy cows and this is her major source of income. She earns about $ 128 per month from all her businesses. She believes she can increase her income if she applies improved methods of farming.

loans.use: She would like to buy improved seeds to increase production of vegetables

loans.name: Aslan

texts.en: Aslan is an IDP from Khojavend region. He has been a client of Normicro since 2003. First he borrowed $400 and started his business selling mobile phones and accessories. Thus he established a business where he earns his living. Now his business is developing and he needs funding to expand his business.

loans.use: To increase the variety of mobile phones

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en: Imeleta is a mother of two and lives with her children and husband in the small Samoan village of Saleaumua. She said that her family had always relied on the intermittent generosity of overseas relatives sending remittances back to Samoa.  Without a reliable, independent income stream, Imelta joined the SPBD program in 2005 in order to gain access to capital to start a small taro plantation.  Imelata invests most of her time and money back into her farming venture, so that she can support her family independently and build a better life for her two small children in Samoa.

loans.use: Buy equipment: fencing, knives, gloves

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
Maria de Lourdes lives with her partner and has six children, the elder four of whom help her in her grocery store. Her partner works as a metalworker, but his salary was not enough to cover all of the household expenses and so she decided to do something to help him. She decided to sell sweets and "chicharrones," from a stand in front of her home. Little by little, her sales grew and she needed to store her products on shelves she made for herself and then she bought metal shelves, which help to liven up her home, which has only a dirt floor. She has been selling grocery items for 8 years now.

Maria de Lourdes is applying for a loan for $750.00 so that she can buy more merchandise and to stock her store, helping to see it grow. She will repay the loan in 6 months. She and her family thank you very much for your support which will help them to improve their lives and to give their children better opportunities in life.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

María de Lourdes vive en unión libre con su pareja y tienen seis hijos, de los cuales los cuatro hijos mayores la ayudan en el negocio de abarrotes que tiene, su pareja trabaja como albañil y con su salario no podía cubrir los gastos para sus seis hijos, por ello ella decidió hacer algo para apoyar con la carga de los gastos a su pareja, y entonces ella decidió vender dulces y chicharrones en una pequeña mesa en la puerta de su casa y poco a poco fue incrementando sus productos en anaqueles fabricados por ella misma y luego compro unos de metal los cuales ambientó en su casa que tiene el piso de tierra, ya tiene ocho años con su negocio.

María de Lourdes está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 750 dólares para comprar más mercadería y así tener surtido su negocio y poder crecer con el mismo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que les brindas para poder salir adelante y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael is married and his wife is a stay at home mom. They have 6 children between 31 and 20 years of age. It was very difficult to find a job when Rafael got married, so he started his own business to be able to offer to his family a patrimony and to provide everything they need. Previously, he used to work at an upholstery workshop in another city where he learned his craft, which helped him start his business in the city of Linares 30 years ago. First, he used to work at the yard of his house and soon after he built a room for his own upholstery workshop. Three of his children work with Rafael in the family business and together have made it grow. Now, he is requesting for a loan of $925 that he will use to buy raw materials that he need in the production of his work, like fabrics, threads, staples, etc. He promises to repay the loan over a period of 6 months. Be part of this business and contribute to its growth, Rafael and his family are very grateful for your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Rafael está casado y su esposa se dedica al hogar, tiene 6 hijos entre 31 y 20 años de edad. Cuando Rafael se casó le fue muy difícil conseguir un empleo e inició su propio negocio para poder ofrecerle a su familia un patrimonio y darles todo lo necesario, anteriormente trabajaba en otra ciudad en una tapicería y ahí aprendió este oficio, lo que le ayudó a comenzar su negocio hace 30 años en la localidad de Linares en Nuevo León. Primero trabajaba en el patio de su casa y poco después construyó una habitación para dedicarla solo a su tapicería. Tres de sus hijos colaboran con Rafael en el negocio y juntos lo han hecho crecer, ahora él está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de materia prima que necesitan en la elaboración de su trabajo, como telas, hilos, grapas, etc., él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte de este negocio y contribuye a su crecimiento, Rafael y su familia agradecen mucho tu generosidad.

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Faribah

texts.en:
Faribah is 35, married with four children and  she cares for four others. She has been in business for 5 years. Currently she has about 20 regular clients. Outside she washes the clothes and hangs them to dry. Then with an iron heated by a charcoal fueled stove, she irons each shirt and pant. I peaked inside and her home is filled with freshly ironed shirts from wall to wall.

With her loan she plans to buy detergent and pay school fees. She dreams of one day owning her own home.

loans.use: Faribah plans to user her loan to buy more detergent and pay school fees

loans.name: Keyttel Januaria

texts.es:
Mrs. Keyttel Januaria C. M. is 24 years old and is from the city of Bluefields. She is married to Mr. Carlos Bacon and the couple has one daughter who is 5 years old. This young entrepreneur has one year of experience in silver jewelry sales. Her clients for the most part are women between 18 and 60 years old and on occasion men between 21 and 31 make purchases because she offers specialized service and delivery. Mrs. C. needs to buy 7 units of bracelets at $27.00 per unit and 5 sets of earrings and charms at $22.00 each set to be able to augment her inventory and in this way satisfy customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Keyttel Januaria C. M. tiene 24 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, esta casada con el Sr. Carlos Bacon ambos tienen 1 hija de 5 años de edad. Esta joven emprendedora tiene 1 año de experiencia en la venta de joyas de plata sus clientes en la mayoría son mujeres de 18 a 60 años y en ocasiones le compran hombres de 21 a 31 años que la prefieren porque ofrece un servicio especializado y a domicilio. La Sra. C. necesita comprar 7 unidades de pulseras a $27.00 dólares cada unidad, 5 juegos de aretes y dijes a $ 22.00 dólares cada juego, para poder aumentar su inventario y de esa manera satisfacer su demanda .

loans.use: Bracelets and sets of earrings and charms.

loans.name: Rakhila

texts.en: Rakhila is 48 years old and is a widow with 2 children. Rakhila lives with her children in Khudat town.  She has owned her own cafe for one year.  She cooks national dishes such as dolma, plov, khingal for her clients. Now she needs a loan of $600 to further develop her business and buy new kitchen appliances. Her goal is to increase her incomes in order to meet the demands of her family.

loans.use: To buy kitchen appliances
